loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Maria Lucrecia is a single mother with three children, one of who is studying in a university and the other two of whom will soon be in school as well. She is a hard-working woman in search of the best for her children, as she wants to ensure that they have a future filled with good opportunities.

12 years ago, Lucrecia began her business in the Ivan Montenegro market with 3,000 Cordobas as her starting capital. She didn't have a place at the market and had to sell from a table and her inventory was small. Now she has her own spot in the market in good condition.

CEPRODEL has helped support Lucrecia. The help that it has given her has made it easier for her to purchase products and increase her working capital, which, in turn, allowed her to expand her business and increase her standard of living.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now and has very good credit.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Lucrecia es madre soltera con tres hijos bajo su cargo, uno de ellos es estudiante de universidad y los otros dos se encuentran en el colegio aun. Ella ha sido una mujer luchadora en busca de lo mejor para sus hijos, tratando de que ellos tengan un futuro mejor y buenas oportunidades en la vida.

Hace 12 años Lucrecia inicio su negocio en el mercado Ivan Montenegro con un capital de C$3,000 (cordobas), no tenia un local sino que vendia en una mesa al detalle y su inventario era poco. Hoy en dia su local esta bien abastecido y presta buenas condiciones.

Para Lucreacia, CEPRODEL le ha servido de apoyo y ayuda ya que le ha brindado la facilidad de comprar productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo, mejorando asi sus condiciones de vida en conjunto con su negocio que prospera a un ritmo excelente.

Ella es clienta de CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y su record es de 6 creditos con una calificacion excelente.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Tchahoua

texts.en:
Tchahoua S., a 22-year-old young lady, is single and lives with her family in Attecoube, a crowded township in the northwestern area of the capital Abidjan. S. contributes to her family's household expenses. She sells various fruit and legumes in the Attecoube open market. She is energetic and courageous.

S. joined the AE&I microloan program in 2005 when she heard about the MFI from her elder sister. S. got a loan of about $350 that has helped her increase her sales and be more independent. She will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk from the local fields.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and legumes from local fields

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johana began her business of used clothing, shoes and toy sales when her husband was left unemployed. With a lot of effort she's been able to expand her business, which is located in the Ivan Montenegro market in the city of Managua.

She began with two thousand Cordobas. Now, her store is well supplied and she has a large set of customers.

Before dedicating herself to her present business Johana stayed at home and spent her time taking care of her children. Johana has worked with CEPRODEL for 8 months and feels that it offers her very reasonable conditions.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente Johana comienza su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y juguetes usados a raiz de que su esposo queda sin trabajo. Con mcha dedicacion ha logrado hacer crecer este negocio que actualmente esta ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.

Comienza con un capita de C$2,000 (dos mil cordobas), lo cual era parte de la liquidacion de su esposo. Hoy en dia su tienda esta bien surtida, tiene una clientela amplia.

Antes de dedicarse a su negocio actual Johana era ama de casa y se dedicaba a cuidar a sus dos hijos.

Johana lleva trabajando con CEPRODEL desde hace 8 meses, tiempo en el que dice sentirse a gusto por el desembolso casi inmediato y las condiciones razonables que se le ofrece.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and improving business structure

loans.name: María Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina is a happy, enthusiastic and hard-working 45-year-old mother. She has run a business for more than twenty years out of her home distributing cleaning supplies, replacement parts and hardware. She is very good at her job and with the money she makes she has been able to help her husband Roberto with the expense of raising and educating their children, the source of so much pride and joy in their lives. Carolina dreams of expanding and hopes to rent a warehouse space from which she could more efficiently distribute the hardware she sells. She promises to repay this loan promptly within six months.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Carolina es una madre alegre, entusiasta y muy trabajadora de 45 años de edad, desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la administración y distribución de material de limpieza, repuestos de máquinas y ferretería en general desde su domicilio; trabajo que desempeña muy eficientemente y con el que ha podido apoyar a su esposo, Roberto, para solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo los estudios de sus dos queridos hijos que la llenan de orgullo y mucha satisfacción.El deseo de Carolina es alquilar un local para utilizarlo como almacén de la ferretería, desde donde podrá atender y administrar eficientemente su mercadería sin demora y sin los problemas que hasta ahora ha tenido. Para esto solicita un préstamo que utilizará para concretar su anhelo. La señora, Carolina, se compromete en retornar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses y promete ser puntual y muy responsable con el reembolso.

loans.use: To rent a space for a hardware distributorship.

loans.name: Lilian Yvonne

texts.es:
Since she began her courier service three years ago with only two employees, Liliana has run it honestly and responsibly and seen it grow into an enterprise with fifteen employees. She has recently expanded into the city of Puno as well. The business lets her meet her family expenses and it makes Liliana very proud to employ fifteen young and enthusiastic workers. At this time, Liliana wants to formalize her business and in order to do so she must obtain a business license from the Transportation and Communications Ministry. She is asking for a loan for this purpose and promises to repay it within six months. With your help Liliana can continue to employ fifteen young people.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La responsabilidad, honradez y dedicación con la que atiende a sus clientes son las que le han llevado a doña Liliana a prosperar con su empresa de mensajería (courrier), oficio que emprendió a iniciativa propia con sólo dos trabajadores; ahora después de tres años de haberse dedicado a esta labor ya cuenta con quince personas a su cargo, no sólo en la ciudad en la que radica, Juliaca, sino también en la ciudad de Puno.Este oficio le está permitiendo solventar satisfactoriamente sus gastos familiares y sobre todo se llena de orgullo y satisfacción para ofrecerles trabajo a quince jóvenes entusiastas, con grandes deseos de superación que en estos momentos siguen sus respectivos estudios superiores.El deseo de doña Liliana es obtener la licencia de funcionamiento del Ministerio de Transportes y Comunicaciones para formalizar su empresa de courrier, porque sabe que con ello puede seguir brindando trabajo a estos emprendedores jóvenes, para esto solicita un préstamo de dinero que utilizará para tramitar su licencia y promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.“Con nuestra ayuda Liliana podrá cristalizar sus sueños y seguir ofreciendo trabajo a muchos otros jóvenes”

loans.use: To obtain a business license.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus is married with four school-age children. She sells used clothing in the Ivan Montenegro market. Seven years ago Maria decided to start her business, which she founded with 5,000 Cordobas in capital that she borrowed from her husband. Before having her own business, she sold clothing but not in any specific location. She has dedicated a lot to take for her children and her efforts are to ensure they are good people and able to make a better future for themselves. By working with CEPRODEL her business has prospered (increased inventory, more customers, better infrastructure and an improved quality of life). She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has a history of 11 loans.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Maria de Jesus es una mujer casada con cuatro hijos todos de la edad escolar, quien actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado Ivan Montenegro. Desde hace 7 años Maria decicio poner su negocio y empezo con un capital de C$5,000 (cordobas) aportados por su esposo.

Antes de tener su negocio propio,vendia ropa pero sin tener un local especifico. Se ha dedicado mucho en el cuido de sus hijos y su esfuerzo es para que ellos sean personas de bien y se forjen un mejor futuro en la vida.

Gracias al trabajo de CEPRODEL su negocio ha prosperado (aumento de inventario, mayor clientela, mejora en estructura y calidad de vida). Lleva trabajando con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años con un record de 11 creditos

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Martin Trust Group

texts.en:
The Martin Trust Group is comprised of 13 women and one man. These women and man own various small businesses that sell various products in town including vegetables, rice, soap, underwear, bags, shoes, and cooked food. Some sell in front of their homes, some at the market, some at the bus station, and some “hawk”.

Members of this group have very little financial access. Sinapi uses the group lending system to allow several people to provide a guarantee on the repayment. Peer support and pressure also provide an incentive to repay. If one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount.

Christiana O., one of the group leaders, is a “hawker”. To be a hawker you must be in pretty good physical condition as you walk all day in the scorching Ghanaian sun selling products that you balance on your head. Christiana has been hawking soap products for the past 25 years.

Christiana will be using her loan to purchase more laundry and bathing soap for her business. With the profit she earns, she hopes to send her 3 youngest children to university. She has 7 children, but the 4 older ones only went to junior high due to lack of financial support. The other members of the group share the same strong work ethics as Christiana and many balance it with a family life like her.

*Photo Note- 4 of the members needed to tend to their businesses and could not make it to the meeting when the photo was taken. Christiana is at the bottom right of the photo.

loans.use: Christina, one of the group leaders, will be purchasing laundry and bathing soap for her business.

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
Bismarck is a married man with two children in school. He is not married but lives with a woman with whom he aspires to establish a family along with his children.

Before he had his own business he was employed by a merchant. When he first started his trade he didn't have a workplace and had a very small inventory. His starting capital was $150 U.S. dollars, yet nevertheless over the years he has managed to situate his business in a fixed location and establish himself there. As of today he has had his own business for three years now.

One year ago he began his relationship with CEPRODEL and it was thanks to the loan he received that he was able to pay his debts, increase his inventory and move ahead. Before starting with CEPRODEL his only help were the moneylenders that made him pay almost 100% interest on his salary. He has obtained 5 loans.

<> Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Bismarck es un hombre casado con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, el no esta casado pero vive con una señora con la que pretende establecer una familia junto con sus hijos.

Antes de iniciar el era empleado de una comerciante. Cuando inicio su negocio no tenia un local y su inventario era poco. Su capital inicial fue de US$150.00, sin embargo a medida que han transcurrido los años logro encontrar un local y se establecio en el mismo. Hoy en dia ya tiene tres años de tener su propio negocio.

Hace 1 año inicio con CEPRODEL y fue gracias al credito oprtuno brindado logro pagar lo que debia de su local e incrementar su inventario, y salir adelante ya que antes de recurrir a CEPRODEL su unica ayuda eran los prestamistas que le cobraban casi el 100% de interes sobre su saldo real. Su record es de 5 creditos.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
Amara B. is 36 years old. He lives with his cohabitant and their 2 children in Yopougon, a crowded township in the northern area of the Abidjan district. Amara is an excellent dressmaker. He has a sewing shop in Yopougon. Amara is ambitious, a hard worker, and well-organized. With income from his business, Amara takes care of his family and pays the school expenses of his children, who both attend primary school near their home.

Amara will use the loan to purchase fabric to make dresses to sell for the upcoming celebrations: Aid El Kebir, Christmas, and New Year. This is a busy period for his business.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make dresses to sell

loans.name: Emelina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Emelina has made great efforts to improve her life and to give the best to her son. She is not married but lives with her partner. Her dedication to improve her life has led her to progress with her business. Before starting her business selling milk products, she sold clothing which she realized wasn't sufficiently profitable to cover all her household expenses. At that point she decided to start her own business which she has been running for about 5 years. She didn't start off selling cheeses, but instead started selling coffee and bread until finally she started her business selling milk products. Five years later her business is profitable and she has experienced the importance and support of working with CEPRODEL; in just 1 1/2 years of working together her business has prospered. Thanks to this she has been able to make improvements in her store and her home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Emelina es una mujer que se ha esforzado por salir adelante en su vida y tratar de darle lo mejor a su hijo. Es soltera sin embargo vive con su pareja. Su dedicacion por salir adelante la llevo hasta donde esta logrando llevar hacia el progreso su negocio.

Antes de iniciar con su venta de lacteos, ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y chinelas, pero esto no era suficiente para cubrir lo gastos en su hogar. De ahi nace la idea de colocar su propio negocio el cual ya tiene de existir alrededor de 5 años. Sin embargo no comienza con la venta del queso, sino mas bien vendiendo cafe y pan, hasta despues se metio en el negocio de los lacteos.

Cinco años despues su negocio le es rentable, y ha sentido la importancia y el apoyo en cuanto al trabajo de CEPRODEL, ya que en 1½ año de trabajar en conjunto ha propsperado su negocio, y gracias a esto ha logrado realizar mejoras tanto en su local como en su hogar.

loans.use: To purchase products and raw materials

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela Marlene M. runs a small neighborhood business making and selling home-cooked foods. She specializes in items such as grilled meats, sausage and pork. Additionally, she sells baby clothing, wool hats and other clothing.

She currently lives with her partner, Hugo Villalba, in Fernando de la Mora, Paraguay. Together they have six children. The three younger children live with Estela and Hugo. Their oldest child is now independent, contributes to his parents’ monthly income and helps pay for his siblings school fees.

Estela began her store 17 years ago to help her parents earn enough money to sustain their family. Because she had to begin working at a young age, Estela was unable to continue her schooling. A few years after she began working, she took out a small loan and began selling office supplies and jewelry. Later, she starting making food to sell, which increased her income.

Her dream is that her children will be able to stay in school and obtain decent jobs when they graduate. To make this possible, Estela has applied for a loan to build her own kiosk, which will allow her increase her income by selling more food.

loans.use: For the construction of a kiosk

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Celinda is 45 years old, and lives in the Central Area of Canchachugo in the District of Usquil Provincia of Otuzco in the Department of La Libertad. Mrs. Celinda has one son in school, she herself only studied until she reached secondary school at the age of 15.

When she was seven yeras old, during her holidays in the city of Huacho, she learned from a friend of her mother's, how to weave baskets of 'junco' (a water plant which is used when dry). Since then she has dedicated herself to doing this during her holidays and with the profits of selling these covered the cost of her studies.

When she finished her studies, she traveled to Lima in order to work as a housekeeper at the same time as studying the technical aspects of nursing (?) but due to the costs she could not continue this. At this time she became pregnant with her child, she returned to her pueblo because the father of her child did not want to assume the responsiblity of being a father.

Upon her return she lived her life as best as possible in order to move forward with her son and dedicated herself to tailoring and sales of baskets of 'junco', and has done this ever since.

She formed the Communal Bank "Canchachugo" and received her first credit of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100) which she used to purchase more 'junco' to make more baskets and sell them in various cities. With the subsequent loans she created her own business and today travels to various cities in the north of the country to supply her business. With this loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy cane and paint to make her baskets.

Mrs. Celina's dream is to improve the designs of her baskets and be able to export them along with her neighbors whom she has taught has to manufacture/make the baskets.

Recently she was a prize-winning recipient of the first prize in the Contest titled "Testimonies of Life during the Fifth National Meeting of Communal Banks" organized by the Consortium of Women and the Community PROMUC, Red, which reunited 13 institutions operating Communal Banks in Peru. Neraly 200 women from all around the country participated.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celinda tiene 45 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado Menor Canchachugo del Distrito de Usquil Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Celinda tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella solo estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria. A la edad de siete años, durante sus vacaciones en la ciudad de Huacho, aprendió de una amiga de su madre, a tejer canastas de "junco" (planta acuática que se utiliza cuando está seca), desde esa época se dedicó a esta actividad durante sus vacaciones y con lo que ganaba cubría los gastos de sus estudios. Cuando terminó sus estudios viajó a la ciudad de Lima para trabajar como empleada del hogar y a la vez estudiar enfermería técnica pero por los costos no pudo hacerlo, allí conoce al padre de su hijo se embaraza, regresa a su pueblo porque este señor no quiso asumir su responsabilidad. Al retornar vio como posibilidad para salir adelante con su niño el dedicarse a la confección y venta de las canastas de junco, y hasta la fecha así lo hace. Formó el Banco Comunal “Canchachugo” y obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) con el que compró junco para confeccionar mas canastas ya que tenía pedidos de diferentes ciudades. Con los siguiente créditos ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora viaja a abastecer a diferentes ciudades del norte del país. Con el reciente préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/.800 (aproximadamente $267) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará junco y tintes para la elaboración de sus canastas. La señora celinda sueña con mejorar los diseños de sus canastas y poder exportar junto con sus vecinas a quienes les enseño a elaborarlas. Recientemente ha sido premiada como ganadora al primer puesto en el Consurso "Testimonio de Vida durante el "V Encuentro Nacional de Bancos Comunales" organizado por el Consorcio de la Mujer y la Comunidad PROMUC, Red que reune a 13 instituciones que operan Bancos Comunales en el Perú. Participaron cerca de 200 mujeres provenientes de diversas partes del país.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Silvestre Juan

texts.es:
Silvestre comes from a large and humble family who, due to their low economic resources, found himself needing to abandon his higher studies to dedicate himself to artistic vocation and craftsmanship. Now with his family established, he devotes himself to creating incomparably beautiful works of clay. The wish of this exemplary father and unbeatable son is to increase the quantity and variety of his merchandise in order to ultimately expand his production and market presence to exportation. He hopes to obtain the economic benefits to offer a higher quality of life to his beloved family. To achieve his objectives, this hard-working family man is requesting a loan, promising to repay your important help in a span of eight months. Let’s work together toward this noble goal so that Silvestre can develop his work with talent and love.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Silvestre proviene de una numerosa y humilde familia, quién debido a los bajos recursos económicos que tenía su familia se vió en la necesidad de abandonar sus estudios superiores para dedicarse a la labor artesanal por su especial vocación artística.Ahora con su familia ya establecida se dedica a la elaboración de hermosos e incomparables trabajos hechos de arcilla. El deseo de este ejemplar padre e insuperable hijo es aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería, con el fin de expandir su producción aún más en el mercado hasta lograr su exportación y obtener mayor beneficio económico para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida familia.Para cumplir con sus objetivos este trabajador padre de familia solicita un préstamo con el compromiso de retornar vuestra importante ayuda en un lapso de ocho meses. “ Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Silvestre siga desarrollando su labor con mucho talento y amor".

loans.use: Increase quantity and variety of his products

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Ever since they started their family thirty-five years ago, Fermina and her husband, Carlos, have dedicated themselves to making ceramic objects, a job they fulfill with skill, and responsibility. Thanks to this work, they meet their family expenses and the higher education tuition of their seven dear children. Both begin their daily work at 7:00am and work until 5:00 in the afternoon, working on their creative, novel and high-quality goods that are later sold wholesale throughout Lima to be prized and valued in the markets. Now, in spite of their advancing ages, they still wish to expand their business to export their goods throughout the world. To solidify their dreams, they remain diligently absorbed in their work and also turn to your generous support to request a loan. They promise to repay in eight months. Let’s give this adorable couple the opportunity to make their anxious dreams concrete. Your support will be a wise investment in their hands.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que formaron su familia hace más de 35 años Fermina y su esposo , Carlos se dedicaron a la fabricación de objetos cerámicos, trabajo que desempeñan con mucha destreza y responsabilidad solventando con satisfacción gracias a este oficio sus gastos familiares y los estudios superiores de sus siete queridos hijos.Ambos inician su labor diaria a las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, elaborando trabajos creativos, novedosos y de excelente calidad, que luego son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima y que son muy cotizados y valorados en el mercado.Ahora, pese a la avanzada edad de cada uno, aún están deseosos de seguir expandiendo su mercadería hasta lograr exportar al mundo entero sus hermosos trabajos. Para concretar sus sueños ambos se desenvuelven diligentemente en esta noble labor y al mismo tiempo recurre a tu ayuda generosa y solicita un préstamo y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses.“Démosle la oportunidad de concretar sus ansiados sueños a esta adorable pareja, tu aporte será una inversión sabia en sus manos”

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials such as clay, firewood, and paint

loans.name: Epifania Rosa

texts.es:
Ever since she was very small, Epifanía has taken interest and initiative in learning the beautiful work of artisanship. After she started her family with Pedro, her faithful partner, she decided to wholly devote herself to this fine art, always dreaming of exporting her goods abroad. Little by little, they managed to become one of the best ceramicist families in their home city of Pukará. But as fate would have it, with tranquility and family togetherness reigning in the home, Pedro lost his life, causing terrible pain and emptiness in Epifanía’s family. Ever since then, this brave mother has taken sole charge of her two adolescent children. With the support of her older son, Oscar, she keeps working diligently to solidify her dreams of exportation, conquering the world market with her beautiful and valued works. To make her dreams a reality, Epifanía is requesting a loan that she promises to repay in eight months. In your hands is the ability to bring her the support she needs to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Epifanía desde muy pequeña siempre sintió una gran inquietud e iniciativa por aprender el hermoso trabajo de la artesanía. Una vez formada su familia , junto a Pedro, su fiel compañero, decidieron dedicarse de lleno a este bello arte siempre con el anhelo de exportar su mercadería al exterior.Así poco a poco lograron convertirse en una de las mejores familias ceramistas de su ciudad natal, Pukará; pero por cuestiones del destino cuando en su humilde hogar se vivía un ambiente de tranquilidad y unión familiar, Pedro, perdió la vida, causando un gran dolor y vació en la familia de Epifanía, desde entonces esta valerosa madre se hizo cargo sola de sus dos hijos adolescentes.Ahora, con apoyo de Oscar su hijo mayor, sigue trabajando arduamente para concretar sus sueños de exportación y así conquistar el mercado mundial con sus hermosos y valorados trabajos. Para hacer realidad sus deseos Epifanía solicitan un préstamo que promete rembolsar en un lapso de ocho meses.“En vuestras manos está brindarle el apoyo necesario para que pueda cristalizar pronto sus anhelos”

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials to start up exportation of her fine goods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 62 years old and lives in the district of Mache, Province of Otuzco in the region of La Libertad. She has seven children but all are grown and no longer depend on her. Rosa has only a first-graD. education. Prior to receiving her first loan she dedicated herself to her home and to helping her husband in the fields.

Upon discovering through the authorities that the organization Manuela Ramos was giving loans to women in the area, Rosa got together with other neighborhood women to form the Communal Bank “Women of Work.” With her first loan of S/.300.00 (approximately $100) she purchased cuajada (a type of fresh, dry curd cheese) and sold it in the city of Trujillo, thus beginning her business. Later with her other credit she bought animals such as pigs, sheep and cows in order to fatten them and sell them in the market of Julcán. Currently Rosa continues with various activities: She has a small store in Mache in which she sells bread, crackers, soft-drinks, candles, etc. In addition, she continues sending fresh cheese to Trujillo every Saturday, so that her daughter can distribute it. Some of this fresh cheese Rosa makes herself with the milk that her livestock produce, and she also buys and sells cattle, sheep, and pigs.

With the recent credit from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (approximately $333) which will be repaid in 4 installments, Rosa will buy 2 calves in order to fatten them and then sell them. Rosa dreams of stocking her store and above all of having various clients so that she can work without leaving home and not have to walk out to the fields or to Julcán to care for and sell livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 62 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Mache Provincia D. Otuzco del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene siete hijos pero todos mayores D. edad que ya no dependen D. ella. La señora Rosa estudió solo hasta primer grado D. primaria. Antes D. recibir su primer crédito solo se dedicaba a su casa y a ayudar a su esposo en la chacra.

Al enterarse por las autoridades D. que Manuela Ramos estaba dando prestamos a mujeres D. la zona se junta con otras vecinas y forma el Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. trabajo”. Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) compró cuajada (quesillo) y llevó a vender en la ciudad D. Trujillo iniciando así su negocio; posteriormente con sus otros créditos compró animales como cerdos, ovejas y vacas para engordarlas y venderlas vivas en el mercado D. Julcán. Actualmente la señora Rosa desarrolla varias actividades: Tiene una pequeña tienda en Mache en la que venD. pan, galletas, gaseosas, velas, etc., además sigue enviando a Trujillo, todos los sábados, cuajada para que su hija las distribuya, parte D. esta cuajada la elabora con la leche que produce su ganado y además compra y venD. ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino.

Con el reciente crédito recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,000 (aproximadamente $333) que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 terneras para engordarlas y luego venderlas. La señora Rosa sueña con surtir su tienda y sobre todo con tener varios clientes para que así trabaje sin salir D. casa y deje D. caminar con el ganado hasta la chacra o hasta Julcán donD. lo venD..

loans.use: The purchase of animals (livestock)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel owns a shoe sales business in the Ivan Montenegro Market. She has been able to do this with the help of her husband and their two children, who are students at the elementary level.

Mabel started her business about 22 years ago after seeing the need to obtain daily means to support her family. After starting her family, her interests were centered around her children's education, being that her husband's salary did not cover all their necessities.

Today, she has been able to excel thanks to the support that CEPRODEL has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

Mabel es propietaria de un negocio de venta de zapatos en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro. Asi mismo con su esposo a conformado un hogar con dos hijos, mismos que son estudiantes en edad escolar.

Mabel inicia hace alrededor de 22 años su negocio a partir de la necesidad de buscar una ayuda al sustento diario de su hogar. Luego al formar una familia sus interese se basaron en la educacion de sus hijos, ya que el salario del esposo no cubria todas las necesidades.

Hoy en dia su negocio ha crecido gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Vidal Freddy

texts.es:
Family problems and tough economic times that Fredy has gone through postponed his dreams of finishing law school. He found himself needing to leave his studies and apply himself to working hard to support his beloved family and the expenses of their humble home, but still hopes to return and finish his university career. At this time, he dedicates himself to buying and selling second-hand sewing machines. He also teaches sewing lessons in his sales center to everyone who wants to learn this fine art. Thanks to this, he has been able to provide for the basic needs of his mother and brothers. Fredy’s desire is to purchase more machines, and to save enough with the proceeds that he earns to invest later on in a stable and secure business. In this way, he will be able to dedicate himself to finishing his dream. For his wish, he hopes to obtain a monetary loan and is committed to returning it in eight months. Your important help will help this responsible young man reach the goal that he put off years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sus problemas familiares y los malos momentos económicos por los que atravesaba retrazaron los sueños de concluir sus estudios superiores de Derecho a Fredy, motivo por el cual se vió en la necesidad de dejar sus estudios y ponerse a trabajar arduamente para apoyar a su querida familia con los gastos que generaba su humilde hogar, sin perder las esperanzas de retomar y concluir su carrera universitaria.En estos momentos se dedica a la compra y venta de máquinas de tejer de segundo uso, también brinda clases de tejido a máquina en un pequeño espacio de su centro de ventas a todas aquellas personas que deseen aprender este bello arte; gracias a ello puede aliviar las necesidades primarias de su madre y hermanos.El deseo de Fredy es comprar más máquinas y con los beneficios económicos que obtenga ahorrar lo suficiente para invertir más adelante en un negocio estable y seguro, de tal manera que le permita retomar y dedicarle mayor tiempo a la conclusión de su sueño. Para esto anhela obtener un préstamo de dinero con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de ocho meses.Tu importante ayuda servirá para que este responsable joven pueda alcanzar la meta que se había trazado años atrás.

loans.use: Purchase more sewing machines to establish his sales business

loans.name: Zoila Belinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila is 44 years old and lives in Puerto Malabrigo in the District of Rázuri in the Province of Ascope in the Department of La Libertad. She studied in secondary school until the age of 15. Mrs. Zoila has five children, four of whom are young and depend on her.

She became a widow a few years ago and lives alone with her children, at this time she was given S/. 150.00 from her brother and used this to purchase artificial flowers and ceramic flowers to sell as a traveling salesperson in her community. She uses her profits to nourish her children.

She found out that Manuela Ramos was providing loans to women in her community she decided to form her own group called "Malabrigo" and with the first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100) she purchased decorations, plus toys/stuffed animals, and kitchen utensils which she sold door to door. Additionally. Ms. Zoila also sells food: ceviche, cotton candy, rice with milk (arroz con leche) and others.

With these profits she is saving, plus the last loan she received from Manueal Ramos of S/. 500 (approximately $167) which will be repaid in 4 months, she travelled to Lima to purchase deocrations, toys and clothes at more afforadable procies and in this way she can have more products.

Mrs. Zoila's dream is to set up a 'bazar' or type of shop in her house and to provide an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoila tiene 44 años de edad y vive en el Puerto Malabrigo en el Distrito de Rázuri de la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria. La señora Zoila tiene cinco hijos, cuatro menores de edad que dependen de ella. Hace algunos años enviudó y quedó sola con sus hijos, en ese momento recibió una propina de S/. 150.00 de su hermano y con ese dinero compró flores artificiales y floreros de cerámica para vender como ambulante en su comunidad, con lo que ganaba alimentaba a sus hijos. Al enterarse que Manuela Ramos estaba atendiendo con préstamos a mujeres de su comunidad decide formar su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Malabrigo” y con el primer préstamo que recibe de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) compra adornos, peluches y utensilios de cocina para luego vender de puerta en puerta. Adicionalmente la señora Zoila también vende comida: cebiche, papa a la huancaína, arroz con leche y otros. Con las ganancias que fue guardando, más el último préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500 (aproximadamente $167) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, viajó a Lima para comprar adornos, juguetes y ropa a precios más cómodos y así pueda tener mayores utilidades. La señora Zoila sueña con implementar un bazar en su casa y con darle educación superior a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase decorations, toys and clothing

loans.name: Santos Violeta

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Violeta is 35 years old, and lives in the Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa of the District of Mache in the Province of Otuzco in the Department of La Libertad. Mrs. Santos has tow children of schooling age, she herself only went to primary school.

She began her business when she was married and lacking money, she sold cereals in small quantities. Given the necessity of expanding her products to match the great demand, her sister introduced her to the Communal Bank "Women who Work" who she herself was a member of. She received her first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100) which she used to purchase greater quantities of cereals and began to realize greater sales in the city of Trujilo. Little by little her business grew, today she purchaes agricultural products throughout the local area as well as from the province of Julcan and she sells them weekly in the city of Trujillo to major merchants.

With the recent loan awared her of S/. 2,000.00 (approximately $667) which she will repay in two months, she will purchase vegetable medleys which are currently being harvested and are thus at a good price.

Mrs. Santos is the reelected president of the Comedor Popular 'Ana Harvis' of the area, comprised of 50 community members. She also received support from institutions which provides training for its members. Currently they are receiving training in breeding rabbits. Mrs. Santos is hoping to realize her dreaming of owning her own home/residence.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos Violeta tiene 35 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa del Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Santos tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella estudió sólo primaria. Empezó su negocio al casarse pero por falta de capital, vendía los cereales en pequeñas cantidades; al ver su necesidad de incrementar sus productos debido a la gran demanda, su hermana mayor la integra al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” del que también es socia; recibió su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) con este dinero compró cereales en mayor cantidad y empezó a realizar su venta al por mayor en la ciudad de Trujillo. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo, ahora compra a agricultores de toda la zona y también de la provincia de Julcán y vende sus productos semanalmente en la ciudad de Trujillo a comerciantes mayoristas. Con el reciente préstamo obtenido de S/. 2,000.00 (aproximadamente $667) el cual será pagado en 2 meses, comprará menestras ya que es temporada de cosecha y están a buen precio. La señora Santos es presidenta reelecta del Comedor Popular “Ana Harvis” de Piscopampa el que beneficia a 50 pobladores de su comunidad, además ella busca apoyo de instituciones para que capaciten a sus asociadas, actualmente están recibiendo capacitación en crianza de conejos. La Señora Santos sueña con tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable medleys in great quantities

loans.name: Anghela Paola

texts.es:
Anghela is a happy and very enterprising young woman that lives with her dear aunt Leticia. Because of her delicious and unbeatable snacks, cakes and pies that she makes with utmost cleanliness and patience, she is very well known and requested in the city. She has a lot of orders, which is why she decided to take on this role without neglecting her studies at the prestigious institute in the city. Anghela and her brave aunt’s wish is to open a snack shop in a strategic location in their city, Juliaca. To make their dreams a reality, they are aware they will have to save and work hard. They are pleased because they know that the public’s welcome will be reflected in the new services they want to offer. At this time they are requesting a loan to invest in purchase of raw ingredients for the creation of their delicious cakes. They’ll also invest in quickly renovating the small sales stall they want to install to keep up with the high demand and satisfaction of their clients. Your collaboration will make their yearnings rapidly become realities.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Anghela es una joven alegre y muy emprendedora, vive junto a su querida tía Leticia, quién por sus deliciosos e insuperables bocaditos, pasteles y tortas que elabora con mucha paciencia e higiene es muy conocida y solicitada en su ciudad; es por esa razón tiene gran cantidad de pedidos y es por esta razón que ella decidió asociarse a este oficio sin descuidar sus estudios en un prestigioso instituto de su ciudad.El deseo de Anghela y su valerosa tía es abrir un snack en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad donde radican, Juliaca, para hacer realidad sus sueños, ambas son consientes que tienen ahorrar y esforzarse mucho y están muy contentas porque saben que la gran acogida del público se verá reflejada en el nuevo servicio que juntas desean ofrecer..En este momento solicitan un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus deliciosos pasteles y también para el acondicionamiento del pequeño espacio de ventas que desean instalar en poco tiempo para cumplir con la gran demanda y satisfacción de sus queridos clientes.“Tu colaboración hará que sus anhelos puedan hacerse realidad en poco tiempo

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making snacks and renovation of a sales stall

loans.name: Primo William

texts.es:
Primo William is a dedicated businessman, father and grandfather who provides for 4 children and 2 grandchildren. Since he opened his barbershop 28 years ago, Primo William has worked hard to make it succeed. For the last three years he has benefited from CEPRODEL and has maintained good credit.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Primo William es un hombre dedicado a su negocio y a su familia. Su hogar esta conformado por 4 hijos y 2 nietos. A Primo William siempre lo ha caracterizado el ser un hombre esforzado y luchador quein ha dedicado casi toada su vida a sacar adelante su negocio.

Decidio poner su negocio hace mas de 28 años, el cual a la fecha ha crecido. CEPRODEL ha sido el brzao derecho de Primo William desde hace tres años, su record crediticio es excelente y él esta satisfecho con el servicio que CEPRODEL le ha brindado.

loans.use: To stock a barber shop.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Twenty-eight year old Nelly is an enterprising and enthusiastic mother of a seven-year-old-girl. She has big dreams of improving herself; ever since was very young, she always helped her dear parents in their carpentry shop creating a wide variety of items, particularly elegant furniture for home and office. Now that she has started a family with Fredy, she's decided to devote herself entirely to this work. Thanks to her ingenuity and diligence, her business is succeeding, enabling her to cover the basic needs of her home and finance her higher education. She is avidly studying accounting at the local university, always desirous of improving herself and her family. Nelly’s wish is to purchase more raw materials (wood) to produce the articles that she is entrusted with everyday. For this, she is turning to your generous heart and requesting this highly beneficial loan, promising to repay it within eight months. Your help is very important to Nelly and her beloved family; let’s make her request possible.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly de 28 años de edad es madre de una niña de siete años, muy emprendedora y entusiasta, con grandes deseos de superación en la vida, desde muy pequeñita siempre apoyó a sus queridos padres en su taller de carpintería en el que elaboraban gran variedad de artículos y sobre todo elegantes muebles para los hogares y oficinas..Ahora y una vez formada su familia junto a Fredy, decidió dedicarse por completo a esta labor, gracias a su ingenio y diligencia está teniendo éxito, permitiéndole cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y solventar sus estudios superiores de contabilidad que muy ávidamente sigue por las noches en una universidad particular, siempre con el afán de superarse y con ella su familia.El deseo de Nelly es comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima (madera) para la producción de los artículos que diariamente le encomiendan fabricar . Para esto recurre a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo que le será muy beneficioso y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses.Vuestra ayuda es muy importante para Nelly y su querida familia, Posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to create beautiful home and office furniture

loans.name: Norma Concepcion

texts.es:
This business is located in the Ivan Montenegro Market. The business began humbly with a small basket with few spices and later she began including the sale of other products which helped the business grow. The business has been in existence for more than two years. Norma continues fighting to give her two children a good education.

Her perseverence and strength has allowed her to have her own home. Her husband works and he is who helps with the expenses of the home. She has been an excellent CEPRODEL client for over a year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise.

Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro. El negocio inicia humilde con un pequeño canasto con pocas especies, más tarde ella fue incluyendo la venta de otros productos y poco a poco fue creciendo El negocio tiene más de 2 años de existir. Ella continúa esforzándose por dar educación a sus hijos los cuales son dos, uno de ellos cursa su educación secundaria.

El esfuerzo realizado le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda. Su esposo trabaja es quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ha sido un excelente cliente de CEPRODEL, por más de 1½ años.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
About 60 kilometeters from the city of Juliaca, there is a small village of Pukara, a place maD. famoous by their beautiful works in ceramic maD. by the industrious villagers. Florencia is no stranger to this fine art, her whole family is well known for their excellence in their crafts (coin banks and decorations), always having large numbers of orders. She starts work tirelessly every day of the week from 5:30 a.m. to 11p.m., always with the unconditional support of her husband, Faustino, who also works as a teacher in the school in Pukara. They both struggle and work hard with one goal in mind, to proviD. their two dear children with higher education, who have followed their parents' example and who are a constant source of priD. and satisfaction. For now Florencia's wish is acquire more raw material (clay, gypsum, paint and lumber), to continue working in their beautiful work, and to fill the great number of orders that are placed. 'This noble mother hopes to have our support to continue on with her daily work, done with great talent and great love.'

A unos 60 Kilómetros D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, se encuentra el pueblito D. Pukará, lugar muy famoso por los hermosos trabajos D. cerámica que realizan sus laboriosos pobladores, doña Florencia no es ajena a este bello arte, toda su familia es muy conocida por los excelentes trabajos en cerámica (alcancías y adornos decorativos) y finos acabados que realizan, obteniendo gran cantidad D. pedidos; ella empieza a trabajar incansablemente, durante todos los días D. la semana, a partir D. las 5.30 D. la mañana hasta 11:00 D. la noche, siempre con el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo, Faustino, quién también se desempeña como profesor en la escuelita D. Pukará.Ambos se esfuerzan y trabajan arduamente con un solo objetivo, ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus dos queridos hijos, quienes por el buen ejemplo que inculcaron en ellos los vienen llenando D. satisfacción y orgullo.Por ahora el deseo D. Florencia es adquirir más materia prima (arcilla, yeso, pintura y leña), para seguir desempeñándose en su bella labor y así cumplir satisfactoriamente con la gran cantidad D. pedidos que tiene. “Esta noble madre espera nuestra colaboración para seguir desarrollando su labor diaria con mucho talento y amor”

Translated from Spansih by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (clay, gypsum, paints, and lumber)  to expant the business and begin the export of their product.

loans.name: Eusebia Gertrudis

texts.es:
The dream of these proud parents, Eusebia and Luis, is to provide the best for their nine children, which have been the inspiration for their great and professional work in the production of sculptures and ceramics. The have dedicated more than 32 years into their business, creating beautiful, elegant, and incomparable work for export. Thanks to their daily struggles in their work they have been able to efficiently meet the necessities of their home, with the goal of improvement they hope to export a larger quantity and variety of their products. To make their dream a reality they are now applying for a loan that will be of greatly help them to achieve their goals, which they plan on repaying in a term of 8 months, promising to be punctual and responsible. Let's help this hard working family so that they can continue their efforts and struggles to triumph in life with their insurmountable and incomparable form of art.

Los deseos de estos afanosos padres, Eusebia y Luís, por brindarles lo mejor a sus nueve hijos, son los que los han llevado a esforzarse mucho con sumo profesionalismo en su labor de escultura y cerámica; oficio al que se dedican hace más de 32 años, realizando hermosos, elegantes e incomparables trabajos de exportación.Gracias al desempeño diario de sus labores han podido satisfacer eficientemente las necesidades de su hogar y en su afán de superación desean exportar en mayor cantidad y diversidad su mercadería. Para concretar sus deseos ellos solicitan un préstamo que les será muy beneficioso en el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, ambos se comprometen a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses, prometen ser puntuales y muy responsables.Colaboremos con esta emprendedora familia para que sigan esforzándose y luchando por triunfar en la vida con su insuperable e incomparable arte.

Translated from Spansih by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase in capital to begin the exportation of their beautiful pieces of art.

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
Luzgarda 28 years old and her dear mother Flora, decided to rent and set up a small craft store where they sell clay and gypsum objects. The strategic location of their charming store is very attractive to turists. Luzgarda and her mother's dream is to expand and further increase the selection of their merchandise, with the goal of bringing a better and more complete services to their clientele. To make their dream a reality they look to you for your support in applying for a loan that will be invested in the expansion and increase in their stock of valuable items, and in this manner slowly improve their family's economic status and above all support her two younger brothers in their professional training. Let's help this family so that they may continue to foster the strong will of excellence in their hearts.

Luzgarda de 28 años de edad y su querida madre Flora, decidieron alquilar un local y abrir una pequeña tiendita de artesanías en el que ofrecen variedad de productos en arcilla y yeso, por el lugar estratégico en que está ubicado su acogedora tiendita es muy concurrida y visitada por los turistas.El deseo de Luzgarda y su madre es ampliar y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, con el afán de brindar un mejor y completo servicio a sus visitantes; para concretar sus deseos en esta oportunidad recurre a tu apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo que invertirá en ampliar y aumentar el stock de su valiosa mercadería y así poco a poco buscar mejorar su situación económica familiar y sobre todo apoyar a sus dos hermanos menores en su formación profesional.Ayudemos a esta familia a que sigan atesorando en sus corazones muchas ganas de superación.

Translated from Spansih by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase their valuable pieces for sale in their small souvenir shop.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
After trying their luck in various other venues, Isabel aged 40 years, single mother of two teenagers, finally decided to conentrate on selling beef and lamb meats, a product that she sells in the Sunday market of her home town of Juliaca. Isabel buys and sells meats from 7a.m. to 12 Noon and in the afternoons she sells postcards in the airport of her home town, a business that generates more income for the support of her familyl. Thanks to these tasks she is providing education to her beloved children and later on she hopes to put them through post-secondary education for their own benefit. Her dream is to earn more income to keep on managing her businesses that have brought her much success, and for this she is applying for a loan that she will invest completely in her meat sales business. With the loan money she will be able to expand her business and improve that much more the standard of living for her beloved children.

Después de tentar suerte con muchas otras actividades, Isabel de cuarenta años de edad, madre separada de dos hijos adolescentes, finalmente decidió dedicarse a la comercialización de carne de res y cordero, producto que ofrece en forma ambulatoria en el mercado dominical de su ciudad natal , Juliaca.Isabel se dedica a la compra y venta de carne desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 del mediodía y por las tardes ofrece tarjetas postales en el aeropuerto de su ciudad, negocio que le genera ingresos económicos adicionales para el sustento de su familia. Gracias a estos oficios está brindándoles educación a sus queridos hijos y más adelante anhela ofrecerles estudios superiores para su superación..Su deseo es obtener más capital para seguir dedicándose a estos oficios que le vienen trayendo mucha satisfacción, para esto requiere un préstamo que invertirá por completo en su negocio de comercialización de carne. Con el dinero que obtenga luego de su inversión podrá acrecentar aún más el nivel de vida de sus queridos hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire greater quantities of products to offer and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
David and Vilma, a hard working married couple, have great dreams to proviD. the best to their three small children. David is a master construction worker, very well known and sought-after and respected by his work community for the excellent and professional work that he provides, with Vilma his wife by his siD. and his four laborers. They do their work every day from 8 a.m. until 6p.m. every night, with the only goal of saving enough money to purchase a small piece of land where they can build a house and therefore offer their beloved children a propper and safe life. The dream of this hard working couple is to purchase a roofing machine, equipment that will facilitate and help David in his work. For this they already have a small amount of money saved but it's still not enought to purchase the equipment they need; for this reason they are applying for a loan that they plan on repaying within a 6-month term. "Let's support the drive and efforts of this young couple to prosper in their life".

David y Vilma, pareja D. esposos muy trabajadores, con grandes deseos D. brindarles lo mejor a sus tres menores hijos, David es maestro D. obras, muy solicitado, conocido y respetado dentro D. su entorno laboral por los excelentes y finos trabajos que realiza, siempre acompañado D. su fiel esposa Vilma y D. sus cuatro trabajadores. Ellos desempeñan su labor diaria desD. las 8:00 D. la mañana hasta las 6:00 D. la tarD., con el único objetivo D. ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir un terrenito y construir su casita y así ofrecerles a sus queridos hijos una morada propia y segura.El deseo D. esta emprendedora pareja es comprar una máquina D. techo, herramienta que le facilitará y agilizará el trabajo a David, para esto ya tienen ahorrado un dinerito pero aún no es suficiente para adquirir su tan deseada herramienta; es por esa razón que solicitan un préstamo y se comprometen en reembolsarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. “Apoyemos el ímpetu y esfuerzo D. esta joven pareja por prosperar en la vida”.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Loan is required to acquire new construction equipment that will facilitate the work and increase the work load.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is hard-working and successful woman who 22 years ago, while she was raising two school-aged children, decided to open a grocery store. She had previously helped her mother at a market stand. She has been quite successful, yet she sees ways to improve the business. Ana Maria has benefited from CEPRODEL loans for the last two and a half years, using the credit to improve the shop and stock it adequately.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hace 22 años Ana Maria Jefa de Familia, comienza su negocio con la vision de ir creciendo poco a poco y con el objetivo de dar sustento a su familia conformada por dos hijos estudiantes colegiales. Ha sido una mujer luchadora y a la vez triunfadora porque hasta el momento ha logrado su proposito.

Sin embargo a la fecha el local aun no presta las condiciones al 100%, sin embargo poco a poco Ana Maria lo ha ido acondicionando. Anterior a su negocio propio trabajaba junto a su mama en el mercado.

CEPRODEL ha jugado un papel muy importante desde hace aproximadamente 2½ años, ya que los creditos que le han sido otorgados le han ayudado a la mejora de su local y a la retroalimentacion de su inventario.

loans.use: To stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
Since she was very young, Erika aged 33 years and her dear sister Angela, always dreamed of opening a beauty salon where they can offer quality service to their clients; finally no after much effort and much sacrifice they managed to rent and establish a small shop in the very busy commercial core of their city Juliaca. Thanks to their habilities and capabilities as cosmetologists they have earned significant clientele that has brought their beauty shop much acclaim. Erika's wish, as a working mother of a 9-month old baby, is to expand her beauty salon called "Enredos" and this way make the salon the most successful in their city, for this she wishes to obtain a loan to invest in the purchase of hair dryers, hair dyes, etc. And this way offer their demanding clientele quality service with ease, to provide her adorable baby a better quality of life. Let's support her to keep up the success in her trade as a cosmetologist.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy jovencita, Erika de 33 años de edad y su querida hermana Ángela, siempre anhelaron abrir su centro de belleza y ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes; finalmente ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudieron alquilar e implementar un pequeño local en un centro comercial muy concurrido de la ciudad en la que radican, Juliaca. Gracias a sus habilidades y capacidades como cosmetólogas fueron acopiando una gran cantidad de clientes que aportan a su centro de belleza muchas satisfacciones.El deseo de Erika, madre emprendedora de un bebé de 9 meses es implementar y ampliar su salón de belleza denominado “Enredos” y hacer de este local el más visitado y concurrido de su ciudad, para esto desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de secadoras de cabello, tintes para cabello, etc. Y así ofrecer a sus exigentes clientes un servicio de calidad con suma comodidad, para brindar a s adorable bebé una mejor calidad de vida.Apoyémosla a seguir prosperando con su digna labor de cosmetóloga.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryers, hair dyes and other articles to increase the clientele for this salon.

loans.name: Ludwin Osay

texts.es:
Ludwin Osay B. J. is 47 years old. He is originally from this town, from Bluefield. He is married and has 5 children, all of whom are either in high school or college. Mister B. is from the creole ethnic group. He's been working in a collective transportation business for four years. This micro-businessman from the coast has monthly contracts to transport 60 students from Monday to Friday of every week from their home to school and back.

However, Ludwin's bus needs a series of replacements and engine maintenance so that he can continue to give this service for a few more years. He wants his bus to be more presentable and comfortable. He needs to purchase two pairs of tires at US $128 each pair, two pairs of retainers at US $12 each pair, two break pads for US $15 each, a set of rear frictions for US $48, and air filter for US $14, a fan clutett for US $80, a water band for $60 and engine maintenance for US $75.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ludwin Osay B. J. tiene 47 años de edad, es originario de esta ciudad de Bluefields, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales estudian en secundaria y la universidad. El señor B. es de la etnia creole y se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte colectivo (bus) brindando el servicio a estudiantes de dos colegios de secundaria de esta ciudad. Este microempresario costeño tiene contratos mensual de trasladar a 60 estudiantes de Lunes a Viernes de cada semana de su casa al colegio y viceversa. Sin embargo su unidad de servicio (bus) necesita cambiarle una serie de repuestos que el señor Ludwin no tiene en su poder asi como el mantenimiento del motor para que pueda brindar este servicio por unos años mas y poder tener su bus mas presentable y confortable. Necesita comprar 2 pares de llantas a US$ 128 cada par, 2 pares de retenedores a US$ 12 dolares cada par, 2 bombillos de frenos a US$ 15 cada uno, un juego de fricciones traseras a US$ 48 el juego, un filtro de aire a US$ 14 dolares el filtro, un fan clutett en abanico a US$ 80 el fan, una banda de agua a US$ 60 la banda y el mantenimiento al motor con un costo de US 75.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts for his Owerhoul school bus.

payments.comment: Esta pagando las cuotas 3 y 4 correspondientes a los meses de Febrero y Marzo 2,008.

loans.name: Adelina Guillermina

texts.es:
Adelina, an entrepreneurial mother, 42 years old, abandoned by the father of her daughter, decided to go into artscrafts ( weaving jerseys, "chompas") and at this time of year she also makes crafts with Cristmas motifs, her only objective being that of increasing the life quality of herself and her dear daughter Lizbeth who is her major joy and pride, giving her a reason to make an effort and work tirelessly day by day. Adelina's wish is to purchase material for the manufacture of her beautiful Cristmas ornaments which are made with skill and capacity, and with the sale obtain substantial economic earnings. Therefore she is asking for a loan to be invested completely in the purchase of raw material for the manufacture of these objects and she promises to repay the loan in a period of six months. Let us support this mother who works arduously with talent and effort to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Adelina, emprendedora madre de 42 años de edad, desde que el papá de su hija la abandonó decidió dedicarse a la artesanía (tejido de chompas) y por estas épocas también realiza trabajos de manualidades con motivos navideños; siempre con un solo objetivo incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su querida hija Lizbeth, quién es su mayor alegría y orgullo es por esta razón por la que se esfuerza y trabaja incansablemente día a día.El deseo de Adelina es comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus hermosos adornos navideños que realiza con suma destreza y capacidad y con la venta de estos obtener buenos ingresos económicos.Para esto solicita un préstamo que invertirá completamente en adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de estos artículos y promete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses. Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the manufacture of Chrismas ornaments.

loans.name: Gabina Yeni

texts.es:
Gabina is the youngest daughter of Cristina and Helar and when she finished her middle school she decided to search for a brighter future in the town of Cuzco where she had a safe and profitable stand selling artscrafts, but because of her father's health problems, Helar is 52 years of age, she had to return to Pukará, her native village, to take care and keep watch of her dear father and since then, with much effort and sacrifice, she has rented a small space where she offers her artcrafts with a lot of enthusiasm and diligence. Her wish is to enlarge and adapt the space and therefore she requires a loan that will allow her to carry out her wish and obtain higher economic benefits to support her mother with the expenses at home and above all to purchase the medicine that will help her dear father recover. She is hoping to receive the disinterested help from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Gabina es hija menor de Cristina y Helar, cuando concluyó sus estudios secundarios decidió ir en busca de un mejor porvenir a la ciudad de Cuzco, lugar donde tenía un puesto seguro y rentable de ventas de artesanías en general; pero por problemas de salud de su padre, Helar de 52 años de edad, tuvo que retornar a su pueblo natal Pukará con el fin de cuidar y velar por la salud y bienestar de su querido progenitor; desde entonces a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha alquilado un pequeño local donde ofrece sus productos artesanales con mucho entusiasmo y diligencia.Su deseo es ampliar e implementar mucho más su local y para esto requiere un préstamo que le permitirá concretar sus deseos y obtener mayores beneficios económicos para apoyar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo adquirir los medicamentos que le ayudará a recuperar la salud a su querido padre. Ella espera por la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Enlargement and adaption of sales space to increase earnings to help her father recover from disease.

loans.name: Gladys Ramona

texts.es:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman who started her plantain business after having dedicated herself to the transportation business, which did not generate enough income since the maintenance of buses has a high cost.

She began her business approximately eight years ago with C$8,000 (Cordobas) in capital, renting a module in a major open-air market with only mesh enclosures. This business has provided sustenance for her family along with the work of Gladys’s husband.

Today Gladys has succeeded in increasing her sales through the credit lent to her through her sponsor, Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora que coloco su negocio de platanos despues de haberse dedicado al negocio del transporte, el cual no e generaba frutos ya que el mantenimiento de los buses tiene un alto costo.

Inicia su negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años con un capital de C$8,000 (cordobas) alquilando un modulo en el mercado mayoreo el cual estaba al aire libre solocercado con malla. Este negocio ha sido el sustento de su familia en conjunto con su esposo.

Hoy en dia Gladys ha logrado incrementar sus ventas a traves del credito brindado por CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Purchase products to stock the business

loans.name: Melecia Bernardina

texts.es:
Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows on pasture land, doña Bernardina is carrying out her daily work herding the grazing cattle that belongs to an educational center in the district of Pukará. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last five years and her dear husband. Timoteo, works as cleaning staff at the same center. Both work very hard to support and offer an adecuate education to their eight underage children as they wish to give each of them the opportunity of superior studies. Bernardina wishes to by a calf for breeding and reproduction of her own cattle and therefore she is asking for a loan which will be repaid in a period of eight months. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true seeing her beloved children as profesionals and with a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En medio de un pastizal, rodeado de hermosas y mansas vaquitas encontramos a doña Bernardina desempeñando su trabajo diario de pastar las vaquitas pertenecientes a un centro educativo del distrito de Pukará, oficio al que está dedicada hace más de cinco años del lugar en el que también trabaja como personal de limpieza su querido esposo , Timoteo.Ambos se esfuerzan arduamente para mantener y ofrecer una educación adecuada a sus ocho menores hijos, anhelando siempre brindarles a cada uno de ellos estudios superiores. En esta oportunidad Bernardina desea comprar una ternerita y así poco a poco dedicarse a la crianza y reproducción de sus propias vaquitas, para esto solicita un préstamo que rembolsará en un lapso de ocho meses. Ayudemos a esta madre trabajadora a concretar sus sueños de ver a sus queridos hijos profesionales y con un gran porvenir.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to start breeding cattle

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
In the "Plaza de Armas" in the district of Pukará, doña Matilde, happy and enthusiastic, is offering a variety of merchandise to the visitors that approach little by little. Matilde owns a small stand where she sells artscrafts which she has been doing for more than eleven years, and today it is the most substantial economic income for her home. Thanks to her work which she carries out diligently and occasionally with the help of her husband, Victor, she covers the family expenses in an acceptable way. Doña Matilde wishes to enlarge her stand and expand the variety of merchandise offered to the customers in order to obtain higher economic benefits and therefore she needs a loan that will allow her to grow. She plans to repay the loan in a period of eight months and promises to be punctual and responsible. With your kind support doña Matilde will be able to reach her goal in a very short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la plaza de armas del distrito de Pukará, encontramos muy alegre y entusiasta a doña Matilde, ofreciendo variedad de mercadería a los visitantes que poco a poco van llegando.Matilde tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas de artesanías, negocio al que se dedica hace más de once años y que hoy en día se ha convertido en el principal ingreso económico de su hogar. Ya que gracias a esta labor que desempeña muy diligentemente en ocasiones con apoyo de su esposo Víctor, solventa satisfactoriamente los gastos de su familia. El deseo de doña Matilde es ampliar su puesto y aumentar la variedad de la mercadería que ofrece a propios y extraños con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios económicos.Para esto requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá crecer mucho más con su oficio; ella se compromete a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses y promete ser puntual y responsable. Con tu gentil apoyo doña Matilde podrá concretar en muy corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more variety of artscrafts for the tourists visiting her beautiful town.

loans.name: Alfredo Terencio

texts.es:
Alfredo Terencio is a single head of the household who has dedicated himself to making his business prosper through great effort. Approximately 6 years ago, he began his Wholesale Business, located in an open market. However, over the years he has improved the structure of his business.

CEPRODEL, Alfredo’s sponsor, in addition to giving him financial support, has also provided a solution to his economic struggles, and Alfredo feels happy and satisfied to work together. Thanks to this financial assistance he has been able to enclose his business, put in a hard floor (before it had a dirt floor), increase inventory and add to clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfredo Terencio es un hombre jefe de familia, soltero que se ha dedicado a hacer prosperar su negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Desde hace aproximadamente 6 años comenzo con su Distribuidora ubicada en un galeron abierto, sin embargo a medida que transcurren los años el ha ido mejorando la estructura de su local.

CEPRODEL mas que brindarle financiamiento, le ha otorgado una solucion a sus problemas financieros, y Alfredo se siente contesnto y satisfecho de trabajar en conjunto. Gracias a esta solucion financiera el ha logrado cerrar el local, colocarle piso ya que antes era de tierra, incrementar su inventario y aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Restock inventory

loans.name: Ni Komang Swastini

texts.id:
Penghasilan suami yang pas-pasan sebagai  tukang bangunan bahkan sering tidak cukup untuk biaya hidup keluarga, membuat Ni Komang Suastini turut bekerja keras untuk mendapatkan tambahan penghasilan . Usaha yang menjadi pilihan Ni Komang Suastini adalah sebagai pedagang hasil bumi, yaitu membeli berbagai jenis hasil panen petani seperti Pisang , mangga, kelapa, nangka ,kakau ,dan yang lainya tergantung musim. Kemudian di bawa ke pasar Negara untuk di jual kembali. Dalam sehari  Ni Komang Suastini mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 30,000,- s/d 35.000,- dari modal yang hanya Rp 500.000,- . Aktifitas yang dilakukan Ni Komang Suastini mulai dari pukul 10.00 pagi berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor  miliknya untuk mencari barang dagangan , setelah barang terkumpul dirasa cukup , kira-kira pukul 16.00 barang itu langsung di bawanya ke pasar Negara untuk di jual pada pedagang yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetapnya . Demikian kegiatan ini dilakukan hampir setiap hari.  
         Mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari oleh Ni Komang Suastini di gunakan untuk menambah modal dan juga untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor  yang ada sehinga usahanya berjalan lebih lancar.

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi barang dagangan dan untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor yang dipakai untuk berdagang agar memperlancar usahanya

loans.name: Anselmio

texts.es:
Anselmo lost his job due to personnel downsizing. This caused him sadness and he was desperate to find a new job. Time went by and Anselmo still didn't find work. Therefore, he decided to start his own business with the little savings he had left. He started selling groceries. However, he couldn't handle that kind of business administration. Therefore, he started selling quilts, towels, sheets and products like that. People need these kind of products and they don't have an expiration date. He's been keeping this business running for two years and little by little has been gaining clients.

Nonetheless, these same clients have been demanding product novelties and have been making some requests that he has not been able to supply due to lack of capital. Therefore, he is requesting a US $925 loan and he is sure he'll be able to repay it in six months. With your help Anselmo could move this business and his family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Anselmo, perdió su trabajo, en un recorte de personal, lo que lo llevó a la tristeza, y desesperación por encontrar un nuevo trabajo. Pasó el tiempo y Anselmo no encontraba trabajo, por lo que decidió comenzar a realizar su negocio, y con los pocos ahorros que le quedaban, empezó por vender abarrotes, pero no pudo con la administración de este tipo de negocios y decidió cambiar de giro, a la venta de colchas, toallas, sábanas y cosas por el estilo, puesto que mucha gente requiere estos productos y no tienen fecha de caudcidad. Hace 2 años que mantiene funcionando este negocio y poco a poco a ido ganando clientes.

Sin embargo, los mismos clientes son los que le están exigiendo novedades en sus productos, y ya le han hecho varios pedidos que desgraciadamente, no a podido surtir por falta de dinero, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 y está seguro que este dinero lo podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses.Con tu ayuda Anselmo podrá sacar adelante este negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco has been doing commerce for 47 years. He wasn't able to study beyond grade school because he needed to seek independence and stop being an extra expense for his family. He then met a lovely woman, whom he married. He then had to work harder in order to maintain her. He and his wife had 10 children, for whom he had to work even harder in order to move forward. This is how he started to sell other products beyond used clothes, such as tapestry for cars. His children are all married except for two, who help Francisco with the sales.

Francisco is not tired of working and he keeps fighting day to day in order to make money - to maintain his wife and the children who are still under his care. This is why he is requesting a US $575 credit which he will repay in 6 months. With this money Francisco will be able to inject life into his business by purchasing merchandise for the winter season. With your help Francisco and his family will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 47 años, francisco se a dedicado al comercio, puesto que no pudo estudiar más que hasta la primaria, y la necesidad en aquel entonces fue de independizarse y no ser un gasto más para su familia, después conoció a una linda mujer, con la que se casó y después tuvo que trabajar más para poder mantenerla, con el paso de los años, tuvo 10 hijos, por los que tuvo que luchar para sacarlos adelante, y fue así como empezó a introducir otros productos en las ventas de ropa usada, como la venta de tela tapiz para autos. Sus hijos actualmente se encuentran casados a excepción de dos quienes le ayudan a Francisco a vender.

Sin embargo Francisco no se siente cansado de trabajar, y sigue luchando día a día para sacar dinero, ahora para mantener a su esposa y a los hijos que le quedan a su cuidado, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Francisco podrá inyectarle vida a su negocio comprando mercancía para la temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda Francisco y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the winter season.

loans.name: Sandra Elva

texts.es:
