Sandra Elva suffered a tremendous illness which left her unemployed for a long time. Before she got sick, she had a small gift store which she had to transfer to keep her clients happy. Now she got the store back and she is willing to move forward, one more time. Therefore, she started selling shoes by catalog.

The fight is still on. In many occasions she has fallen and risen again because catalog sales do not provide a fixed income. Therefore, she is requesting a US $300 loan which she will repay in four months. With this money, Sandra will be able to purchase the orders clients have already requested. She will also be able to purchase Christmas gifts to offer her clients. With your help Sandra will be able to move on after this terrible illness.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra Elva, sufrió de una terrible enfermedad, que la dejó sin poder trabajar por un largo tiempo. Antes de enfermarse tenía una pequeña tienda de regalos, la cual tuvo que traspasar para que esta no perdiera la clientela, y ya que se recuperó, está dispuesta a salir adelante, nuevamente, y por lo tanto comenzó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue en pie, y necesita en muchas ocasiones, caer y volverse a levantar, puesto que el negocio de la venta por catálogo no representa un ingreso fijo. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Sandra podrá comprar los pedidos que ya le hicieron y comprar artículos navideños para poder ofrecérselos entre sus clientas. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá salir delante después de este terrible acontecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase new products for Christmas' sales.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Unfortunately, a year ago Reyna lost her husband, with whom she shared many anecdotes and very happy moments. Moments she remembers often these days to be able to overcome the sadness that haunts her. Nonetheless, Reyna is not letting this situation defeat her and keeps fighting to move on and go forward. When her husband was still alive, Reyna started selling products by catalogue, starting with naturist products, then shoes. Little by little she started building her client portfolio.

Life always goes on. This is why Reyna is convinced that working hard will allow her overcome her sadness. This is why she's requesting a US $425 credit which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Reyna will be able to purchase merchandise to have better products to offer her clients. With your help Reyna will be able to keep going and overcome her sadness.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Desgraciadamente hace un año, Reyna, perdió a su esposo, con quien compartió muchas anécdotas, y convivió con él momentos muy felices que hoy recuerda con mucha frecuencia para poder salir delante de la tristeza que la embarga. Sin embargo Reyna no se deja vencer por lo que está pasando y sigue luchando para salir adelante. Cuándo su esposo todavía vivía, Reyna comenzó a vender productos por catálogos, comenzando con productos naturistas, después con zapatos y poco a poco empezó a hacer su cartera de clientes.

Pero la vida sigue y es pos esto que Reyna está convencida que con trabajo logrará salir de esta tristeza, y es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $425 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Reyna podrá comprar mercancía para surtir y tener mejores productos que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Reyna podrá salir delante de esta tristeza.

loans.use: Stock merchandise to offer her clients

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria’s husband does contract work in the local town’s industry: however there are long gaps between contracts in which he is without work. It is for this reason that Maria Guadelupe decided to begin to look for a business in order to be able to meet household expenses without waiting for her husband to obtain new work. This was how she began to sell clothes and ceramics, and after a time a friend of hers invited her to sell cosmetics from a catalogue, saying to her that these products would give her a good profit margin. She decided to hold a demonstration in her house, together with her neighbours, and she managed good sales that day and from then on she has continued fighting to advance.

Maria’s goal now is to become the co-coordinator of a group of saleswomen, and for this she is asking for a loan of $575 USD, to be paid back over 5 months. With this money Maria will be able to meet all the orders which she has for the upcoming end-of-year party season, and with the profits she will make they she will be able to renovate a part of her house in order to make a small office where she can meet her clients. With your help, Maria will be able to realise her dream.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El esposo de María, trabaja por contrato en una industria de su comunidad, sin embargo hay largas temporadas entre contrato y contrato que se queda sin trabajo. Es por eso que María Guadalupe decidió comenzar a buscar un negocio para poder solventar los gastos de la casa, que no esperan a que su esposo consiga trabajo nuevamente. Y fue así como comenzó por vender ropa y cerámica, y después de un tiempo una amiga de ella la invitó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, diciéndole que dichos productos le iban a dejar una buena ganancia, y se decidió a hacer una demostración en su casa, juntó a sus vecinas y logró hacer una buena venta ese día y desde entonces a luchado por salir adelante.

La meta de María ahora es llegar a ser coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María podrá surtir todos los pedidos que tiene para esta temporada de fiestas de fin de año, y con las ganancias que tenga poder remodelar una parte de su casa para ponerla como oficinita para atender a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda el sueño de María se hará realidad.

loans.use: Stock orders from her clients

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
In March 1991, a friend of Leticia’s mother offered to make a demonstration in her house of the products which she now sells. This same friend suggested to her mother that she should sell these products, but her mother said it would be better is Leticia sold them and in this way she was able to fund her training, and later she changed her aims to try and meet the expenses of her two small children, as her husband is a construction worker and earns very little. This was how she began, first as a saleswoman and now she is the coordinator of a group of saleswomen and is working very hard to become a director – she hopes she will be able to achieve this.

However, the road is difficult and requires much strength and effort: for this reason she is asking for a loan of $575 USD which she will repay over a 5 month period, in order to buy the orders which have been made during this season, and thus achieve her outlined goals. With your help Maria Leticia will be able to move forward with her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde Marzo de 1991, una amiga de la mamá de Leticia le ofreció hacer una demostración en su casa de los productos que actualmente vende. Esa misma amiga le sugirió a su mamá vender dichos productos, pero su mamá dijo que mejor Leticia los vendiera y de esta forma ella se ayudaba a costear su carrera, y después cambió su finalidad a tratar de costear los gastos de sus dos pequeños hijos, ya que su esposo es albañil y gana muy poco dinero. Fue así que empezó primero como vendedora y actualmente es coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras y está trabajando muy fuerte para llegar a ser directora esperando lograrlo.

Sin embargo el camino es difícil y se requiere de mucho esfuerzo, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses, para poder comprar los pedidos que le hicieron en esta temporada, y así poder cumplir con la meta que se trazó. Con tu ayuda María Leticia podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Stock merchandise to offer to her customers

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela and her husband have four children, for whom they want the best of futures, and for this reason they don’t want their children to stop studying, so they can be of benefit to their country. The husband of Micaela is the driver of a bus route, and the salary he earns is very small: it’s for this reason that Micaela, with the firm intention of ensuring that her children better themselves, decided to start selling cosmetics. This was after a friend demonstrated in her house and convinced her that cosmetic sales have a very flexible timetable, which would allow her not to neglect her children, that the profits are good and this would allow her to help with the expenses of schooling her four children. From December 2005 she has dedicated herself to the sale of these products.

However, Micaela is trying to advance and become the coordinator of a group. For this she is asking for a loan of $575 USD, to be repaid in 5 months. With this money Micaela will be able to stock the products which her customers have requested. And she will be able to offer this work to other women who need economic help. With your help Micaela will be able to go forward with her business and thus her children will be able to continue studying.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Micaela y su esposo tienen 4 hijos, para los cuales quieren el mejor de los futuros y es por eso que no quieren que dejen de estudiar para que sean personas de provecho para el país. El esposo de Micaela es chofer de una ruta, y el sueldo que gana es muy poco, es por eso que Micaela, con la firme intensión de que sus hijos salgan adelante, decidió ponerse a vender cosméticos. Esto después de que una amiga hiciera una demostración en su casa y la convenció de que la venta de cosméticos es muy flexible en horarios, que a ella le sirve para no desatender a sus hijos, y las ganancias son buenas, que le ayuda para los gastos de las escuelas de sus cuatro hijos. Desde Diciembre del 2005 se dedica a la venta de estos productos.

Sin embargo Micaela lucha por salir adelante y llegar a ser coordinadora de un grupo. Por lo que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Micaela podrá surtir los productos que le solicitaron. Y poder ofrecerles este negocio a otras mujeres que necesiten de la ayuda económica. Con tu ayuda Micaela podrá sacar adelante su negocio y así sus hijos podrán seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Buy merchandise her clients have ordered.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
In 2004 Dalia began to sell cosmetics from a catalogue and other products, in order to meet household expenses, as her husband works as a fisherman and during the off-season he can’t earn much money. Dalia and her husband have 5 children between 5 and 11 years old, and as a result the expenses of school, clothing and food are very high, and with the little that her husband and Dalia earn the family has to survive.

For this season Dalia wants to prepare by stocking-up merchandise which her customers have asked for as presents. It is for this that she is asking for a loan of $475, to be repaid in a period of 4 months and with the money Dalia will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her clients. With your help Dalia will be able to move forward with her 5 children, who need her very much in order not to stray off-track in their lives.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde el 2004 Dalia comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo y otros productos, para poder mantener los gastos del hogar, puesto que su esposo trabaja como pescador, y en temporadas de veda, no obtiene mucho dinero. Dalia y su esposo tienen 5 hijos entre los 5 y 11 años de edad, por lo que los gastos de su escuela y los gastos de ropa y comida son muchos, y con lo poco que gana el esposo y Dalia es con lo que vive la familia.

Para esta temporada Dalia se quiere preparar, puesto que es cuando sus clientes le piden cosas para regalos. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Dalia podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Dalia sacará adelante a sus 5 hijos que tanto la necesitan para no irse por el mal camino de la vida.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: María

texts.es:
The father of Maria’s two small children abandoned them, and she was left liable for certain household bills and their children. What she earned as a cleaner in a construction company was not enough to meet the expenses of her children. For this reason she decided that selling some product would be the best means to ensure her family’s advance. One day in October 2006, as she was leaving her sons at school, she realised that the salespeople who were in the school entrance sold a lot, and it occurred to her that she could do the same outside her house, so one day she put a small table outside with some sweets and snacks and the people who passed began to buy. She like this work and little by little invested in more merchandise: later she put up a shelf with snacks and now she has more stock.

The project of Maria is to expand her business more and to establish a more permanent and larger shop by renovating part of her house’s patio. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of $475 USD which she is intending to pay back in 4 months and with money Maria will be able to buy more merchandise and with these profits she will be able to establish her little grocery shop in her house patio. With your help Maria, one of so many single mothers, will be able to move forward with her children and offer a good example for life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El padre de los dos pequeños hijos de María los abandonó, y ella quedó desprotegida con ciertos gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Puesto que con lo que ganaba como trabajadora de limpieza en una constructora no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Por lo tanto decidió que vender algún producto sería la mejor manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Y fue así que en Octubre del 2006, una vez que fue a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela se dio cuenta que los vendedores que estaban a la entrada de la escuela vendían mucho, y a ella se me ocurrió hacerlo fuera de su casa, así que un día sacó una mesita con algunos dulces y frituras y la gente que pasaba le empezó a comprar, le gustó y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en más mercancía, después puso un anaquel con frituras y ahora tiene más surtido.

El proyecto de María es expandir más su negocio para poner una tiendita en forma y más grande, acondicionando un espacio del patio de su casa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para que así con las ganancias ella pueda adecuar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el patio de su casa. Con tu ayuda María una de tantas madres solteras podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un buen ejemplo de vida y superación.

loans.use: Stock merchandise in order to be able to acquire a place for his shop

loans.name: Ni Luh Sekar

texts.id:
Living with her husband and 2 children, Ni Luh Sekar must work to supplement the family’s expenses. Her husband’s income as a skilled laborer is insufficient, as Ni Luh Sekar needs to expense Rp. 20.000 (USD2), - to buy daily essentials even before paying for her children’s education. With a funding of Rp. 1.000.000 (USD100), - Ni Luh Sekar started a general stall located in front of their home, selling daily essentials like: rice, sugar, detergent, soap and other light snacks. Daily, Ni Luh Sekar generate revenue of between Rp. 200.000 to Rp. 250.000 (USD20 to USD25), - with profit of Rp. 25.000 to 30.000 (USD2.50 to USD3),- Ni Luh Sekar is personable and well recognized thus her business developed quickly. Furthermore with this additional funding from Dinari the goods she sells are more complete ranging from contents for the kitchen to the bathroom are available. Thus increasing her profit until Ni Luh Sekar is able to pay for her eldest child’s education, currently in SMP (equivalent to middle school).

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal bersama suami dan dua anaknya Ni Luh Sekar harus bekerja extra untuk menghidupi keluarganya. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang tukang dirasa kurang cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari., karena setiap harinya Niluh Sekar harus mengeluarkan biaya Rp. 20.000,- untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari belum lagi untuk biaya sekolah anaknya .Dengan modal usaha Rp.1 000.000,- Niluh Sekar mulai membuka usaha warung yang berlokasi di depan rumahnya . barang yang di jual pun mulai dari barang barang kebutuhan sehari- hari seperti : beras, gula, diterjen, sabun dan berbagai jenis makanan ringan . dalam satu hari Niluh sekar mendapat hasil penjualan berkisar Rp 200,000 S.d 250.000,- dengan keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp 25.000,- s.d 30.000,- . Ni luh Sekar terkenal sangat baik dan ramah sehinga usaha warungnyapun berkembang cepat .Apalagi dengan mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari jenis barang daganganNya menjadi lebih berpariasi dan lengkap dari isi dapur sampai kamar Mandi ada disini . dengan demikian keuntungan yang didapat juga semakin banyak sehingga niluh sekar mampu membiayai pendidikan anak sulungnya yang sekarang sudah duduk di bangku SMP .

loans.use: Increase working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto V. is the father of three young children for whom he wants the best. Gilberto works as a school bus driver, but the money that he earns from this job is not sufficient to pay his family expenses. For this reason he began to sell notebooks out of his home, and then little by little he began to add more products until his business became a small general store. Today he has clients in his neighborhood.

However, the struggle to continue growing remains a challenge, and for that reason Gilberto is asking for a loan of $200 to be repaid within 6 months. With this money Gilberto will be able to buy more merchandise in order to have a variety of products and maintain his few clients rather than losing them due to a lack of products. With your help, Gilberto will be able to give his young children opportunities for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilberto V. es padre de familia de tres pequeñitos, a quienes quiere darles siempre lo mejor, y Gilberto trabaja como conductor de transporte escolar sin embargo el dinero que gana en este negocio, no le deja lo suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de su familia, es por eso que comenzó a vender libretas fuera de su casa, y así poco a poco empezó a meter más productos hasta hacerlo una tienda de abarrotes. Que hoy ya tiene clientes de su colonia.

Sin embargo la lucha de seguir creciendo está en pie y es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gilberto podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad en sus productos y los poquitos clientes que a juntado no se vayan por falta de mercancías. Con tu ayuda Gilberto podrá sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to have greater variety in his business

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba’s husband is a contractor, and together they have two children, one teenager and one ten-year-old, who need help to be able to get ahead and not go down the wrong path in life. That’s why Rosalba has fought to give the best of herself to her children without neglecting them all day, and why she dedicated herself to sales: her schedule is flexible, and her earnings are seasonal. She began by selling one brand of beauty products out of catalogs, and now she sells many brands to give her customers more variety.

Nevertheless, when combined with the little her husband earns, her daily fight goes on to raise money to pay the costs of the household and her children, who are doing very well in school. For her children, she is requesting a loan of $575 over a six-month term. With this money, she will be able to buy more merchandise and offer a wider variety to her customers through the Christmas season. With your help, Rosalba can get her children ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Rosalba es contratista y junto con él tiene 2 hijos, uno en la adolescencia y el otro de 10 años, los cuales necesitan apoyo para poder salir adelante y no meterse en malos caminos de la vida. Es por eso que Rosalba a luchado por darles lo mejor a sus hijos, sin descuidarlos todo el día. Y fue así que se dedicó a las ventas, así su horario es flexible y las ganancias son dependiendo las temporadas. Comenzó por vender productos de belleza por catálogos de una marca y hoy cuenta ya con otras marcas, para así poderle dar más variedad a sus clientas.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue, para poder sacar dinero diariamente, y asú junto con lo poco que gana su esposo poder pagar los gastos de su casa y los gastos de sus dos hijos que hasta hoy van muy bien en la escuela. Por sus hijos está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientas en la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda Rosalba podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of goods to offer her customers

loans.name: Blanca Verónica

texts.es:
After helping her sister with her sales, Blanca decided to become independent and purchased some shoe catalogs that she could offer to her friends. With this money, she helped her husband with the household expenses, since her husband works as a store clerk, and does not earn enough to pay all the costs of the home.

Since she buys the shoes in installments, it takes a long time to recover what she’s invested and stock other shoes. This method is not working well since the money does not come in quickly and if one customer fails to pay, she falls even further behind. Therefore, Blanca is requesting a loan of $575 that she can pay with a six-month term. With this money, she will be able to purchase the merchandise that her customers request as well as other products to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Después de ayudarle a su hermana a vender Blanca decidió independizarse y comprar unos catálogos de zapatos para poder ofrecerle a sus amigas, y con ese dinero poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo trabaja como almacenista y lo que gana es muy poco para poder pagar los gastos del hogar.

Debido a que los zapatos los vende a plazos, tarda mucho tiempo en recuperar lo que invirtió para poder surtir otros zapatos. Esta técnica ya no le está funcionando puesto que el dinero no lo recupera rápido y si una clienta le queda mal en un pago ella se retrasa más. Por lo tanto Blanca está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar la mercancía que le solicitaron y más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientas.

loans.use: Put in customer orders and purchase merchandise for greater variety

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela has always worked to be able to earn her own money. Unfortunately, she made a bad decision to marry the father of her children; life with was not healthy, so she decided to move out. Adela put herself to work at getting her two small children ahead, and she began to sell some stationery, rent a computer, and save her money. She began to purchase more things for her store, and little by little she has been gaining customers.

Nevertheless, her children’s school needs change every month, and Adela has to buy more merchandise to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is requesting a loan of $575 with a term of six months; with this money, she will purchase more merchandise to sell. With your help, Adela and her children can get ahead, and they can be proud that their mother raised them up well despite not having a father figure.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Adela siempre trabajó para poder sacar dinero para ella, desgraciadamente tomó una mala decisión al casarse con el padre de sus hijos puesto que la vida que llevaba alado de él no era sana, así que terminó por separarse de él. Adela decidió ponerse a trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos, comenzó a vender un poco de papelería y a rentar una computadora, y ahorrando comenzó a comprar más y más cosas para su tienda, y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes.

Sin embargo las demandas de los niños de las escuelas va cambiando cada vez más, y Adela tiene que comprar más mercancía para tener todo lo que necesitan sus clientes, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Adela y sus hijos podrán salir adelante, y tener el orgullo de que sus mamá los sacó adelante a pesar de no contar con una figura paterna.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Joaquina Filipe

texts.pt:
Joaquina Filipe Vilaculos lives in the Liberdade neighborhood of Maputo. She is a married mother of 3. She entered the program in 2005 with an initial loan amount of 3,000 MT (meticais). She sells used clothing in Liberdade and has also delivered clothing to Namaacha. She is borrowing 5,000 MT, to be repaid in 5 months, for the purpose of investing in the business. The loans have helped her purchase goods for the home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Joaquina Filipe Vilaculos vive no bairro da Liberdade em Maputo. Vive maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos.Entrou para o programa em 2005 com um empréstimo inicial de 3.000MT. Vende roupa usada na Liberdade e tem levado também a roupa para Namaacha.Vai tomar 5.000MT para pagar em 5 meses para investir no negócio. Os empréstimos têm ajudado a cliente uma vez que com os lucros consegue comprar bens para a sua casa.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Florinda Francisco

texts.pt:
Florinda Francisco C. is 47 years old, single, and the mother of 6 children. She lives in the Bagamoyo district in Maputo. She sells firewood and charcoal in the market and at home. She entered the program in 2004 as a member of the Bagamoyo group, having taken a first loan of 1,800 meticais. Now she'll be in her 4th loan cycle as an individual client and will take a loan of 5,000 meticiais. All the loans have been applied to the business. She has shown herself to be a person of good character and has not missed payments.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Florinda Francisco C. tem 47 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos. Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo. Vende Lenha e carvão no mercado e em casa. Entrou para o programa em 2004 como membro do grupo Bagamoyo,tendo tomado 1.800MT como 1º empréstimo.Vai agora para o 4º cilclo como cliente individual e vai tomar 5.000MT. Todos os empréstimos tem aplicado no nogócio. Tem demonstrado ser uma pessoa de bom carácter e não tem falhas nos pagamentos.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
MWANAMTAMA is 54 years old and opened the “Killy Shop” (named after her son) in 2002. This business currently brings in about $150-170 a month.

In 2005, the shop burnt down due to an electrical short. After this tragedy, a loan was taken out to rebuild the shop and to restock its inventory. Fortunately, only the shop was burnt during the fire, although it is connected to the front of their home.

Mwanamtama lives with her husband and with six children – three of their own and three orphaned relatives. They have three other children as well, who have grown and are now independent. Their house assistant and shopkeeper, whom they pay about $18 a month each, also live with them. The husband works in a hotel.

In hopes of receiving a second loan, Mwanamtama would like to buy a refrigerator for the shop and to start selling wholesale eggs in a new location. She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and buy eggs

payments.comment: Mwanamtama has successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Gracinda João

texts.pt:
Gracinda João Z. is 36 years old, lives with her husband and is the mother of 3 children. She lives in the Laulane district in Maputo. She has a stand at her home where she sells a range of food products. She entered the program in May of 2007 with a loan of 6000 meticais. She will be in her 2nd loan cycle and will borrow the same amount to pay in 5 months. It would be premature to evaluate the nature and growth of the business with the time that she has been in the program.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Gracinda João Z. tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Laulane em Maputo. Tem uma barraca em sua casa onde vende diversos produtos de mercearia.Entrou para o programa em Maio de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar om mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses.É ainda prematuro avaliar o carácter e crescimento do negócio pelo tempo que está no programa.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Ana Eduardo Cabral

texts.pt:
Ana is single but lives with a man with whom she has 10 children. (Five of the children are hers, and 5 are from another woman, but they are all under Ana's care.) Ana's husband is a miner and works in a neighboring country. Ana is this man's first wife. She and the other wife take care of the business and the children almost always, since Ana's husband only comes home to spend vacation.

Ana entered the loan program in 2005. The first loan that she took out at that time was 6,000 meticais to invest in the business. Because the business is going well, she wants to take out another loan now to acquire more products to restock her store. The majority of the children are studying. The youngest ones are the only ones who don't go to school, but as soon as they are old enough, they will be enrolled. Ana and her family live in Matchelene, a rural area which is about 15 kms from the city of Xai-Xai. In addition to the store, Ana and her family also have a small field in the lowland area, where fertile land is located for agricultural activity.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 10 filhos (5 dela e 5 de uma outra mulher) mas todos estao sob a responsabilidade de Ana. O marido de Ana e mineiro trabalha num Pais vizinho.Ana e a primeira mulher deste homem.Ela e a outra mulher e que cuidam da casa do negocio e dos filhos quase todo o tempo, pois que o marido de Ana so vem a casa para passar ferias. Ana entrou para o programa de credito em 2005.O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou na altura foi de 6.000,00 Mt para investir no negocio. Porque o negocio esta a correr bem ela quer tomar um outro emprestimo agora para a aquisicao de mais produtos para rechear a sua loja. A maioria das criancas estao a estudar. So nao estudam os mais novinhos, mas logo que estes tiverem idade serao matriculados. A Ana e sua familia vivem em Matchelene uma zona rural que dista cerca de 15 Kms da cidade de Xai-Xai.Para alem da loja Ana e sua familia tambem fazem machamba na zona baixa,onde se localizam as terras ferteis proprias para a actividade agricola.

loans.use: Ana wants to use the money to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina is single, but she lives with a man with whom she has 4 children. Cristina's partner is a worker who works in the mines in a neighboring country. Cristina is the person who takes care of the business, home, and children the majority of the time, since her partner only comes once a year to spend vacation. Cristina's children are studying in elementary and secondary school. She wants to use the loan money to stock her store. Cristina entered the loan program in 2005. At that point, she took out a loan of 3,000 meticias. Cristina also has a small field because she lives in the Matchelene zone, which is a rural zone located about 15 kms from the city of Xai-Xai.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Cristina e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. O marido de Cristina e mineiro trabalha nas minas num Pais vizinho. Cristina e quem cuida do negocio , da casa e dos filhos a maior parte do tempo, pois que o marido de Cristina so vem uma vez por ano para passar ferias. Os filhos de Cristina estao a estudar no ensino Primario basico e no segundo nivel.Ela quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para rechear a sua loja. Cristina entrou para o programa de credito em 2005.Na altura ela tomou 3.000,00 Mt. Cristina tambem faz machamba porque ela vive na zona de Matchelene, que e uma zona rural que dista da cidade de Xai-xai, cerca de 15 kms.

loans.use: Cristina wants to use the money to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.pt:
Ricardina is married and mother of 3. She lives in Maxine in the province in the Inhume. She joined the credit program in 2006. Her first loan was of 3.000, 00mt. She sells kitchenware at the market. Since business is doing well she wants to start selling clothes and shoes as well. Ricardina’s husband in unemployed but works odd jobs to help provide for the family. One of her sons is going to school and the other 2 are still small. Ricardina supports her family with the income fromt he business.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardina e casad e mae de 3 filhos. Ela vive na Maxixe, provincia de Inhambane. Ricardina entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 3.000,00 Mt. Ela vende a sua loica no mercado.Porque o negocio lhe esta a correr bem ela introduziu tambem a venda de alguma roupa e algum calcado. Ela esta no setimo ciclo.O marido de Ricardina nao esta empregado vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar sua familia. Dos filhos de Ricardina apenas um vai a escola os outros dois ainda sao pequenos. Mas logo que estes tenham idade serao matriculados. Com os rendimentos Ricardina ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Ricardina will use the loan to increase her inventory and also buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Berta Antonio Joao

texts.pt:
Berta is single but she lives with a man with whom she has 2 children. Berta's husband is not employed, and makes his living from small jobs. Berta entered the loan program in 2006. Berta lives with her family in a location called Nzucuane in the Homine district. It's an essentially rural area, so Berta also has a small field for subsistence farming for her family. With her earnings, she helps her partner with the household expenses. In the future, she wants to help her partner also fix up the house. Berta's children are studying in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Berta e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos. O marido de Berta nao esta empregado vive de pequenos expedientes.Berta entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Berta vive com sua familia numa localidade chamada Nzucuane no distrito de Homine. E uma zona essencilamente rural. por isso Berta tambem faz machamba para a subsistencia de sua familia. Com os rendimentos ela ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. No futuro ela quer ajudar o marido tambem a reabilitar a casa. Os filhos de Berta estao a estudar no nivel primario basico.

loans.use: Berta wants to use the money to buy products for her store

loans.name: Raquel Joaquim Filip

texts.pt:
Raquel lives in the town of Maxixe, which is the seat of one of the districts of the Province of Inhambane. She sells in the central market. She is single, but lives with a man with whom she has 4 children. Raquel's partner is a carpenter. Raquel wants to help him with the household expenses, so that's why she is entering the loan program. This loan that she will take is her first. She says that if business goes well, with the earnings, she wants to help her partner build a house from conventional material. Raquel's children are studying, with the exception of youngest, who is not yet old enough.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Raquel vive no municipio da Maxixe sede de um dos distritos da Provincia de Inhambane. Ela vende no mercado central.Ela e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. O marido de Raquel e carpinteiro. raquel quer ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa por isso ela esta entrando agora para o programa de credito. Este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o primeiro. Diz ela que se o negocio correr bem com os rendimentos quer ajudar o marido a construir uma casinha com material convencional. Os filhos de Raquel estao a estudar com a excepcao do mais novo que ainda nao tem idade.

loans.use: Raquel wants to use the money to purchase beans, peanuts, cakes and candies to stock her stand.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
The A. family has 6 years of experience in growing and selling vegetables (tomatoes, peppers, cabbage), having land and a source of water. They manage to sell the vegetables produced in their two greenhouses and also the vegetables purchased at small vendors, which they sell subsequently at a higher price.

Ms. A. rents a table at the central market in Cahul. During the period May – September, the family sells the vegetables cultivated on their own land and during the other months of the year, they buy and re-sell agricultural products.

Ms. A. came to Microinvest for a loan as this year she has to plow her land. Usually it was an Association that was offering agro services. This autumn she needs financial resources that were not planned for, that is why she decided to take out a loan.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and  pay someone with a tractor for tilling her land

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile G. has just over one and a half hectares of agricultural land and an additional half hectare of vineyard. He has a annual harvest of up to 2 tons of grapes which he sells to local wineries. He also grows wheat and corn which he uses as animal feed. Vasile works his agricultural business in his free time in order to supplement the income from his regular job as a technician at the mayor’s office. Unfortunately he does not have his own equipment and he has to pay someone else in the village to cultivate his fields. Vasile would like a loan to buy wheat seeds and to pay for tilling so he can prepare his fields for seeding.

loans.use: seed purchase and plowing expenses

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion L. works at a local farm, overseeing the storage facility. He has a lot of experience in agriculture but is only able to dedicate his free time to his own farming business since he and his family need the income he earns from his job. Evenings and on the weekend he works on his own land, about 2 hectares. There he primarily grows wheat, since it is something which does not require much tending but still brings a little extra income. He is requesting a loan to fund the purchase of seeds and to hire someone to till his fields with a tractor in preparation for planting.

loans.use: seed purchase and plowing expenses

loans.name: Maria Pedro

texts.pt:
Maria is single, but she lives a man with whom she has 5 children. Maria's children are studying - some in secondary school and others in primary school. Maria's partner is not employed, and lives from small jobs to support his family. Maria entered the program in 2006. She does her business in a market. She and her family live in the Town of Maxixe. With the earnings, she wants to help her husband with the household epenses. In the future, she is planning to fix up her residence. Maria's children are currently studying.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. Os filhos de Maria estao a estudar alguns no ensino secundario basico e outros no ensino primario. O marido de Maria nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos negocios para o sustento de sua familia. Maria entrou para o Programa em 2006. Ela faz o seu negocio num mercado. Ela e sua familia vivem no Municipio da Maxixe. Com os rendimentos ela quer ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. No futuro pensa reabilitar a sua residencia.Os filhos de Maria estao a estudar.

loans.use: Maria wants to use the money for the purchase of plastic buckets and pans to sell.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion L. works together with his father on the 1 ½ hectares of land they own to grow corn, wheat and sunflowers. The corn and wheat are used for both consumption and as animal feed, while the sunflowers are harvested for seeds which are pressed into oil. Because of the drought this year, they were not able to harvest nearly as much as they had planned and are unable to pay to have someone plow their fields before the next planting of wheat. Ion needs a loan to prepare the fields and to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to prepare fields and buy seeds

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana B. works with her family to maintain the nearly 5 hectares of their farm. About half is her property and the other half is her mother’s. Her mother is elderly and can no longer work in the fields, so Ana takes care of her property as well. In addition to working the fields, which are primarily planted with wheat, she also raises animals. As for other farmers in the area, this year was a very hard one for Ana, as the weather conditions were not favorable and she was not even able to recover the costs of planting her wheat. She is need of a loan to pay for 850 kg of new seed stock and to have her land plowed ahead of the next planting.

loans.use: seeds and plowing expenses

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has two small plots of land, one she recently inherited from her parents and one she purchased. She has three daughters, all of whom are currently in school and need support. After her husband passed away in 2005, Elena began working overtime at the local bakery to maintain a monthly income which allows her to support the family.

In what little free time remains, Elena works in her small agricultural business to have an additional periodic, small profit which has become vital to covering expenses. With the income and with part of the harvest she obtains from her agriculture activities, she manages to raise several pigs and some chickens, most of which are for the family’s consumption but a few of which are taken to market as well.

Elena previously took a loan and reimbursed it on schedule and without problems. She now needs another loan to cultivate the soil, buy seeds, and prepare in other ways for the next season. It will also help her to maintain the small plot of grapevines which has become her pride and joy. She works hard to cultivate and care for the grapes, which results in a beautiful harvest and good prices at the market.

loans.use: purchase seeds and prepare for next year's crops

loans.name: Sandra Gabriel

texts.pt:
Sandra Gabriel S. is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is a resident of Bagamoyo, Maputo, which is the neighborhood where she sells new clothes - she also delivers to and make purchases from South Africa. She joined the program in June 2006 receiving then a loan in the amount of 3.000MT. This will be her 6th cycle and this time she will borrow 4.000MT that will be repaid within 4 months. She has proved to take good care of her loan payments.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra Gabriel S. tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro de Bagamoyo em Maputo. Vende roupa nova no mesmo bairro e também faz entregas e compra na Àfrica do Sul. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Vai para o 6º ciclo e vai tomar 4.000MT para pagar em 4 meses. Tem se comportado bem nos empréstimos.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Dulce Mariza

texts.pt:
Dulce is a single mother. She lives with her son in her parents' home. She is a goldsmith - a craft she learned from her father. Earlier this year she joined the program and now she will get her second loan. Her residence is located in Maxixe and her small jewelery tent can be found at the local market. If business goes well, she plans on expand her small tent into a real jewelery store.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Dulce e mae solteira. Ela vive com o seu filho na casa dos pais. Ela e ourives. Ela fabrica brincos para a venda. Ela aprendeu esta arte com o seu pai.Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Este emprestimo e o segundo que ela vai tomar.Ela vive na Maxixe e tem a sua pequena ouriversaria no mercado. Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa no futuro transformar a sua pequena barraca numa verdadeira ouriversaria.

loans.use: Dulce wants to use the money to purchase raw gold to manufacture earrings.

loans.name: Tudor

texts.en: Tudor V. worked abroad a period of time in order to earn more money and to give a future to his family with two little daughters. When his wife became ill, he had to return to his country. Here, in Moldova, he has 0.2 ha of peach orchard and 0.8 ha of vineyard. He would like to take a loan at Microinvest to buy orchard and vineyard supplies and hopes Kiva lenders will choose to help him.

loans.use: purchase peach trees and vineyard supplies

loans.name: Runke

texts.en: Mrs. Runke A. is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old, and hails from Mushin, Lagos State. She sells drinks, groundnut oil and eggs. She has been in business since 1995 and needs the loan amount of $800 to buy more drinks, groundnut oil, and eggs for sale. She explains that this will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, groundnut oil and eggs for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the hardworking mother of three who never had the opportunity to learn how to read or write. She believes that many of the obstacles she encountered in life were caused by illiteracy, and is determined that her children will not suffer the same fate. Esther is looking for ways to pay her children's school fees, and believes she can do that by selling vegetables and other food items to the people of her village. She has come to us for a loan to buy the items she will later sell, and plans to use this new source of income to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy carrots, green beans, plantain, cocoyams

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Mrs. Kudirat O. is a mother of 4 children, she is 40 years old; she lives in Mushin, Lagos State. She sells clothes and has been into her business since 1994. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more clothes for sale. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ngum

texts.en: "There is no food for a lazy person"  -- that is the motto of F. Ngum, who works very hard to help her husband provide for their five children, three of whom are still very young. F. rises before dawn to fry puff balls for customers who eat them for breakfast. She has come to us for a loan to continue in this line of work, as well as grow cassava and begin selling water fufu, a paste of grated and fermented cassava that is very popular in Cameroon. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees and help her husband build a house.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, firewood, oil and water fufu

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Mrs. Iyabo A. is 38 years old, married and has 4 children; she is from the Mushin area in  Lagos State. She buys paper from printing presses which she then sells to other companies that are into tissue paper.  She has been doing this business since the year 2002 and she needs the loan of $400 to buy more paper for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tissue paper for sale

loans.name: Muma Godfred

texts.en: Godfred is a young man who is the father of four children. While working as a day laborer, he used a portion of his income to go to school to become an electrician. His training will be finished soon, and he plans to open his own business. He has come to us for a loan to buy the tools he will need for his work. Godfred is confident of his ability to make a profit because many of the people of his village know he is being trained in this field and will need his services. After he opens his business, he will use his income to repay this loan, buy a plot of land on which he can build a house, and educate  his children.

loans.use: To buy tools for his new business

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Mrs. Kudiratu A. is 63 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in Isolo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells yam and garri and has been in the business since 1966. She is seeking for a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more yam and garri for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yam and garri for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth Bih

texts.en: Elizabeth Bih is 63 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She could not afford to give most of her children a secondary-school education, so her greatest desire is to help them learn a trade or how to run a business. She helps support her family by raising pigs, and has applied for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, feed for them to eat, and seeds that she can use to grow crops to sell. She will use the additional income to pay for vocational training for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Chene Victorine

texts.en: Victorine operates a call box which travelers and the people of her town use to make telephone calls. Because business is slow, she and her husband are unable to pay school fees for their two children. Victorine believes she can increase her income by selling firewood in addition to airtime on her roadside call box. She has applied for a loan to buy firewood and more airtime, and will use the additional income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy firewood and airtime for her telephone call box

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet O. E. is 46 years old, married and has 4 children.  She sells frozen food, provisions and foodstuff.  She is from Mushin, Lagos State.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a refrigerator to enable her to store frozen food.  She has been in business since 2005 and she is currently a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Kubri Fonka

texts.en: V. is the mother of five children, all of whom are in school. Paying their school fees is a big challenge, but she is determined to do it to secure a better life for all of them. Because she and her husband are not able to pay these fees on his salary, V. has come to us for a loan to start her own business. She will use her loan to buy, cook and sell food to the people of her village, and also buy firewood to sell to her customers. She will use her income to pay school fees and find a bigger house to live in, because today she and her family live in a small house with only two rooms.

loans.use: Purchase of food and firewood

loans.name: Maria Luísa

texts.pt:
Maria Luisa C. is 52 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She sells fruits, vegetables and some other basic need goods, such as bread and cookies from her residence in Bagamoyo, Maputo. She joined the program in 2005 as a member of the Espereança Group getting a loan in the amount of 1.800MT. Her business has seen a steady gradual growth and she has never made a late payment towards her loan balance. She is now in her fifth cycle and she will borrow 8.000MT that will be paid in 6 months. This loan will be invested in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Luisa C. tem 52 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vende fruta e alguns produtos de 1ª necessidade como pão, biscoitos,etc. na sua residência sita no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em 2005 como cliente grupal, membro do grupo Esperança e tomou como 1º empréstimo 1.800MT.Tem verificado um crescimento gradual no seu negócio e nunca teve atrasos nos pagamentos dos empréstimos.Está agora no 5º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para continuar a reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Folasade

texts.en: Mrs. O. Folasade is 31 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has a restaurant where she sells cooked food.  She has been in business since 1997 and is now requesting a loan in the amount of $625 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amina Abdul

texts.pt:
Amina is not officially married but she lives with the father of her 5 children. Amina's husband is unemployed at this time. He works with Amina at their retail counter - while she cooks, he helps the costumers. Amina joined the program in 2006. Her work location is in Homoine, in the distict of the same name. Amina's children are all in school. If business goes well and generates a profit she will use it to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Amina e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. O marido de Amina nao esta empregado. Trabalha com Amina na Barraca, enquanto ela cozinha ele atende os clientes.Alima entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela faz o seu negocio em Homoine, sede do distrito do mesmo nome.Os filhos de Amina estao a estudar. Se o negocio correr bem e tiver bons rendimentos pensa reabilitar a casa.

loans.use: Amina wants to use the loan amount to purchase products for her retail counter ( ingredients that will be used to prepare food and beverages.)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Mrs. Sarah A. is 38 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Papa Ajao in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She sews clothes and also sells cloth.  She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years and in business since 1992.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a sewing machine.  She will also be able to buy clothes to sell with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and clothes to sell

loans.name: João Hilário

texts.pt:
Joao Hilario M. C. is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in the city of Hulene and his business is located in Magoanine, Maputo. He joined the program in 2005 with a loan of 3.000MT. He sells kitchenware, cellular telephones and a wide variety of chargers for these telephones. It is clear that his business has grown considerably: he began selling kitchenware at first, then, in the following cycle, he open a different location and began selling cellular telephone chargers. With this new loan request he wishes to set up a selling counter in the Museum's area to sell food. He will borrow 8.000MT which will be paid within eight months.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

João Hilário M. C. tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmentece tem 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Hulene e tem o seu negócio principal no bairro de Magoanine em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em 2005 com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Vende Loiça, tem telefones celulares públicos e vende uma variedade de recargas para telefones celulares.Nota-se um crescimento considerável do seu negócio: no principio vendia apenas loiça, no ciclo anterior abriu mais um local para a venda de recargas e com o novo empréstimo pretende abrir uma banca na zona do Museu para venda de produtos alimentares.Vai agora tomar um empréstimo de 8.000MT pagável em oito meses.

loans.use: Business Expansion.

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Mrs. Remi J. is 36 years old, married with 4 children and hails from Mushin, Lagos State.  She sells foodstuff and flour.  She has been in business since the year 2001 and is now requesting a loan of $800 to buy more food items and flour to sell.  She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff & flour

loans.name: Stop Group

texts.pt:
The Stop Group was formed in July of this year by two ladies: Primavera and Arminda. Primavera is the group leader and she is divorced - her former husband left her to live with another woman. She has three children and she joined the program right after she became a single mother. She did so in order to support her children for they are still in school. Arminda is married and has 7 children. She sells vegetables she grows in her smallholding along with her husband. Her children help out as well when they are not in school. She works at the smallholding in the mornings and she sells vegetables and peanuts in the local market in the afternoons. Arminda was part of a different group but decided to leave it and create the Stop Group alongside Primavera because of the hardship her friend was facing. Primavera lives in Maxixe and sells coconuts in Maputo. She needs to rent a vehicle too haul her coconuts from Maxixe to Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

O grupo Stop foi formado em Julho deste ano e e formado por duas senhoras nomeadamente Primavera e Arminda. Primavera e a lider do Grupo e e divorciada. O marido abandonou-a e foi viver com outra mulher.Ela tem 3 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa assim que o marido a abandonou. Ela entrou para o programa para poder sustentar os seus filhos que ainda sao pequenos e ainda estao a estudar.Arminda e casada e mae de 7 filhos. Ela vende vegetais que colhe de sua machamba onde ela e o marido trabalham.Os filhos quando nao vao a escola tambem ajudam nos trabalhos da machamba. Nas manhas ela trabalha na machamba e nas tardes no mercado para a venda dos vegetais e amendoim. Arminda estava num outro grupo, mas quando Primavera quis entrar para o programa ela resolveu sair do anterior grupo e formar o grupo stop com Primavera que estava passando por um momento dificil na sua vida.Primavera vive na Maxixe mas vende coco em Maputo. Para tal ela precisa alugar uma viatura para transportar o coco de Maxixe para Maputo.

loans.use: The members of this group want to use the money to purchase and transport coconuts and other crops grown in a smallholding to the local market and also to purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth O. is 29 years old.  She is still single, and she has been a leader of a union under LAPO for the past 4 years.  She lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She sells provisions and foodstuff and has been in the business since the year 2004.  She is now requesting a loan of $475 to buy more provisions and foodstuff to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Mrs. Taiwo B. is 32 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Mushin, Lagos State.  She sells cosmetics in her community.  She has been in business since the year 2000 and she is now requesting a loan of $400 to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: "I learned the act of trade from my mother.  I sell provisions and drinks and it has be the source of livelihood of my family," says Mrs. Rosemary I., who is a 30 year old married mother of 4 children living in Benin City.  She has been in this business since 2005 and she is currently a LAPO member.  She is seeking a loan of $250 to buy more provisions and drinks.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess A. is 40 years old, married and has 5 children.  She lives in Benin City where she sells provisions to people living in her community.  She has been in business since 1998 and a LAPO for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $550 to buy more provisions to sell.  She hopes to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "LAPO have really assisted me in my business," says Mrs. Mabel O., who loves to talk about LAPO and the poor women in her community.  According to her, she learned her trade from her auntie whom she stayed with before she opened her business in 1997.  She has been with LAPO for 5 years and is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen Agbon has been a faithful and dedicated LAPO client for the past 3 years.  She sells bags of rice, groundnut oil and palm oil.  She learned this trade from her mother and has been in business since 2004.  She is 39 years old, married, has 3 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She is requesting a loan of $475 to buy more bags of rice, groundnut oil and palm oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, groundnut oil and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "I did not learn my business from anybody but it is a gift from God.  I love creating things, designing and sewing.  I have been in business since 1992," says Osarenkhoe Mabel.  She is 50 years old and married with 6 children.  She lives in Benin City and has her shop in Oba Market, Benin City.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials for sewing and sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro O. is 32 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Benin City.  She sells clothes and sews for people in her community.  She has been in this business since 2004 and has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.  She wishes to buy more clothes to sell as well as tailoring materials.  She hopes to repay her loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a hard working woman who has been a source of help to her family.  Patience is 63 years old, married to Mr. O. and has 5 children.  She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and also sells them to the public.  She is currently a LAPO member and she has been in business since 2000.  "I need a loan of $800 to buy more birds and goats for sale", says Mrs. Patience O.

loans.use: To buy more goats & birds to sell

loans.name: Vefadar

texts.en:
Vefadar K. is a refugee from the Gubadli region, an area of Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in the west part of Azerbaijan. He is 31 years old. He began his business with $300 in 2001, selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs.

During the last three years Vefadar expanded his business very successfully. He opened his own shoe store in the central market. He now needs a loan of $600 to further develop his business by buying more kinds of shoes and opening a goods section. He hopes to increase his business and improve his family’s living condition with this additional income. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of shoes as well as other goods

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: 'Selling artwork is a very good business', says Patience E.. She is 53 years old and married with three (3) children. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and a secretary in  the local LAPO union. She hopse to get the loan of $800 to buy more artwork for sale.

loans.use: To buy more artwork for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Torrez is 28 years old, married, and has four children -- two in high school, one in primary school and one living away from home. She makes a living recycling items such as used drink containers in her town of Villa Cerrito, Paraguay

Vilma moved away from her parents’ home when she was very young and began working at a small stand selling snacks and other convenience items. After doing that for a while, she realized she could make more money recycling, and was one of the first people in her area to go into this line of work. Now she spends her days collecting, sorting and selling recyclable materials such as metal, plastics, aluminum and cardboard, and then carrying them to recycling companies in a horse-drawn cart. In addition to recycling, Vilma also sells fruits and vegetables from this same cart.

Her dream is to be able to save enough money to stop recycling and open a small grocery store, because that would allow her to spend more time at home with her six-year-old son. To do this, she will need to expand her recycling business so that she can save enough money to begin work on her store. She has come to us for a loan to purchase the materials she needs to expand her recycling business and begin building her store.

loans.use: Operating capital to expand her business and open a new store

loans.name: Helen A.

texts.en: Mrs. Helen A. E. is 35 years old. She is married with 5 childre and lives in Benin City of Edo State. She sells recharge cards and local food (Santana). She has been a LAPO member for the past 5 years. She is soliciting for $250 to enable her to buy more recharge cards and cassava for the preparation of  local food (Santana) for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and recharges card  for sale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Mrs. Dorcas O. is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City. She makes clothes for her customers. "I am very happy whenever I makes clothes for people," says Mrs. Dorcas O., who learned about the fashion business for 3 years and started on her own in 2001. She is an LAPO member and needs the loan of $250 to buy more clothes and tailoring material for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring material for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo S. is 32 years old, married and has one son.

Ever since he was a young man, Eduardo has had many different types of jobs. Today, he makes a living for himself and his family going door-to-door selling cleaning supplies such as detergent, fabric softener, bleach, brooms and other articles.

He had been doing this for three years, and is doing well but would like to expand his business by purchasing additional supplies to sell. To make this possible, he has come to us for a loan to purchase new items such as baking soda, distilled water and chlorine.

loans.use: Purchase of items to sell such as baking soda, distilled water, chlorine, etc.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: 'Clothes are what people cannot do without. I started selling clothes in the year 2004', said Miss Joy Edowe who is 27 years old and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is requesting for a loan of $475 to enable her to buy more clothes and jewellery for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and jewellery

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Mrs. Catherine O. is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells medicine to people living in her community. She had 2 years' training before she opened her own business in 1973. She is in need of $625 to enable her to buy more medicine for sale. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Tawai

texts.en: Mrs. Tawai Moshood is 35 years old, she is married with 6 children, and she lives in Benin City. She grinds pepper, beans and tomatoes for people living in her community. She learnt the business from her mother. She is requesting for a loan of $475 to enable her to buy a additional grinding machine and foodstuff for sale so she can help her family.

loans.use: To buy additional machine for granding

loans.name: Francia

texts.en: Mrs. Francia E. is 50 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City. She runs a restaurant. This is a business she learnt from her mother and has been running since 1997. She is in need of $400 to buy more drinks, foodstuff and beef for sale. She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, fried meat and  foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Geralder

texts.en: Mrs. Geralder O. is 25 years old, married and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to people living in her community. She learnt her business for a year before she started her own in the year 2004. She needs $400 loan to buy more provision, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: 'I sell kitchen utensils to people living in my community', says Mrs. E. Joy. She is 35 years and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City. She learnt her business for 3 years and then opened her own in the year 2003. She is seeking for the loan amount of $475 to buy more kitchen utensils for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for sale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: 'I sell drinks to people living in my community and the neighbouring town', says Mrs. Kate O., who is 36 years, married and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City of Edo State. She is a LAPO member and in this business for 3 years. She is in need of $550 to buy more drinks for sale. This, she said, would help her serve her customers better and will equally help her to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Yvonne Aya

texts.en:
A. Aya Yvonne was born in 1964 in the central region of Côte d'Ivoire. Yvonne is a single mother who lives with her 3 children in Yopougon, a crowded township in the northern area of the Abidjan district. Yvonne's cohabitant disappeared in 2002 during the civil war, and his family has not heard from him since then. Yvonne found herself alone with her children and she courageously undertook to work hard to care to them. She has been able to send all of her three children to school and pay for household and school expenses.

She sells hand-crafted pottery and onions in the Yopougon-Sicogi market. Yvonne is a hard worker and honest. She has been very successful, and has taken advantage of the loans she received to improve her family's living conditions in very difficult circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase hand-crafted pottery to sell

loans.name: Ahanuwa

texts.en: Ahanuwa O. is 28 years old, still single and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. She learnt her business from her mother when she was a child; she is in need of $400 loan to buy more provisions and drinks for sales.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista U. is 53 years old, married and has three children and four grandchildren.

She comes from a very poor family, and for the last 35 years has made a living traveling around the country selling clothing while her husband worked in construction. It is not easy to make a living doing this kind of work, but she and her husband have been able to give all of their children a good education because they work so hard.

For some time now, Evangelina has dreamed of opening her own store, selling clothing to the people of her community. She as come to us for a loan that will this dream possible by allowing her to buy the goods she needs to open her store --- items such as trousers, shorts and clothing used by the farmers and other people who live in her area.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her hew clothing store

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 57 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and water and learned her business from her friend and then started on her own in 2002. She is the leader of her union. She is seeking a loan of $475 to buy more provisions and water for sale

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra lives in her own house on Severo Aparicio street in the Nuevo Potosí neighborhood of La Paz with her husband and children. She started sewing when she was very young, originally making "aguayos" (multicolored ponchos) with the help of one of her children.

Then she began to make jackets and sold them to friends and that is how she made herself known in the clothing market. With the funds loaned from Impro, Alejandra bought sewing machines and now makes warm-up suits, jackets, etc. The loan she seeks now is to increase her raw materials and buy another machine as the whole family works in the business now. The client (Alejandra) was interviewed by Aljazeera on Kiva's behalf. In the video produced from the interview one can appreciate Alejandra's work.

Her previous history is good and qualifies Alejandra as a preferred client and she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandra vive en casa propia en la calle Severo Aparicio de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus hijos; desde muy joven se dedico a la costura y originalmente elaboraba aguayos (son ponchos multicolores) con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos.

Posteriormente empezó a confeccionar chamarras y fue ofreciendo a los amigos y fue así como se hizo conocer en el mercado de ropas. Con el capital prestado de Impro, Alejandra compro maquinas y actualmente confecciona deportivos, chamarras etc. El crédito que ahora solicita es para incremento de material y compra de una maquina más ya que trabaja toda la familia. La cliente fue entrevistada por la cadena Aljazeera que hizo un trabajo para Kiva. En el video producido en la entrevista se puede apreciar el trabajo de la cliente.

Su antecedente Histórico es bueno y califica a Alejandra como cliente preferencial y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and raw materials

loans.name: Emilin

texts.en: 'LAPO has not failed me', says Mrs. Emilin O. U. who loves to share her view with others about LAPO. According to her, she learned her trade for a week and then opened on her own in 1997. She is a member of LAPO and secretary of her union. She is 50 years old, married and has 8 children, she lives in Benin City. She needs $400 to buy more plantain and oil for the production of plantain chips.

loans.use: To buy more plantain chips for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris A. is 46 years old, married with 5 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells provisions and drinks to people. She has been in this business since 2005 and needs a $475 loan to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sales. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio is a native of Tayy Loma in Carapegua, is 36-years-old, is single without kids, and lives alone. He makes a living by traveling and selling craftwork like handmade bedspreads and tablecloths, embroidered by the women of Carapegua, an activity that is typical in the region. Dionisio has done this since he was very young because his father did the same type of work. Dionisio would accompany him to make his sales, and this is how he learned the trade and got to know various places that now constitute his work area.

One of the most difficult experiences he has had was when it was discovered that his mother had a very serious illness and needed a very expensive treatment. Because of this, Dionisio traveled to Argentina in search of better work opportunities. He returned several years ago, and with the little savings he had, he bought merchandise to sell once again, traveling to different places and cities.

Dionisio needs this credit for the purchase of bedspreads, tablecloths, embroidered napkins, and shirts, among other things, to make wholesale sales of them, since the demand for these products had increased in the last few months.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Dionisio es oriundo de la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapeguá tiene 36 años de edad es soltero sin hijos y vive sólo.

Se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía como sobrecamas y manteles artesanales, bordados a mano por las mujeres de Carapegua y cuya actividad es típica de la zona. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad ya que su padre se dedicaba a la venta de los mismos y el desde niño lo acompañaba a realizar la venta, fue así como adquirió el oficio y conoció varios lugares que hoy constituye su zona de trabajo.

Una de las experiencias más difíciles que paso fue cuando a su madre le detectaron una enfermedad muy grave y que demandaba un tratamiento muy costoso; a causa de esto, Dionisio, viajo a Argentina (país limítrofe de Paraguay) en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales. Hace unos años volvió, y con un poco de ahorro que le sobro compro mercaderías para venderlas otra vez, recorriendo diferentes lugares y ciudades.

Dionisio necesita el crédito para la compra de sobrecamas, manteles y servilletas bordadas, camisas entre otros para venderlas al por mayor, ya que en los últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads, tablecloths, embroidered napkins, and shirts.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome makes all types of clothes and sells them at the local market. She is married and has three children ages 12, 14, and 18 years old. Her husband works with Salome in her business. Their income is too low to support their family. Salome is very hard-working.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials and expand their business. She proposes to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you. SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Buying new sewing machines

loans.name: Nogossan

texts.en:
Nogossan D. was born in 1980. She is a single mother with 2 children. Both of them go to school. Nogossan takes care to her children alone. Her unique revenue resource is her fruit and legumes business. From this business Nogossan has earned the independence she was looking for from her family. She has been selling various fruits and legumes in the Yopougon-Sicogi market for more than 7 years. She contacted AE&I the first time in June 2005. She received her first loan 3 months later, and she has been an excellent performer since then.

Nogossan wants to purchase goods in bulk from the production field in a village at about 120 kms from her home. This will allow her to get better a price and improve her margin.

loans.use: Nogossan Dosso will use the loan to purchase fruits and legumes in balk

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio A. is married, has one adopted daughter and runs a successful tailoring shop with his wife.

He began working with the Foundation Paraguay nearly 10 years ago.
