In that time, he has received several loans which he used to buy cloth, yarn, thread, buttons, zippers, notions and other items that he needs to make clothing for men and women. There is strong demand for these products in the markets in Limpio and Luque, small towns just outside of Paraguay´s capital city, Asuncion. That's why Patricio has come to us for a new loan of $225 for additional materials he needs to make more clothing for his customers.

We are confident that he will repay the loan because of his work with us in the past. In addition, his daughter is also a client of the foundation -- and through their hard work and careful use of loans received from the foundation, the family has been able to build a good life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, thread, zippers and other items

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
H. Tahir is a 46 year old married man who has three children. He is a farmer. He is from the Lachin region and right now lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2003, when he purchased one cow with money that he had saved up. Last year he bought one more cow and expanded his business.

He would like to receive a $500 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business in order to further improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To acquire 2 small bulls and feed to sustain them

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia owns a beauty salon. She is married and has one child. Her husband works with Mukwano Soap Industries. She has a dream of becoming one of the top hair designers in the city. She is asking for a loan to buy a new dryer and steamer for her business. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING NEW DRYER AND STEAMER

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.en:
Antanacia M. de Torres is a 45 year old woman living with her husband and their three children in Tres de Mayo, Paraguay. Antancia´s husband is a mechanic and helps substantially with the household expenses. Of her three children one has graduated and has a job and home of his own and the other two are in high school.

Antancia has run a despensa out of her home for almost a year. A despensa is very similar to a small grocery. Her store provides a variety of basic staples to the people in her neighborhood. Before opening her despensa she sold fruit. Little by little she augmented her stock and now runs her despensa which offers everything from fruit to meat or sodas and dairy products.

For many years Antanacia was unable to work full time because she was constantly caring for her son who was in and out of hospitals. However, now that her children are older they are more independent.

With the work she puts into her store she has been able to expand quickly. She owns three different refrigeration units each for a separate item; one for drinks, another for meat and another for dairy. Her plan for her store is to continue to expand. With the money that she has asked for she will continue down this path. She tells us that meat is particularly expensive and the money will help her to purchase more.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store, including meat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth owns a retail shop and is married with four children ages 3 years, 9 years, 13 years, and 15 years. Her husband is a jobless man. Ruth is a very creative woman and she struggles for the betterment of her family and society as well. She is asking for a loan of USD 550 to buy a refrigerator for cooling soft drinks to sell at her shop. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months and thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: TO BUYING  REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora Lisis Vasquez is 38 years old, living with her partner of 16 years in Luque, Paraguay. Together Dora Lisis and her partner, Augustin Benitz Perez have three children, two boys and one girl. One of the boys has finished school and the other two, a girl of 13 and boy of 5 are still in school. Her partner currently helps her in her store. He is also working to open a liquor store of his own.

Dora Lisis has run a copetin for the past eight years. A copetin, is a store very much like a deli, where Dora sells breakfast and lunch as well as cigarettes, icecream and other conveniences. For seven years Dora ran her store out closer the city center of Luque but moved to her present location in Asuncion in hope of earning a better weekly profit. In her current location she serves around 50 clients a day, most of which are mechanics working close to her store.

Dora Lisis tells the Foundation that her work is very tedious. She opens her store between 5am and 6am everyday excepting weekends. In order to open in time to serve breakfast she must wake up to buy and prepare food at 3 or 4am. She does not close her store until 8pm. These long hours take a lot out of Dora and keep her from spending more time with her five-year-old.

With the money she has solicited Dora will eventually convert her store from a copetin to a despensa. A despensa is a small grocery which sells household staples such as flour, fruits and bread. She tells us that a despensa would allow her to earn enough money to support her family as well as have more free time.

loans.use: Purchase household staples such as flour, fruits and bread.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is an entrepreneur who owns a small retail shop selling different items. She is a widow and has 4 children. Hawa is in the battle against poverty and for the betterment of her family and society as well. She is asking for a loan to buy a small refrigerator to store products. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Buying a small refrigerator

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is 49 years old, married to Sixto Zarate, and they have 8 children: 7 are married and working while the youngest studies in school.

Previously she worked in a tailor shop and with the time and experience she gained there, she opened her own tailor shop. She began with only one machine and now she has three sewing machines.

Her husband works buying and selling cattle.

Genoveva wants to expand her tailor shop by buying more sewing machines and then she can have more employees thereby providing employment to other people.

With the loan she wishes to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, thread, and fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Genoveva tiene 49 años esta casada con el Sr. Sixto Zarate tienen 8 hijos: 7 están casados trabajan y el menor estudia en el colegio.

Anteriormente la señora trabajaba en un taller de costura y con el tiempo y la experiencia adquirida, ella abrió su propio taller de costura. Ella empezó con una sola maquina y ahora posee tres máquinas de costura.

Su marido se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.

La señora Genoveva quiere ampliar su taller de costura comprando más maquinas de coser y poder contar con más empleados y de esa forma dar también empleo a otras personas.

El préstamo que solicito desea invertirlo en la compra de una maquina de coser, hilos y telas.

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marguerite Kra

texts.en:
Marguerite Kra D. is a 36-year-old woman, and has 4 children. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a crowded suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. For more than 12 years, Marguerite has been selling fruit and legumes in the Yopougon-Sicogi market. She purchases goods in bulk from production fields that are located more than 100 kms from Abidjan.

Her husband is a taxi driver. Marguerite contributes significantly to the household income and her children's education expenses.

Marguerite is energetic and a hard worker. She joined the AE&I microloan program 2 years ago and has been very successful since then. She has benefited from several loans that were repaid on time.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 49 years old and has been a widow for 5 years. She lives in Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She learnt her business from her sister after which she started her own in 2002. She wants a loan amount of $250 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She is also a LAPO member. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 55 years old, a widow with three (3) children and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to people living in her community. She has 5 years' experience in this business and has been a LAPO member for 4 yrs. She is in need of 325 dollars to enable her to buy more provision, foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is 29 years old, married to Diego Cabrera for 8 years, and they have a 7 year old son that goes to elementary school.

Together they work to support their family. They have a cafe (dining room) where they sell all kinds of fast food, soft drinks, and sweets. The business has had a steady clientele for several years. In addition, Laura also sews. In the future she would like to expand her current business and have a clothing store.

She wants her son to continue to study, finish school and pursue studies in the university so that he will have better opportunities in life.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her cafe, such as soft drinks, meat, eggs, oil, ground cracker, and bread for sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Laura tiene 29 años esta casada con el Señor Diego Cabrera hace mas de 8 años, cuentan con un hijo de 7 años que va a la escuela primaria.

Juntos trabajan para mantener la familia, poseen un copetín (comedor) en donde se vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas, gaseosas y golosinas. El negocio ya cuenta con una clientela formada hace varios años, además, ella también se dedica a la confección. Le gustaría poner para el futuro una tienda de ropas y ampliar más su negocio actual.

Desea que su hijo estudie, culmine sus estudios primarios y en el futuro seguir una carrera universitaria que sea de su agrado de modo a obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos para su copetín, tales como gaseosas, carne, huevo, aceite, galleta molida, pan para sándwiches.

loans.use: Purchase soda pop, meat, oil, eggs, ground cracker, bread for sandwiches.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty A. is 55 years old, a widow with 6 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells shoes, bags and creams. She learned her business for a year and then opened on her own in 1973. She is requesting for a $400 loan to enable her to buy more shoes, bags and creams for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and creams for sale

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty EmokpaeI sells drinks to people living in her city. Through this business I support my family financially. Beauty is 35 years old, married with one child. She lives in Benin City and has 5 years experience in her business. She is a LAPO member and she is in need of $400 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Benin City, where she operates a hairdressing saloon. She fixes and braids hair for people, and has been doing this for two years. She is seeking a loang of $250 to enable her to buy more hair products to expand her business. Roseline plans to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more relaxers and hair cream

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Mrs. Theresa Asogwu sells all kinds of bags and it has helped me support my family financially. Theresa is married with 5 children and she is 38 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, and learned her business for 6 months and started her own in 1998. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years; she needs $400 for purchase of bags for sales.

loans.use: To buy more bags for sale

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
When Edwin and Augusta married they left their birth city, Pukará, in search of a better quality of life. Unfortunately it didn't go well for them and they had to return to their city of birth. It was then that Augusta decided to open an artisan workshop with the help of her loving parents. She now tirelessly works every day of the week from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the late afternoon. This work has given them the opportunity to participate in a national artisan contest, winning one of the first places for the beautiful decorative works that they make from clay and plaster. Both Edwin and Augusta are very happy and satisfied, and they wish to improve the quality and variety of their merchandise and variety of paint in order to keep creating the fine adn elegant works of art. Their goal is to continue saving their earning in order to be able to give a better quality of life to their two small children. "We help Edwin and his faithful wife continue to be successful with their beautiful, elegant, and unmatched artisan work."

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que formaron su familia Edwin y Augusta partieron de su pueblo natal Pukará en busca de una mejor calidad de vida, desafortunadamente no les fue muy bien y tuvieron que volver a la tierra que los vió nacer, entonces fue que decidió abrir con apoyo de sus padres que cariñosamente los acogieron un taller de artesanía; trabajo al que ahora se dedican incansablemente desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde durante todos los días de la semana. Esta labor les dio la oportunidad de participar en un concurso nacional de artesanos, obteniendo uno de los primeros lugares por los hermosos trabajos decorativos que realizan a base de arcilla y yeso.Ahora con mucha satisfacción y alegría ambos desean mejorar aún más la calidad y variedad de sus mercaderías y para esto solicitan un préstamo de dinero que lo utilizará en comprar una considerable cantidad y variedad de pintura para seguir realizando los finos y elegantes acabados de su bello arte, a fin de seguir atesorando los beneficios económicos que obtengan para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños niños. “Ayudemos a Edwin y a su fiel esposa a seguir triunfando con su bello, elegante e insuperable trabajo de artesanía”

loans.use: Purchase special paints in order to improve the quality of their beautiful artisan products.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is 70 years old, and is a widow with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells beads and clothes, and has been operating it since 1994. She learned this from her mother. She hopes that, with her loan, she can buy more beads and clothes for sales. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more beads and cloths for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria R. Romero is 49 years old, married with four children and living in Arregua, Paraguay. She lives in her home with her husband, Mario Ruiz Diaz, an army officer and their 10 year old daughter. Arregua is a small and quiet town 40 minutes outside the capital city of Asuncion. It is here that Victoria works running both a copetin and a despensa. 

Victoria has been running her copetin in Arregua since 1975 and is easily an expert in the trade. A copetin is a small stand dedicated to the sale of local fast foods. These include: empanadas, sandwiches, milanesa (breaded chicken) and other such items. She learned to cook and manage the copetin from her mother. Since then, she has bought the stand she now works out of and enjoys a well-established client base.  Her stand, which is directly to the side of the main route running through Arregua serves customers from the nearby school and other regulars from the neighborhood. 

Additionally, Victoria runs a despensa, otherwise referred to as a small grocery in which persons from the neighborhood can pick up common household necessities. These include: flour, drinks, eggs, milk and fruits and vegetables. As of  right now Victoria runs her despensa out of her home. 

The money Victoria receives from both endeavors has allowed her to raise her three boys. Her youngest daughter, 10, still lives at home and thanks to Victoria´s hardwork is able to go to school. With the money she has solicited Victoria will by  merchandise for her copetin.

loans.use: Purchase oil, floor, meat, eggs, fruits and bread

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. owns a restaurant, where she sells drinks and water. She is 63 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She needs $400 to buy more drinks to sell. She has been in business since 1972 and she has been recieving loans from LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and table water for sale

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
In a humble home, in the village of Pukara, we find hardworking and joyful Doña Agustina (64 years old), making her beautiful pottery (pots). She makes them in the traditional manner, out of mud and clay. And, thanks to her nimble and creative hands, her work has enabled her to provide her 3 beloved children a higher education as well as fully meet the needs of her family. Now, despite her advanced age, she remains willing to continue expanding her business by working dilligently in her art. In order to continue realizing her plans, this exemplary woman wants to get a loan to be used fully for the purchase of raw materials (clay and wood), which she will use in the creation of her valuable pots, and thus move her small business forward. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 8 months. Let us support this worthy mother and help her prosper with her noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

En un humilde domicilio del pueblito de Pukará, encontramos muy laboriosa y alegre a doña Agustina de 64 años de edad, realizando sus hermosos trabajos de alfarería (ollas), basados en barro y arcilla, de manera tradicional; gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos esta labor le ha permitido brindarles estudios superiores a sus tres queridos hijos y satisfacer plenamente las necesidades de su familia, ahora, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio y para esto trabaja diligentemente en este bello arte.Para concretar sus planes esta ejemplar mujer desea obtener un préstamo para utilizarlos plenamente en la compra de materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus valiosas y creativas ollitas y así sacar adelante su pequeño negocio, ella promete rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Apoyemos a esta digna madre a prosperar con su noble labor.

loans.use: Purchase of clay and wood to increase her production of pottery.  (Compra de arcilla y leña para incrementar su producción.)

loans.name: Celfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Celfa Rivola Sanchez, 58, is the mother of two children, ages 21 and 14 respectively. The older of the two is in college and the younger is in the 8th grade at the city high school of San Ignacio. Celfa, her husband and her two children live together in their own house.

Celfa owns a copetín, or a small luncheonette and grocery store. She opened her store 10 years ago with the money she saved by working outside Paraguay for a period of time. She works hard daily to ensure the proper maintenance of her store. Her husband also assists her. Her store is located centrally in San Ignacio and for this reason receives a good number of customers. At her lunch counter she sells empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, drinks and deserts. She has asked for a loan in order to buy a freezer so that she can increase the number of drinks and frozen goods she sells during the summer months. In this way she hopes to increase the traffic in her restaurant and grocery and thereby increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en: Mr. Vitalis N. is 35 years old.  He is married with 3 children, and he lives in Benin City.  He rides motorbikes for a business.  He started his own in 2003. He is a LAPO member. He needs $400 so he can buy a new bike. He promises to repay within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more additional bikes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria L. lives in her parent's home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her three children; Maria works for herself, making pants and warm-up suits that she sells to retail merchants in the city.

She has a bedroom, a small kitchen and a precarious bathroom. As she lacks space, Maria has put her sewing shop in her bedroom, resulting in an uncomfortable situation for her and her sons to do her work.

The loan she seeks is to refurbish a room that is deteriorating in order to use it as a tailor shop. This is the first time that she seeks a loan and the socioeconomic analysis resulted in a favorable score and she can obtain a loan. The social vision of our institution applies perfectly to this case and is an important factor in the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria L. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos; la señora Maria trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando pantalones y buzos deportivos que vende a comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad.

Actualmente tiene un dormitorio, una cocina pequeña y un baño precario. Por la falta de espacio, la señora tiene instalado el taller de costura en su dormitorio, ocasionándole incomodidad tanto en su desempeño laboral, como a sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de una habitación que se encuentra deteriorada para utilizarla como taller de costura. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. La visión social de nuestra institución se aplica perfectamente y es un factor importante en la resolución de crédito.

loans.use: Refurbish a room in order to use it as a tailor shop

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en: Mr. Vitalis N. is 35 years old.  He is married with 3 children, and he lives in Benin City.  He rides motorbikes for a business.  He started his own in 2003. He is a LAPO member. He needs $400 so he can buy a new bike. He promises to repay within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more additional bikes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Mr. Osigbemhe Susan is 33 years old, married with 3 children, lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and vegetables to people living in her town. She learned her business for 6 months and started her 2005. She is a LAPO member. She is in need of $250 to enable her to buy more provisions and vegetables for sales. She very much appreciates this loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and vegetable for sale

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelo C. lives in his own house in the Villa Mercedes zone of El Alto city. He lives with his wife and two kids and works as a caretaker in a school in the city of La Paz. His wife works at a kiosk in the same location. With the five credits they received before from IMPRO Marcelo and his wife were able to accomplish the hard construction of six rooms, all with a cement structure and brick walls. They also finished two other rooms - the ones that they actually live in. The loan Marcelo requests will be directed towards the construction of the four rooms that remain to be completed. This is the sixth time that he is requesting credit and based on a socioeconomic analysis he favorably qualifies and is able to repay a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marcelo C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Mercedes de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y su dos hijos; el señor Marcelo trabaja como portero en una escuela de la ciudad de La Paz, y la esposa atiende un kiosco en la misma unidad educativa. Con los cinco créditos anteriores concedidos por IMPRO, Marcelo y su esposa realizaron la construcción de seis habitaciones en obra gruesa, es decir estructura de cemento y muros de ladrillo, y concluyó dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que actualmente ocupan. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de las cuatro habitaciones restantes. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To complete the finished work of 4 rooms in order to live better

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: “To support my family standards of living, I sell provisions, drinks, and recharge cards at my shop” says Ruth O.. Ruth is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. Ruth is looking for a loan of $250 to provide a wider range of products to sell at her shop, and better support her family and children.

loans.use: To buy more provision, drinks & recharge card for sale

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky E. is 42 years old, married mother of 6 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a leader in one of LAPO union and has been in business since 2002. She sells wine and makes call for people in her area. She hopes to get a loan of $625 to enable her buy more wine and recharge cards for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cartoons of wine and cards for call

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: A successful businesswoman, who has the ambition to increase the worth of her business, Mrs. Kemi B. is a fashion designer and also sells clothes to her customer. She is 42 years of age and has three children. She hopes to expand her business with the loan that can hopefully be given to her. She has 14 years of experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Alberto Félix

texts.es:
The responsibility with which they work and the service they bring to their clients, are the principal characteristics of Alberto's well-known printing shop and his family's work.

Alberto is 53 years old, and ever since he married Paulina, he decided to open up a printing shop. They used to run this shop in the city of Arequipa, but later decided to move it to the city of Juliaca. With the help and dedication of their 4 children (all adolescents), little by little the small shop grew due to the requests and needs of their many clients. At present, it is one of the busiest print shops in their city, and it is for this reason that this printing family wishes to improve their services to meet with the great number of requests and solicitations they're receiving. To this end, Señor Alberto would like to receive a loan, which he will use to purchase materials of good quality (paper and ink). He promises to reimburse the loan amount within a period of 6 months.

With your help, Alberto and his family, will be able to find the means that they have proposed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La responsabilidad con la que trabajan y el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, son las principales características por la que es conocida la imprenta del señor Alberto y su emprendedora familia.Alberto de 53 años de edad, desde que se casó con Paulina, su fiel esposa decidió abrir una imprenta, taller que en un principio funcionaba en la ciudad de Arequipa, pero que por cuestiones familiares decidieron trasladarla a la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora con apoyo y dedicación de sus cuatro hijos ya adolescentes el pequeño taller fue implementándose poco a poco y obteniendo gran cantidad de clientes y pedidos; en estos momentos es una de las imprentas más concurridas de su ciudad y es por esa razón que esta emprendedora familia desea ampliar e implementar aún más su pequeño taller para cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos y solicitudes.Para llevar a cabo este hecho el señor Alberto desea obtener un préstamo que utilizará para adquirir materia prima (papel, tinta) prometiendo reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Con vuestra ayuda Alberto y su familia podrán conseguir la meta que se han propuesto.

loans.use: To purchase ink and paper to satisfy the needs and requests of their dear clients. (Compra de tinta y papel para satisfacer las necesidades y pedidos de sus queridos clientes.)

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Florinda Gimenz is a married 47-year-old with three children living in Mariano Roque Alonso, just outside of the Capital city of Asunción, Paraguay. She is employed by a cellular telephone store. Through her work there she contributes to the family income. Florinda was a mother of four, however, a tragic car accident claimed the life of one of her children. She is currently caring for a girl of 12; the other two children are grown and live independently.

Sra. Florinda has had a convenient store for the past thirteen years. She store is named “8 de Diciembre”. This is the date of the memorial for the Virgin of Caacupe, the patron Saint of Paraguayans. She began her shop with the small amount of money she had been able to obtain. The store started out as a small stand made of wood. Later, she was able to obtain a group loan, which she used to enlarge her store from a small stand to a full convenient store. In addition to running this store, Florinda also works a number of odd jobs on the side. She is a dynamic hard-working individual.

She wants to further expand her business by opening a branch of her despensa that sells notions and gifts. The client-base she has already established would be well served by such a store. Especially since Florinda is already so well liked in the neighborhood.

The credit she ask will go towards buying merchandise for her despensa, including: sugar, yerba mate (tea), pasta, breads, sodas and more.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, tea, pasta, breads, sodas and more

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen I. is 42 years old, and a married mother of 6 children.  She lives in Benin City.  She sells iron pots, plate, plastic and rubber in the villages market. She has been doing this since 1984 and has a member of LAPO for the past 4 years. She needs $400 to buy more pots, plates to sell.  She wishes to thank those who lend.

loans.use: To buy more iron pot, plate, cooler and plastic rubber for sale

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
The opportunities to get ahead in life are often times within reach for those that know how to take advantage of them. This is a very common saying in the life of Antolina, who works hard each day for the well-being of her four little children. It's because of them that she has decided to opt for keeping her family together, in spite of the immense effort that this takes.

For a long time, her husband worked away from home as a construction worker and one day, because of his great desire to learn, he decided to work under a recognized master baker in his city and learn to how to makes bread. The constant trips that he took brought much sadness to his young children. For that reason, they both decided to open a bakery in their small home, after seeing the need in their neighborhood. Three months have already gone by since their family has been together and Antolina has been enjoying this very much. Although the sacrifice to produce the breads is very arduous, she feels very happy to be with her husband.

They begin making the bread at three in the morning and then later, distribute it to the stores in their neighborhood. Antolina also has a second job, working in an ice-cream factory. Although now, because of decreased temperatures that are occuring every day, the demand (for ice cream) has diminished considerably. However, she will continue to work hard to earn the money that will allow her to sustain her children. To reach this goal, she wishes to increase the production of bread even more and to improve their little bakery by obtaining a machine that will allow her to increase the quality of production of their delicious and exquisite breads.

Because of this, she has come to these integral people (Microfinanzas PRISMA), so that she can obtain this loan that she so yearns for to make her projects a reality. Help her - your support is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Las oportunidades para salir adelante están muchas veces al alcance de los que saben aprovecharlas, este es un dicho muy común en la vida de Antolina, que cada día trabaja diligentemente por el bien de sus cuatro hijos pequeños y es por ellos que ha decidido optar por mantener a la familia unida a pesar del inmenso esfuerzo que eso significa.Hace tiempo atrás su esposo trabajaba fuera de su tierra natal como obrero de construcción y un día con sus enormes deseos de aprender decidió ponerse bajo las ordenes de un reconocido maestro panadero de su ciudad y aprendió a elaborar panes, los constantes viajes que realizaba mantenían con mucha tristeza a sus pequeños y es por esta razón que ambos decidieron abrir una panadería en su pequeña casa después de observar esa insatisfecha necesidad en su localidad.Ya pasaron tres meses desde que Antolina goza de su unión familiar aunque el sacrificio de elaborar los panes sea muy arduo, ella se siente muy feliz de estar al lado de su esposo elaborándolos desde las tres de la madrugada para luego repartirlos en las tiendas de su localidad. De manera paralela a este negocio, Antolina, también está dedicándose a la fabricación de helados aunque ahora por las bajas temperaturas que se presentan diariamente su demanda a disminuido considerablemente. Sin embargo ella seguirá adelante para obtener las ganancias que le permitan sostener a sus hijos y para este propósito desea incrementar aún más su producción y mejorar su pequeño taller de panadería para obtener una máquina que le permita elaborar con mayor calidad sus deliciosos y exquisitos panes; es por ello que acude a aquellas personas solidarias para que pueda obtener la tan ansiada suma y hacer realidad sus proyectos.. Ayúdala tu aporte es muy importante.

loans.use: Increase of captial to purchase a machine to ease and increase production of bread for her bakery.

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es:
24274 Melquíades is a responsible father who has always watched over his family’s financial security, which allows to cover their basic needs and the education of his four beloved children. He accomplishes this by means of his agricultural activities. Melquíades cultivates his lands and cares for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small stretch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few plots of land. Nowadays, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns 20 hectares and two cows to fatten and sell at the local market. He makes his income at the time of harvest. He holds high hopes for the present season and wishes to continue making an effort to secure wellbeing and save the money needed to afford the treatment which will alleviate his wife's eye health issues. Melquíades is requesting a loan towards these ends and thank you for your disposition to collaborate with him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Melquíades es un padre responsable que siempre ha velado por mantener a su familia con una seguridad económica que les permita cubrir sus necesidades básicas y la educación de sus cuatro queridos hijos; esto lo hace intensamente a través de su labor agrícola. Diariamente Melquíades se dedica al cultivo de sus tierras y al cuidado de sus animales. Recuerda claramente cuando decidió independizarse con un pequeño número de animales de ganado y sus pequeñas tierras; cuando contrajo matrimonio, tenía en su poder pocos terrenos de cultivo y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, cuenta con 20 hectáreas y con 2 vacas, para engordarlas y luego comercializarlas en el mercado local. Las ganancias son obtenidas en tiempo de cosecha y para esta temporada él tiene grandes anhelos y deseos de seguir esforzándose por lograr bienestar y acumular el dinero suficiente que le permita realizar el tratamiento médico para aliviar la salud visual de su esposa. Melquíades solicita un préstamo para estos fines y agradece tu disposición de colaborar con él y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to increase production and afford the medical treatment of his beloved wife.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
Gladys has dedicated herself to agriculture for the past 22 years. Since she started her home next to her beloved husband, she wished to offer the best to the children to come. Years later, Gladys still works for that reason and because she enjoys cultivating the land. She gets up very early every day to tend to her usual chores in the field, in company of her inseparable partner during sowing season. The harsh cold weather that impacts the sierras of her country has damaged her crops in previous years and the expected income has always been affected. Nonetheless, she wishes to maintain the hopes of increasing her income with this activity, in order to see her six children prosper. For this reason she is thinking of increasing her selection of crops with a greater variety of seeds. Gladys is requesting a loan in order to meet her goals and thanks you for your collaboration. In order to provide the best to her children, she will continue working with great effort and love.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys ya lleva 22 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Desde que formalizó su hogar al lado de su querido esposo, deseó ofrecerle lo mejor a los hijos que vendrían; ahora, pasados los años, Gladys sigue trabajando por esta razón y porque cada día le agrada labrar la tierra. Siempre se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a sus acostumbradas labores en el campo, en compañía de su inseparable socio en épocas de siembra. El fuerte frío que azota la sierra de su país ha perjudicado su cosecha en años anteriores y las ganancias que pensaban obtener siempre se han visto perjudicadas. Sin embargo quiere seguir manteniendo la esperanza de incrementar sus ingresos económicos con esta actividad, para ver a sus seis hijos totalmente superados y es por ello que piensa ampliar sus productos de siembra con mayor variedad de semillas. Gladys solicita un préstamo para cumplir sus anhelos y agradece tu colaboración y, para darle lo mejor a sus hijos, seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y amor.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity and variety of seeds in order to optimize the quality of her crops.

loans.name: Catalina De Los Sant

texts.es:
This woman is from the city of Managua. She started her business in the outskirts of the market 14 years ago with a modest working capital of $80.00, money that she saved through her hard work selling cigarettes on the streets. She started her business when she realized that she would not be able cover her and her children's needs.

When she started her business she didn't sell many products and the conditions in her shop weren't great because she started in a modest, small kiosk. Thanks to her hard work and perseverence and after much sacrifice, she was able to refurbish her store and pay for her children's education.

She now offers a wide variety of products. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 3 years and has a record of 13 loans, which have helped her because thanks to the funding she has prospered.

Esta señora es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio empieza en las afueras del mercado 14 años con un modesto capital de trabajo de US$80.00, fruto de sus ahorros que logro reunir con mucho esfuerzo cuando vendia cigarrillos de manera ambulante en las calles. Ella inicia el negocio al observar que no lograba cubrir las necesidades propias y de sus hijos.

Dicho negocio contaba con apenas algunos productos y las condiciones del local no eran las apropiadas ya que empezo en un modesto y pequeño kiosko. Como fruto de su esfuerzo y perseverancia con mucho sacrificio logró acondicionar el local y darles educación a sus hijos.

Ella ahora oferta una amplia variedad de productos. Trabaja con CEPRODEL, desde hace 3 años con un record de 13 creditos, lo cual le ha beneficiado porque gracias al financiamiento ha logrado prosperar.

loans.use: To purchase products to stock up on inventory

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino is a hard working person and he makes an effort to give his 5 beloved kids the best. He decided to stay in his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. He would now like to extend his cultivated lands and would also like to be able to offer a public transport service to to his beloved community while he keeps working hard on his lands with the loan that he will intelligently invest in buying seeds, fertilizers and animal feed. Paulino thanks you very much for your love of the prodigal.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Paulino, es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para brindarle lo mejor en sus cinco queridos hijos, decidió quedarse en su tierra natal para poder desarrollarse y ahora se entrega diariamente y con mucho cariño a las tareas del campo que realiza diariamente cuando labra la tierra y cría a sus animales.Por el trabajo diligente que realiza ahora ha extendido sus terrenos de cultivo y piensa iniciar a ofrecer sus servicios transporte público en un moto taxi a la población de su querida comunidad; mientras tanto seguirá trabajando arduamente en sus campos de cultivo para ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia con un préstamo que invertirá inteligentemente en la compra de semillas, abonos y alimento para sus animales. Paulino te agradece tu gran amor hacia el prójimo.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and animal food so that they can accoplish their dream of driving their neighbours about in motorbike taxis/Compra de semillas, abonos y alimentos para sus queridos animalitos con el objetivo de iniciar a construir sus sueños de transportar a sus vecinos en un moto taxi.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a very brave woman who after years of hard work selling countless articles of hardware, has come away reaping many benefits. This is despite the fact that in the beginning she sold many heavy items, which was difficult for her to handle. But with the passage of time and her immense effort (she has always been dedicated to her work), she has increased her products and her business now has a place in the formal sector due to their inventory of construction products. Delia's dream has always been to maintain a steady and secure income in order to meet the financial demands of her family, and now this reality has brought many joys to her children and to herself. She is now requesting a loan to be able to increase the quantity and variety of her products and in turn enable her family to prosper in the dreams they have or hope to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Delia, es una mujer valiente, tras los años de labor intensa de venta de innumerables artículos de ferretería, viene cosechando muchas satisfacciones a pesar de que en sus inicios ofrecía estos artículos tan pesados de manera ambulante, sin embargo con el paso de los años y el inmenso esfuerzo que siempre le ha dedicado a su trabajo ha incrementado sus productos de su negocio y ahora cuenta con un lugar formal en el que ofrece sus variados productos de construcción.Su sueño siempre ha sido mantener un espacio seguro de ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades que demanda su hogar y ahora esta realidad le está otorgando muchas alegrías a sus hijos y también a ella.Solicita un préstamo para posibilitar la prosperidad su hogar a través del incremento de la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que ofrece a fin de que su querida familia sobresalga en cada actividad que deseen o planeen realizar.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of products for sale in her construction supplies store.  (Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor variedad y cantidad de artículos para el pequeño centro de ventas de artículos de construcción.)

loans.name: Gloria Eusebia

texts.es:
Gloria is a brave woman who possesses fortitude. For years, she worked hard to sell food and now, she has a small convenience store in her own house. She runs this business in hopes of a better future for her family. She wants to continue working to see her four children who are already separated from her. She lives for the idea of always being there for her children when they need her. Currently, she works intensely to support her youngest child who is 11 years old and her only companion. Her other three children already support themselves and live in other cities. She requests a loan for her store and the various initiatives she has in mind for this business. We are grateful, from this moment onwards, for your great willingness and wish to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Gloria, es una mujer valiente y con mucha fortaleza; hace años atrás se dedicaba al comercio de alimentos y ahora en la actualidad tiene en su propia casa una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de primera necesidad con la que mantiene la esperanza de obtener un futuro mejor para ofrecérselos a su familia.Ella quiere seguir trabajando para ver a sus cuatro hijos ya superados y es por ello que se desvive con la idea de estar siempre presente cuando sus hijos la solicitan; ahora se dedica intensamente a sostener a su último pequeño de 11 años que es su única compañía ya que sus tres hijos ya se sostienen y radican en otras ciudades.Solicita un préstamo para implementar su pequeño espacio de ventas y los proyectos de negocio que tiene en mente. Te agradecemos desde ya tus grandes deseos de ayudarla.

loans.use: Use the loan to increase the quantity and variety of products in her store's inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth Elena

texts.es:
Elizabeth has a strong desire to overcome her situation, and wants to be able to provide her children with a successful future. To this end, she opened a store a year and a half ago. She works in this small shop every day and although she has expanded her inventory, sales have fallen considerably. Elizabeth, does not lose hope and continues to move forward with this business for the welfare of her three beloved children. She feels very motivated and satisfied and holds in her heart all her future plans that are aimed at improving the economic situation of her family. Each day she meets her demanding role as mother and also plays an important part in meeting the finances of her home. She wishes to continue working to acquire a greater number of products to increase profits for the benefit of their children, which are her constant motivation. This is why Elizabeth is applying for a loan to invest in her small shop. Profits generated by sales will increase her children's educational opportunities.

Help Elizabeth and your kindness will be greatly rewarded.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, tiene grandes deseos de superación y quiere obtener para sus hijos un futuro que les otorgue éxitos; así como pieza importante para conseguir sus sueños aperturó una tienda hace un año y medio para formalizar sus ventas y labor ya que antes se dedicaba al comercio de manera ambulante. Con el empeño que ella le otorga día a día a su pequeña tienda está creciendo y aunque las ventas han bajado considerablemente, Elizabeth, no pierde las esperanzas de seguir adelante y continuar con este negocio para bienestar de sus tres queridos hijos. Ella se siente muy motivada y satisfecha y alberga en su corazón planes a futuro que están orientadas a mejorar la situación económica de su familia.Día a día cumple con su exigente rol de madre y también forma parte importante de la economía de su hogar. Desea seguir trabajando para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y mayores ganancias en beneficio de sus hijos que siempre la motivan a hacerlo, es por ello que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en su pequeña tienda y con las ganancias que genere la venta de sus productos incrementar el nivel educativo de sus hijos.Apoya a Elizabeth, tu bondad será recompensada grandemente.

loans.use: To purchase essential goods to supply at competative prices within her region.  (Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad a fin de ofertarlos a un precio competente) dentro de su localidad.

loans.name: Santos Hilario

texts.es:
This man is a widow and the head of his family. He started his small business selling onions and potatoes about 20 years ago. His business is located in the market in the city of Managua.

Santos Hilario is a hardworking man who has always looked for ways to help his children succeed. So far he has been able to do so paying for his children's education and showing them that work, no matter what you do, is honorable.

When Santos started this business his location was much worse, but little by little he has been able to furbish his location and also offer more comfort to his clientele.

Thanks to the support from CEPRODEL, Santos has been able to increase his daily income and cover his basic needs. Santos has been borrowing from CEPRODEL for three hears and has an excellent borrowing record (20 loans).

Este señor es viudo y jefe de familia. Inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de cebollas y papas hace alrededor de 20 años. El local está ubicado el mercado mayoreo de la ciudad de managua.

Santos Hilario ha sido un hombre luchador que siempre ha buscado como sacar adelante a sus hijos, a la fecha lo ha logrado dandoles educacion y demostrandoles que el trabajo no importa cual sea es dignificante.

Cuando Santos comenzo este negocio las condiciones del local eran pesimas, sin embargo oco a poco, granito a granito a logrado ir acondicionando el local, logrando asi atender a su clientela mas comodamente.

Gracias al apoyo brindado por CEPRODEL Santos ha logrado incrementar sus ganancias diarias y con esto cubrir sus necesidades basicas. Desde hace tres años Santos pertenece al grupo de clientes de CEPRODEL con un record crediticio excelente (20 creditos).

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock up on inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Ms. Julia R. is 68 years old and living in a small house in the city of Mariano Roque Alonson with her daughter. Years ago, Julia took a class in party planning and decoration where she learned how to prepare for celebrations such as birthdays or weddings. She makes bags and wallets that are often used for large parties or festivals as prizes for various games and contests.

Julia learned to use recycled material such as, cardboard or magazines in addition to yarn, to make these items. Julia can make imitations of nearly any type of wallet. Often she lines her crafts with magazines pages that have pictures of famous people of Paraguay or other parts of the world. She uses the wallets that her daughter or she buys at the market as models for her own creations. She chooses the type of wallet that attracts the most attention and then designs them using paper. Later she gives them the form of their respective materials.

With the credit that she is asking, Julia, is preparing for a well-known Paraguayan holiday, the Festival of Caacupe which is on the 8th of December which takes place in the city of Caacupe.

loans.use: purchase material to make wallets and bags.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a hard working person, always dedicated to give the best to his family and assuming his role as a responsible and devoted father. For years, he has been working in factories that produce roofing tiles, but not too long ago he decided to start his own business. Because of this, now he buys tree trunks that he chops by himself with an ax and then sells them as bulk wood in a market in the area. He works hard everyday, not only for supporting his five children, but also as an honest effort in order to provide his family with a safe and comfortable home. Marco Antonio is a good example of a responsible father, always looking after his family’s welfare. He is not satisfied with what he gives them, he wants the best. This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy more trunks and, with the profits, keep providing for his family. Help Marco Antonio so he can continue his efforts in order to give the best to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco Antonio, es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre se ha empeñado por dar lo mejor a su familia, asumiendo responsablemente su rol tan abnegado de padre, desde hace años se ha dedicado a trabajar en fábricas de elaboración de tejas, pero hace poco se decidió a tener su propio negocio y es por ello que ahora se dedica a comprar troncos de madera para luego él mismo cortarlas con un hacha a fin de venderlos como leña al por mayor en el mercado de su zona.Cada día trabaja esforzadamente porque no sólo quiere mantener a sus cinco hijos sino darles un buen ejemplo de trabajo esforzado de manera correcta para adquirir en un futuro con este esfuerzo un terreno para otorgarles una morada segura y cómoda a sus hijos.Marco Antonio es un buen ejemplo de padre responsable que siempre busca el bienestar de su familia y no se conforma con darles lo que tiene, quiere darles lo mejor, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar más troncos y con las ganancias seguir sosteniendo a su familia.Apoya a Marco Antonio a seguir adelante con sus anhelos de darle lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital for obtaining additional tree trunks in order to supply wood for food cooking from his demanding clientele.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manual is a man that little by little reaches his goals through being perseverant and at the same time, dedicated. Thanks to his own strengths and the desire to provide a better future for his family, he has been able to move from being a simple salesman to becoming his own boss.

Approximately 2 years ago he rented a place which had terrible conditions and was very deteriorated and there, he started his business. His initial investment was $533.00.

Manual has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and his record is 9 loans. WIth the financing granted, he bought his business location, making him successful. For Manual, CEPRODEL is an ally to his progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Manuel es un hombre que poco a poco alcanzo su objetivo siendo perseverante y a la vez dedicado. Gracias a su propio esfuerzo y las ganas de luchar por darle un futuro meor a su familia lo llevaron de ser un simple vendedor a ser su propio jefe.

Hace aproximadamente dos años rento un local el cual estaba en pesimas condiciones, muy deteriorado y ahi empezo su negocio. Su capital inicial de inversion fue de US$533.00.

Manuel trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y su record es de 9 creditos. Con el financiameinto otorgado compro el local y le ha realizado. Para Manuel CEPRODEL es un aliado de su progreso.

loans.use: Purchase of hundredweights (packages of 100 kilograms) of basic grains

loans.name: Zenobia Alberta

texts.en:
Mrs. Zenobia, has always been linked to farming activities. She was born and was raised in a 100% agricultural and livestock farming family. After many years of learning, she has acquired a lot of experiential knowledge that has been quite effective when it comes to taking care of her farming activities, especially raising small farm animals. She is a woman with a good sense of humor and lots of optimism in life. These qualities made her a key figure in her family during times of hardship and lack of money when they lost their crops after a huge cold wave that affected their harvest. They also had to endure other difficult decisions as a family. Currently she has big projects in mind; she is planning to venture into planting peas and she is preparing her land for crops. In the meantime she is firmly dedicated to breed small farm animals such as hens and guinea pigs in order to support her family, while her husband works as a mason. Mrs. Zenobia, gets up everyday embracing the opportunity to prepare her three children still under her care (of which she had nine) with energy and motivation for life. This is why she is asking for a loan that will be invested in improving her small farm by purchasing small farm animals, manure and pea seeds. Give your support to this strong-willed woman so she can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zenobia, siempre ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas, nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora y ganadera y tantos años de aprendizaje la han dotado de conocimientos, aunque empíricos muy certeros para el desempeño de sus labores agrícolas, sobre todo el de la crianza de animales menores.Ella es una mujer que tiene un buen sentido del humor y mucho optimismo para seguir adelante, estas cualidades la han llevado a ser un miembro de gran fortaleza para su familia en momentos difíciles y de escasez económica cuando perdieron sus cosechas por la inmensa ola de frío que cayó sobre sus tierras de cultivo y otras de tensas decisiones que tuvieron que afrontar como familia.Hoy tiene grandes proyectos en mente, piensa incursionar en el cultivo de arveja y por ello esta preparando la tierra para su cultivo, mientras tanto ella se está dedicando férreamente a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para sostener a su familia, mientras que su esposo se dedica a ser un obrero de albañilería, Doña Zenobia, se motiva cada día con el afán de preparar para que enfrenten la vida con mucha fuerza y entereza a tres de sus nueve hijos que todavía están en su poder.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo que los invertirá en la mejora de su pequeña granja de animales menores y en la compra de abono y semillas de arveja.Apoya a esta mujer de gran fortaleza a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Improving a little area for breeding and buying pea seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jose Pilar

texts.es:
Don D., as he’s called by those who know him, has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without the daily bread. For a long time he dedicated himself to agriculture, saving little by little, until he managed to start a business selling tomatoes.

With a starting capital of US $ 25, which he accrued with great effort, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 25 years ago, in order to support his parents. He initially established his business at outdoor premises that lacked protection and were unsuitable for any kind of business. Nonetheless, D. set his mind to condition it and, according to his capacity, he has improved it little by little. To this date, he is the only support of his son and father.

For the past 2 years, CEPRODEL has been part of the progress in D.’s business, providing him with the needed capital at the right time. This collaboration between the financial institution and the client is what has made this business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don D., como es llamado por las personas que lo conocen, sin duda alguna ha sido un hombre trabajador que se las ha ingeniado desde muy joven para que a su familia nunca le falte el pan de cada día. Se dedicó mucho tiempo a la agricultura, ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr comenzar con un negocio de venta de tomates.

Hace 25 años él tomó esta iniciativa para poder sustentar a sus padres, y comenzó con un capital de US$25.00, que le costó reunir y que logró gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación. El local donde inicialmente colocó su negocio era al aire libre, sin ninguna protección y sin condición alguna para un negocio. Sin embargo D. se propuso acondicionarlo según sus capacidades, y poco a poco lo ha mejorado. A la fecha él es el sustento de su hijo y su padre.

CEPRODEL ha sido parte de este avance en el negocio de D. desde hace 2 años, brindándole el financiamiento necesario en el momento oprtuno. Este trabajo en conjunto (Institución Financiera-Cliente) es lo que ha llevado a prosperar el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 65 years old and is married to Mr. Humberto García. They both have 3 grown up children who are also married and no longer live with them.

Mrs. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez owns a PULPERIA. She has over 30 years of experience in the business. Her clientele are children, men and women of all ages who prefer her store because of the diversity of products she carries.

Mrs. Méndez needs to buy:
Units Concept Cost(USDs)
1 Quintal Rice $38
1 Quintal Sugar $27
1 Quintal Flour $37
1 Bidon Oil $22
2 Boxes Soap $18
2 Docen Soap bars $10
2 Boxes Salsa Natura $8
1 Pack Clorine $10
1 Big bag Detergent $11
1 Big bag Toilet paper $7
3 Docen Tooth paste $24
2 Boxes Soups $20
2 Docen Salsa Lizano $18
1 Docen Numar Butter $10
1/2 Docen Chicken Broth $5
1 Box Tang $2
2 Docen Spaghetti $8
1 Box Kola Shale $16

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 65 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Humberto García ambos tienen 3 hijos adultos y casados ya no viven con la pareja. La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. Méndez es propietaria de una pulpería, tiene más de 30 años de experiencia, sus clientes son niños, hombre y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por vender diversidad de productos. La Sra. Méndez necesita comprar 1quintal de arroz el quintal cuesta $38.00 dólares, 1 quintal de azúcar el quintal cuesta $27.00 dólares, 1 quintal de harina el quintal cuesta $27.00 dólares, 1 bidón de aceite $22.00 dólares el bidón, 2 cajas de jabón de lavar $9.00 dólares cada caja, 2 docenas de jabón de baño $5.00 cada docena, 2 cajas de salsa natura $4.00 dólares cada caja, 1 paca de cloro $ 10.00 dólares cada paca, 1 bolsón de detergente $11.00 dólares el bolsón, 1 bolsón de papel higiénico $7.00 dólares el bolsón, 3 docena de pasta de diente $8.00 cada docena, 2 cajas de sopas $ 10.00 dólares cada caja,2 docena de salsa lizano $9.00 dólares cada docena, 1 docena de mantequilla numar $10.00 dólares la docena, 1/2 docena de consomé $5.00 dólares la media docena, 1 caja de tang $2.00 dólares la caja, 2 docenas de espagueti $4.00 dólares la docena, 1 caja de kola shale $ 16.00 dólares la caja.

loans.use: Purchasing of rice, sugar, flour, oil, soaps, tooth paste, detergents, soups, pasta, salsas, butter, chicken broth, toilet paper, clorine, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita, is a woman who works very happily, she spends as much time as possible in her small shop attending to all the residents of her community. She has four sons whom she adores and tries to give them everything they need. However, recently she went through one of the biggest scares of her life - her youngest son (only seven years old) fell on the farm and unfortunately on one of the machetes they use to cut their crops. This resulted in a very deep cut to his small stomach, and he had to be urgently transferred to the hospital in the city of Merced, where he was hospitalized for a week. As a result of this unexpected tragic accident Margarita had to incur various expenses due to the hospitalization of her son. This is why she has asked for a loan to help them improve their sales and bring in more business. You can help make this family live as happily and united as before.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Margarita, es una mujer que trabaja muy alegremente, le dedica el mayor tiempo posible a su pequeña tienda a la que concurren todos los pobladores de su comunidad en busca de los artículos que necesitan diariamente. Ella tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son su adoración y a los que les brinda todo cuanto pueda tener, sin embargo una mañana pasó por uno de sus mayores sustos y preocupaciones, su menor hijo de tan sólo siete años cayó en su chacra y por desgracia sobre el machete que utilizan para cortar sus productos que por su naturaleza ocasionó un corte muy profundo en el estómago del pequeño, quién tuvo que ser trasladado con urgencia al hospital de la ciudad de la Merced en donde recibió atención y estuvo internado por una semana. A consecuencia de este inesperado accidente Margarita tuvo que realizar diversos gastos frente a la hospitalización de su pequeño hijo para su pronta recuperación y bienestar.Es por eso que pide y solicita un préstamo que les ayude a mejorar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos y recuperarse de esta terrible tragedia.Tú puedes hacer que esta familia siga viviendo tan feliz y unida como hasta ahora..

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell in her small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.pt:
David Fernando E. was born in Maputo on the 10th of October 1978. His is 29 years old and studied through the 9th grade. He supports 5 people (even though he lives with just 3) and is married. He grew up and lived the majority of his life with his mother and siblings. While he was a student in his free time he took classes in tailoring and practiced karate. For the last 10 years he has been working as a tailor; sewing and doing emboidery. He also gives sewing classes and is a sewing machine repair technician. He employs three people, one with 5 children, another with 2 and the last with one. With the loan for 12,000MT he plans to purchase fabric, thread and dyes. He runs the business out of his home which enables him to open the shop at 8:00 and work for 16 hours. His employees come using public transportation, some travling a great distance. The raw materials are purchased in Maputo or in South Africa, and transported on public busses. Summer is his high season since his customers re-sell his goods in open air markets or on the beaches where domestic and foreign tourists can shop and buy his products. The average weekly income is 3,000MT - and he has a system to record the purchase of raw materials, good produced and goods sold. His business is currently doing well and provides a monthly return of 10,000MT which he uses to care for his family, pay his employees' salaries, do some home repairs and even save a little. For the future he plans to expand his business and to purchase additional sewing machines - to do this he will have to take out an additional loan to guarantee the success of this expansion. His customers are very satisfied with his work and his main objective is to increase the volume of orders and hire additional employees to meet the growing demand.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

David Fernando E. nasceu na Cidade de Maputo aos 10 de Outubro de 1978, tem 29 anos de idade, concluiu a 9ªclasse, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com apenas 3 e é casado maritalmente. Cresceu e viveu grande parte da vida com a mãe e seus irmãos , estudava e nos tempos livres ia ao curso de corte e costura e também practicava karate. Actualmente faz trabalhos de corte e costura, estampagem, batique e dá aulas de corte e costura a sensivelmente 10 anos e segundo este frequentou curso de corte de costura e também é técnico de reparação de máquinas de costura, emprega actaualmente 3 empregados dos quais 1 tem 5,2 e 1 filhos respectivamente. Com o crédito de 12.000MT pretende comprar tecidos, linhas e tintas. O empreendimento está localizado em sua residência facto que lhe facilita e portanto abre as 8:00 e fecha 16 horas e os trablhadores para chegarem ao local tem que apanhar transporte colectivo e as vezes percorrem grandes distancias. A matéria prima é adquirida em Maputo e na Àfrica do Sul e usa o transporte colectivo para levar os materiais e o verão é o período com mais clientes porque geralmente expõem e vendem ao ar livre na praia onde turistas nacionais e estrangeiros apreciam e compram. A receita média semanal é de 3.000MT e o que dá mais lucro é o Batique e tem um sistema montado de registo de materiais primas, produtos produzidos e vendidos. O grande constragimento que tem emfrentado é a falta de clientes, contudo de alguma maneira não afecta o pagamento das letras. O estágio actual do empreendiemnto é saudável e tem uma margem do lucro mensal de 10.000MT e estes rendimentos usa-os para sustento familiar, pagar salários, construir sua residência e se possível poupar. No futuro a perspectiva é expandir a actividade e comprar mais máquinas de costura e terá que recorrer ao crédito para como garante para o sucesso d sua actividade. O cliente está bastante satisfeito com emprendimento e a maior conquista é aumentar o volume de encomendas e ter nais trabalhadores para responder com prontidão a demanda.

loans.use: To buy row material to make clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of materials

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia Tilleria is a 38 year old single mother with one three year old child. She lives with her mother their humble community of Rincón Guazú, Paraguay.

In 2003 she opened a small convenience store with the help of her brother. He later moved to Argentina in search of a better job. He continues to work there but sends money to Remigia so that she will be able to buy merchandise and continue to grow her micro-enterprise. Today she already has a loyal client base which she established by paying close attention to what products she offers. For the care she gives her store she as seen as a unique establishment in the area.

Remigia is optimistic and wishes to convert her store into a mini-market. In this way she hopes to achieve a higher standard of living for her daughter and mother, whom she is already supporting

With the money she has borrowed Remigia will buy sugar, flour, and rice to continue to offer the best products possible.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour and rice

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Sr. Rubén S. is 34 years old with three young children. He has been providing for his family from a very young age and was forced to end his studies early due to economic problems.

Rubén has been the owner of a small convenience store since 2002. He was able to open this store through the money he saved while working in a factory that made gloves. His time working in this factory generated enough income to support his family and allowed him to save a little money. With this money and a small loan he was able to open his store which provides daily necessities to his community.

With the help of his wife, who works as the clerk and handles administrative tasks, Rubén´s store is well liked by those in the area. They have many loyal customers. Rubén´s goal is to provide a higher standard of living for himself and his children. He hopes that by providing them with the education he was not able to have they will move forward and become professionals.

The money Rubén has borrowed will allow him to buy fruits and vegetables augmenting his inventory.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosula

texts.es:
Señora Rosula M. is 42 years old, and is married to Mr. Melanio Esquivel. Together they have five children, two older ones and three school age children.

Rosula started her business with their savings generated with the money her husband earned working for a transportation carrier of passengers in the year 2000. They rented a small space just outside at the terminal of the company where her husband worked, where every day there was an interesting movement of people traveling. This is how they were inspired with the brilliant opportunity for this type of business.

At first she began selling fast foods such as pastries, croquettes, vegetable tarts, and so on. And then began diversifying her products and foods with more sophisticated offerings. Today this business is very profitable, especially since she already has a customer base, and even developed a catering service for people who work in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase various goods, as well as to supplement the sale of meals in her small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosula M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Melanio Esquivel, matrimonio con cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres en edad escolar.

Rosula comenzó su negocio con los ahorros que genero con el dinero que ganaba su marido que trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transporte público de pasajeros, en el año 2000, alquiló un pequeño salón justamente en la terminal de la empresa donde trabajaba su marido, en donde cada día había un movimiento interesante de personas que viajaban, por lo tanto vio una oportunidad brillante para este tipo de negocio.

Comenzó vendiendo comidas rápidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, tartas de verduras, etc. y luego fue diversificando sus productos ya con comidas mas elaboradas. Hoy en día dicha actividad le es muy rentable, porque ya tiene una clientela formada e incluso ya ofrece servicio de catering a personas que trabajan en la zona.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías varias, ya que además de la venta de comidas posee una pequeña despensa.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, etc. (Compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne, etc.)

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Mr. Faustino E. is 46-years-old and married to Leonora Villalba, living in Capiata, Paraguay. Together they have two children ages 8 and 14. Both children are currently in school.

Faustino began working as a distributor of dairy products seven years ago. He has previously owned a small grocery but after more saving and sacrifice was able to buy a van. With the van he began his business delivering dairy products to the people in Capiata. In addition to what he sells during his delivery route Leonora also helps with the business by selling dairy products out of their home.

With the loan they have solicited, Faustino and his wife will purchase more dairy products. It is their hope that they will expand their business enough to purchase another vehicle and thereby increase the number of people they can serve.

loans.use: purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita has devoted much effort to the cultivation of mangoes and cocoa, thanks to the support of her partner whom she married years ago. Together, they've devoted their efforts and continued commitment to their agricultural work in order to give a proper education to their children who brought joy to their lives each day. But sadly, even with all their hard work and good intentions, they suffered a great tragedy when their eldest daughter suffered a serious accident in which she lost her life. This brought great anguish and sorrow to their home, but despite having great pain and sadness in their hearts, Rita collected all her strength and took over the care of their small grandchildren (3 and 7 years old), which were orphaned when their mother died, and because their father didn't want to take responsibility of them. Despite all the sadness (over their daughter's death), joy filled them when she and her husband took over the paternity of her grandchildren and began to work hard for them. As a consequence of this situation, Rita intends to upgrade their products and expand the cultivation of their land. This is why she is applying for a loan (to buy fertilizers) in order to improve their crops, which will help them in creating a pleasant life for her grandchildren. With your help Rita can provide a life suited to their grandchildren and provide them with a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Rita, se ha dedicado con mucho esfuerzo al cultivo de mangos y cacao; gracias al apoyo de su pareja con el que contrajo matrimonio años atrás, dedicó por completo sus esfuerzos y empeño constante a su labor agrícola a fin de brindarle una adecuada educación a sus pequeños niños que alegraban su día a día su humilde morada.Sin embargo cuando todo esfuerzo y trabajo estaba concentrado hacia ese fin su hija mayor sufrió un grave accidente en el que perdió la vida; este hecho trajo gran congoja y tristeza en su hogar y a pesar de tener gran dolor e inmensa tristeza dentro de su corazón, se armó de valor para hacerse cargo de sus pequeños nietecitos de 3 y 7 añitos, los cuales quedaron huérfanos porque su padre nunca quiso hacerse responsable de ellos.Motivo por la cual ella y su esposo asumieron la paternidad de sus nietos y por ellos trabajan arduamente y muy contentos para también otorgarles felicidad y bienestar.Ha consecuencia de esta situación Rita, tiene pensado mejorar sus productos y extender el cultivo de sus terrenos y solicita un préstamo para acrecentar sus productos y comprar abonos a fin de mejorar sus cosechas, que le ayudarán a tener una vida placentera para ella y sus nietos.Con tu colaboración Rita podrá brindar una vida adecuada a sus nietos y brindarles un futuro prometedor
