The second time she borrowed $700 and expanded her business.

Now, she plans to change her outdated ironer to a new one and diversify the variety of fabrics she uses. Thus, she will be able to increase her income and afford giving herself little joys that maybe ordinary for others but not for her, such as buying a brand new TV set, and other household wares.

Now, she needs a $1000 loan in order to further develop her business. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She thought that this expanding will improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: She plans to change her outdated ironer to a new one and diversify the variety of fabrics she uses

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret B. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in the town Alaba, which is in the Lagos State of Nigeria. Her business is selling provisions and drinks. She has been in her business since the year 2000. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. Mrs. B. is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Subgroup B Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
JUMA, age 42, has worked as a repairman at his radio repair shop for over 10 years. At his shop, Juma gets around 10 customers a day and earns about $45-55 a week. For each repair, Juma charges his customers between $1.50 and $5, depending on the service. Juma is married with 5 kids (ages 18, 15, 8, 4, and a baby of 2 months) and takes care of 2 other 10-year-old relatives.

Juma is the leader of Subgroup B of Group “Sungura” (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. He will be sharing this loan with his subgroup members Flora L. (selling soft drinks), Fatuma J. (selling chickens), Mary K. (selling charcoal), and Marietha M. (tailoring). Juma, as the government executive officer of his street, knows each of his subgroup members and their businesses personally since they all work and live in the same neighborhood. He and his subgroup have taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay each back successfully.

Juma used the previous loans to buy more radio spare parts for his shop, as well as to pay for general home expenses such as his children’s school fees. He hopes to use the new loan to purchase more radio spare parts and thus increase his business.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche C. sells food, drinks and Santana, which is local food made from cassava. She has been in the business since 2004 and is a dedicated LAPO client. Uche C. is  married and has 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She wishes to expand her business by buying more food, drinks and Santana to sell.  That is how she will spend the $800 loan.

loans.use: To buy food, drinks and Santana

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
A. Tahir was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory of Gubadli region, situated in the west part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He is 54 years old and a father of three children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. He is homeless and staying in a worker’s hostel in Sumgayit city.

Tahir opened his business in 1999. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. His son helps him at this work. Tahir’s son is in the picture.

For his first loan he borrowed $400 from Normicro and opened his business. The second time he borrowed $600 and expanded his business. Now he wants to borrow $800 to open a big vegetable section on his counter and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business further.

loans.use: To open a big vegetable section on his counter and improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla is married and has a six-year-old son. She is from the city of brooks and swamps, but she has lived for several years in the city of Mariano R. Alonso. She produces leather goods such as wallets and belts. She learned this trade from an uncle who does the same work and who has helped her since she was a young girl with this trade.

Several years ago, Perla traveled to Argentina to work. Then, after two years of hard work, she returned to Paraguay. Today she keeps working in the leather trade with her uncle, and they hope to start another type of sales to be able to generate extra income. This is why Perla is requesting the loan, mainly to purchase coal, which she will sell out of her home, in addition to the leather goods that she makes.

The sales of this new product will generate good profits because in this area, the demand for coal is high and there are few businesses that sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Perla es casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años, ella proviene de la ciudad de arroyos y esteros, pero vive hace varios años en la ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso.

Perla se dedica a la marroquinería, que es la elaboración de accesorios en cuero, tales como billeteras, carteras y cintos. Este oficio lo aprendió de un tío que se dedica a lo mismo y a quien ella ayuda desde pequeña en este oficio.

Hace unos años, Perla viajo a Argentina para trabajar, luego de dos años de arduo trabajo, volvió a Paraguay. Hoy día ella sigue trabajando en este oficio junto con su tío, y desean incursionar en otro tipo de ventas de modo a generar un ingreso extra. Por ello, Perla solicita el crédito para la compra al por mayor de carbón, que lo venderá en su casa, además de los productos que ella elabora.

La venta de este nuevo producto le generará buenas ganancias ya que en la zona la demanda del carbón es alta y existen muy pocos negocios que se dedican a la venta del mismo.

loans.use: Purchase of coal in large quantities

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca lives with her husband of 12 years and together they have a two year old son. Blanca and her husband have a business selling eggs wholesale, along with a few other products. She used to work as an employee for a company, while her husband worked as a fisherman. After several years of saving money and gaining experience, Blanca decided to start her own business selling eggs.

They began providing eggs to a few small stores, and today they have a strong customer base, including small shops and supermarkets. Although the work is very hard and they start their day at 3am, they are very dedicated and have already progressed a lot thanks to their efforts, purchasing two trucks to help with their distribution. They also have several employees now, including sales and deliveries.

Blanca is requesting the loan so she can make bulk purchases of eggs, because during this time of the year there is an increase in demand and she would like to be prepared for it.

La Sra. Blanca vive en pareja hace 12 años y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Blanca junto con su pareja se dedican a la ventas de huevos al por mayor y algunos que otros productos.

En principio Blanca trabajaba como empleada en un negocio, y su pareja era pescador, luego de varios años de ahorro y experiencia en las ventas, Blanca decidió dedicarse a la venta de huevos.

Empezaron proveyendo a pequeños comercios y hoy día ya tienen una basta clientela, entre ellos despensas, supermercados, entre otros. Aunque el trabajo es muy sacrificado, pues deben iniciar su jornada a las 3 am., realizan su labor con mucha responsabilidad; es así como hoy día han progresado bastante ya que gracias a sus ganancias adquirieron dos camionetas con las que realizan sus repartos. También poseen ya varios empleados entre ellos vendedores y repartidores.

Blanca desea adquirir un crédito para la compra de grandes cantidades de huevos, ya que en esta época del año, la demanda aumenta bastante y ella desea estar preparada para ello.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY EGGS IN LARGER QUANTITIES, AND BE ABLE MEET THE INCREASED DEMAND FROM CUSTOMERS THIS TIME OF YEAR.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria lives with her son in a rental at 1422 Feliciano Kantuta Avenue in Ciudad de la Paz. Her job is the preparation of food that is sold in a booth at the Uruguary market. She is part of those clients that have requested loans from Kiva in the past. Her previous loan was paid off in it's entirety. She is now requesting a new loan to buy prime materials that she uses in her business and to continue increasing her capital. Because of her prior loan, Ana Maria is able to have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Maria vive en alquiler con su hijo, en la Av. Feliciano Kantuta Nº 1422 de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida la cual vende en un puesto dentro el mercado Uruguay. Ella es parte de los clientes que solicitaron crédito vía Kiva; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Ahora solicita uno nuevo para la compra de las materias primas que usa en su negocio y seguir aumentando su capital. Por su antecedente crediticio Ana Maria puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce food.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo is a young, single man that lives with his mother. He works as a taxi driver in Ciudad de La Paz - El Alto, which serves as his primary source of income to support his mother. He lives in the Cotahuma area in Ciudad de La Paz. The loan will be used for the maintenance of his taxi which is his tool for work and the primary source of income. This is the first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor Hugo, joven soltero que vive con su madre, trabaja de chofer de taxi de servicio publico Inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que mantiene a su madre. Vive en la zona Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es su herramienta de trabajo y principal fuente de ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase motor for taxi.

loans.name: Sandra Aydee

texts.es:
Sandra works as a secretary and her husband is a chauffer. Both jobs are the source of income with which they support their two sons who are 2 and 7 years old. At night she studes public accounting so that she will have the opportunity to move up in the company where she works and increase her family's income. She lives in the Tacagua district of the city of La Paz.

She will use this loan to buy a medium-quality computer that she will use to do the schoolwork for her university classes.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her socio-economic evaluation of qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra trabaja como secretaria; el esposo es chofer asalariado y ambas actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con los que mantienen a sus dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad; por las noches estudia contaduría pública para tener la oportunidad de ascender de posición en la compañía donde trabaja e incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Vive en la zona Tacagua de La ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora de mediana calidad, la misma que le ayudara para realizar sus trabajos en la universidad.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio-económica realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 52 year-old widow with 4 married children. Catalina works hard to rent out tables, chairs, tablecloths and other party related products. She opened this business together with her sister but after 6 years, her sister left the country and left her to run the business.

Catalina underwent difficulties to operate the business alone, which was worse after her husband's death. Her late husband supported her emotionally and financially. His job at the factory helped to cover their living costs.

In spite of these vicissitudes, Catalina persevered and today, her business is running more smoothly. She wants to buy more merchandise. She seeks a loan that will allow her to invest in plastic chairs so she can increase the variety of products to offer in her renting business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina tiene 52 años, ella es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, todos ya casados. Catalina se dedica al alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y otros afines para fiestas. El negocio lo abrió junto con su hermana, pero hace 6 años, su hermana viajo a otro país y quedo ella sola frente al negocio.

Le costo mucho a Catalina salir adelante sola, más aún luego de la muerte de su marido, ya que el era su gran apoyo emocional además de económico, pues el trabajaba en una fábrica y ayudaba con los ingresos y gastos de la casa.

A pesar de las vicisitudes, Catalina persevero y hoy día el negocio marcha bastante bien. Ella desea adquirir hoy un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de sillas de plástico de esta forma poder aumentar la variedad de su stock de alquiler.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia is 37 years old and married to Cresencio Sosa. They have 3 young children who are currently students at the district school.

Her husband is a fisherman. Nidia works together with him and sells fish. They've had this business for 14 years and so far, it has done well. They started with a boat where Cresencio went fishing and Nidia traveled to different homes and businesses to sell th fish. They started to make some progress little by little and today, they have a larger boat as well as a permanent fish stand in the market of their municipality. In addition, Nidia owns a mobile stand that she bought in a fair which she uses to travel to various cities to exhibit and sell different products.

These are the different types of fish they sell: tiger catfish, dolphin fish, pacu, as well as others. Nidia seeks a loan to buy a wide variety of fish at wholesale prices since there is a high demand for them at this time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Nidia tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con Cresencio Sosa y tienen 3 hijos, todos menores, y que actualmente están estudiando en una escuela de la zona.

Su marido es pescador y junto con él, Nidia, se dedica a la venta de pescados. Hace ya 14 años que tienen el negocio, y cuentan que les va muy bien. Empezaron con un bote, con el cual Cresencio iba a pescar y luego Nidia recorría casas y negocios para vender los pescados. Poco a poco fueron progresando y hoy día ya tienen una lancha más grande, y ya tienen un puesto fijo de venta en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Además de este puesto de venta, Nidia, posee un puesto propio adquirido en una feria que recorre diferentes ciudades exponiendo diferentes tipos de productos.

Entre los diferentes tipos de pescados que venden podemos citar: Surubí, Dorado, Pacu, Piraña, Mandi´i, entre otros. Nidia solicita el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de pescado, ya que en esta época del año la demanda de los mismos aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale prices

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina, age 27, owns a photo studio with her husband in downtown Ayacucho, Perú. They provide all types of photographic services and sell every imaginable camera accessory. Film is developed and cameras, batteries, and even movies are sold within their walls. Albertina and her husband have been the sole owners of their studio for almost one year and a half. Before, Albertina was working in various other photo studios in the area and her husband was an employee in the shop they currently own, under different management. When the owner of the studio Albertina’s husband was working in retired, the couple jumped at the opportunity to buy the studio and apply the knowledge they had been gaining over the past several years.

Today, Albertina’s photo studio is a rapidly growing business where she and her husband are busily attending to their many customers. When asked if she has any goals for maximizing the growth of her business, Albertina’s eyes widen and she sighs with an exasperated expression she saying “yes!” The machine currently being used to develop customers’ film is rented, and to own one themselves would be an incredible help, she explains. As well, they still lack the equipment to develop digital pictures. Acquiring such capabilities would allow Albertina and her husband to enter an entirely new market and bring their photo business to the next level.

Everything Abertina and her husband do is with the motivation of supporting their growing family of a seven year-old daughter and baby girl on the way. Being a part of her village bank has allowed them the opportunities needed to grow their business and this is why she says she is so pleased to be involved. She has also learned how to save her money in the bank, a skill that has helped immensely in provision for her family. Albertina is asking for a $400 loan. With this money, she will buy and sell larger quantities of products, the first step on her way to new equipment.

loans.use: To buy and sell larger quantities of products, the first step on her way to new equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a “feriante.” This means that once a week she travels four hours outside the city of Ayacucho, Peru to the “ferias” (rural markets) to buy the products which she brings home to sell to her urban community. The products she buys and sells vary, however the one thing she always sells is cheese. She loves the specific type of Ayacuchano cheese which is white and has a very strong taste salty, made from cow’s milk. The cheese is made in small blocks which she loads into her three buckets to sell. Along with cheese, when animals are available in the markets, mostly sheep and pigs, she also brings these home to sell the meat, a more profitable venture. Delia has many regular clients that depend on her for their weekly supplies of cheeses and meats, she explains, and she delivers these products straight to their doors.

This mother of two beautiful girls has been practicing this trade for as long as she can remember. Her mother was involved in the same venture, and she grew up traveling back and forth between city and countryside, learning the tricks of the trade. As a professional goal, Delia explains that for her entire life she has dreamed of owning her own small grocery store. An additional dream of hers is to one day be the owner of her very own home, to which she would attach the small store. Because she has been saving diligently for the past 8 years, Delia explains that she has been able to buy a piece of property, and as her capital continues to grow, she will soon be able to begin construction on her home and grocery store.

Delia says she feels very happy to have been a part of her village bank for the past 8 years. She has learned how to save her money and she has learned how to better maintain her home through the weekly lessons. With the $400 loan Delia is requesting, she will invest primarily in her cheese business, being able to buy and sell larger quantities, accumulating a larger clientele. She will also invest the money in transportation between countryside and city, which is an expensive element of her business.

loans.use: To buy and sell larger quantities of cheese.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
In the midst of the busy Nery García Market, Dolores H. O. D. Jota can be found sitting at her stand behind a mountain of bananas. For the past 2 years, this friendly businesswoman has been selling fruit from her permanent stand. The bananas she sells arrive directly and daily from the forests outsiD. her city of Ayacucho, Perú. These she is able to sell all year round, Dolores explains, and she sells some seven different varieties from extremely small bananas to very large and round and even red bananas. Dolores also sells whatever type of fruit happens to be in season, for example, today one can find a wiD. variety of pineapples, mangos, and papayas.

Year before, Dolores was an “ambulante,” which means she sold in the markets, but without a fixed stand, having to cart her fruits around with her all day long. She was also only able to stock smaller amounts of fruits which came from the capital city of Lima, instead of fresh from the forests and harvesters in the countrysiD.. It was only through very hard work that Dolores was eventually able to earn her own stand within the market, and it is with that same diligence that she continues to work everyday from 3 am to 6 pm, doing everything within her power to continue growing her business and her clientele. Her goal she says is to open a second stand next door, from which she would expand her market and sell spices.

With the help of loans from her village bank, Dolores has been able to grow her business and support her family of a husband and seven children. She says she is infinitely grateful to have received the economic help through miroloans, something that has taught her how to manage her business in a responsible and punctual fashion. Dolores is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy and sell even larger quantities of bananas, facilitating greater profits.

loans.use: Buy and sell larger quantities of bananas.

loans.name: Elberta

texts.en:
Elberta earns her living through the preparation of delicious food, traditional to Peru and the Andes mountains. From her two stands side-by-side in the main market of Ayacuho, Peru, she serves “mondongo,” a thick beef soup, “puca picante,” a dish of potatoes, peanuts, and a red sauce served over rice, and “chincharron,” which is fried pork. These are only her most popular dishes among several others prepared daily. Although Elberta hasn’t always been preparing meals, she has always been in the food business. Fifteen years ago, she was living in Cusco, Peru and ran her own bakery. After her mother-in-law passed away, she and her husband and their eight children moved to Ayacucho. Because establishing a bakery was prohibitively expensive for Elberta, instead she opened up her stand in the market where she is today. Elberta explains the fact that she loves her work is the most important part of making a living, and she is very lucky to have found her passion in cooking.

Elberta joined her village bank 10 years ago because she wanted to expand her business. At the time, she only had one stand, but through the loans she received and savings she accumulated, she was eventually able to expand and buy the stand next door. It is with this same mindset that Elberta continues in her village bank. Her goal is to one day buy her own property and construct a home with the savings she is accumulating. Additionally, she hopes to open a small restaurant which she would attach to her newly constructed home. Elberta is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will buy all the ingredients that go into the food she serves daily: rice, oil, noodles, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda Oriely

texts.es:
Esmeralda is a hard-working mother, working as a nurse every day in a hospital with the sole goal of supporting her two daughters. She also works selling beauty products for the international brand, Avon; visiting her clients in their homes, leaving them the products and charging them afterwards. She has already experienced how strong she can be, when her husband abandoned her 5 years ago, walking out on her and unburdening himself of the worry of the support of his daughters. This is why she now carries out the functions of both father and mother in their home. Her wish is to open a sales center of cosmetics in which she can use all of the experience she has aquired, in order to be able to completely support her daughters, whom she loves very much. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. Let's help with this noble goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Esmeralda, es una diligente madre, técnica en enfermería que a diario trabaja con el único fin de apoyar a sus dos hijas, también se dedica a comercializar algunos productos de belleza de la marca internacional, Avon, que expende visitando a sus clientas en sus domicilios, dejándoles los productos y cobrando posteriormente.Ella realiza su máximo esfuerzo ya que su esposo la abandonó hace cinco años, marchándose de casa y despreocupándose del mantenimiento de sus hijas, motivo por el que ella desempeña las funciones de padre y madre en su hogar.Su deseo es abrir un centro de ventas de cosméticos, en el cual pueda vertir toda la experiencia adquirida a fin de poder apoyar enteramente a sus hijas, a las que ama mucho y para ello desea un préstamo.Colaboremos con este noble propósito.

loans.use: To have an increase in captial to open a place to sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE EVERY DAY ITEMS SUCH AS SUGAR, RIZE, OIL AND MILK TO STOCK HER BUSINESS, AS WELL AS UTENSILS FOR HER BAKERY.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana is 25 years old and married to Alfonso Dionisi. They have two young children together who fill their home with happiness. Adriana and her husband run a small general store, and they also sell wholesale sweets/snacks to various shops in their area.

Their main customers are shops, kiosks, and food carts and trucks, as well as super markets. From the time she was very young, Adriana has been selling every day grocery items. She met her husband because they worked in the same business. With a great deal of effort, they were able to buy a small piece of land, build their own home and open a shop together. Today they also own a small truck, and two motorcycles which they use to distribute their products to other cities.

Adriana would like this loan to stock more products in their general store. Their business is already generating good income. Some of the items they need to buy include sugar, tea, noodles, rice, and various drinks and sweets.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

La señora Adriana tiene 25 años, esta en pareja con Alfonso Dionisi de profesión comerciante, ellos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que son la alegría de la casa.

Adriana, junto con su esposo, poseen una despensa bien surtida y también se dedican a la venta de golosinas al por mayor a diferentes comercios de la zona.

Sus principales clientes son despensas, kioscos, puestos de ventas ambulantes, y supermercados. Adriana cuenta que desde muy joven se dedico a la venta de distintos tipos de mercaderías. Fue así como conoció a su marido que también se dedicaba a lo mimo.

Con mucho esfuerzo lograron comprar un terreno y construir su propio hogar y abrir la despensa juntos. Hoy día ya poseen una camioneta y dos motos carros con los que realizan el reparto de las mercaderías, de este modo pueden llevar sus productos inclusive a otras ciudades.

Adriana desea un crédito para surtir de más productos su despensa, ya que también este negocio genera buenos ingresos. Algunos de los productos a comprar son: azúcar, yerba, fideo, arroz, bebidas en general y golosinas de diferentes variedades.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUGAR, TEA, NOODLES, RICE, AND VARIOUS DRINKS AND SWEETS TO STOCK THE BUSINESS.

loans.name: Fanny Dareli

texts.en:
Two years ago, when 31 year-old Fanny moved to Ayacucho, Perú to live with her husband, she decided to begin a small business. Her mother-in-law brought her to the village bank, and with her very first microloan, Fanny began a Nintendo arcade. She slowly accumulated televisions and gaming systems, and before she knew it, she was able to provide toys and a bed for her new baby son. As she is always looking for the best way to increase her business, Fanny recognized the need for internet in her community and decided to change gears and open an internet café. She sold her televisions and together with the profits, with the money she had been saving in the bank, and with her loans, she bought 7 computers and opened her new business. It continued to grow, and today, she and her husband run a beautiful and very busy internet café with 12 computers, a new television for playing movies, and a large display of candy for her patrons to snack on. All the neighborhood children pass in and out of her doors throughout the day, playing video games, meeting friends, and learning from the limitless resources the internet has to offer.

As a professional goal, Fanny and her husband hope to buy the property next door and expand the internet café to allow more computers and more customers. Fanny is incredibly grateful to her village bank for allowing the realization of her ambitious business goals. Without the loans and classes she has received for the past 2 years, she says she wouldn’t know how to save her money and none of what she has today would have been possible. Fanny is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will replace two out-of-date computers with newer, faster models.

loans.use: Replace two out-of-date computers with newer, faster models.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel is 27 years old and has 4 children. They live together in the district called Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo. She was only able to study up until her 4th year at secondary school, but today she is a partner in a popular little restaurant in her neighborhood, and she's president of The Mothers Club of Florencia de Mora which is located in the front of her house. She decided to earn her own money washing clothes so she could start her own business.

She began her business buying small quantities of sweets which she could sell after 2pm outside of her house, and with the little bit of money she was earning, she began to also sell meals after 7pm. Along with this, she also has a small cobbler business. Maria Ysabel does whatever she can to cover the costs of her home with these three small businesses, and pay for the education of her children.

She learned about Movimiento Manuela Ramos from a friend, and received her first loan of $100 which she invested in her shoe business. She began making one dozen pairs, and now 5 dozen pairs. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells the shoes around town, and also sends some to her brother to sell in Piura. With this loan which she will repay in 4 months, she would like to purchase materials for her shoe business in greater quantity, as the demand grows with the holiday season. Maria Ysabel's dream is to be able to have her own house, and open up a good restaurant there.

La señora Maria Ysabel tiene 27 años, solo estudio hasta 4º año de Secundaria, tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella y vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento La Libertad. La Señora María es socia de un comedor popular de su barrio y es Presidenta del Club de Madres de Florencia de Mora situado al frente de su casa, decide ganar su propio dinero lavando ropa de otras personas para ahorrar y poner su propio negocio. Inicia su negocio comprando en pequeñas cantidades todo tipo de golosinas para vender a partir de las 2:00 pm. a fuera de su casa, con lo poco que iba ganando también empezó a vender comida a partir de las 7:00 pm. Paralelamente tiene otro pequeño negocio de confección de zapatos. Ella trata de una u otra manera solventar los gastos de su casa con estos tres pequeños negocios, sobre todo la educación de sus hijos. La señora se entera de la existencia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos por medio de una amiga y forma el Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Pérbola”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300 ($ 100). el cual invirtió en la confección de zapatos, ella empezó haciendo 1 docena, y ahora hace 5 docenas. Los sábados y domingos se dedica a venderlos como ambulante y otra parte los envía a su hermano a venderlos a Piura. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($ 267) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró materiales para la confección de zapatos en mayor cantidad ya que la demanda será mayor en las fiestas de fin año. El sueño más grande que tiene la señora Maria Ysabel es tener su propia casa y allí colocar un buen restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED FOR HER SHOE BUSINESS AND MEET THE GREATER DEMAND OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON.

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard working lady who spends most of her day as a secretary working in an office from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm, Monday through Wednesday. Aside from her hard work in this job, she also works selling dress clothing. She brings her merchanside from Lima in order to fulfill her customers' requests, which thus causes her to travel bi-weekly to the capital city to make her purchases. While she does this, her only relative, her mother, stays behind to watch over the home. Maria cares for her mother's health and well-being and for this reason Maria asks that you help her with the loan so she may increase the amount of merchandise she provides in order to fulfill her customers' needs. Please do not be indifferent to Maria's needs and let's collaborate with her and her elderly mother who requires great care and treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise.

María, es una dama muy trabajadora que ocupa el mayor tiempo del día a su labor de secretaria en un grifo donde trabaja desde las 9:00 am. hasta las 5:00 pm. de lunes a miércoles y muy a parte de su desempeño en este trabajo vende prendas de vestir a las personas que le envían sus pedidos. Ella trae su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima para cumplir con las peticiones de sus clientes, razón por la cual viaja quincenalmente a la capital para realizar sus compras, mientras su abnegada madre cuida de su hogar y por ser su único familiar, María vela por su salud y bienestar.Por esta razón Maria, pide le ayudemos con el préstamo de una cantidad de dinero para que pueda aumentar la cantidad de sus artículos a fin de satisfacer los pedidos de las personas.No seamos indiferentes ante la necesidad de Maria y colaboremos con ella y su anciana madre quién requiere de mayores cuidados y tratamientos

loans.use: Purchase fashion garments to help her beloved mother's economic and medical situation.

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.en:
Hipólita is a “feriante.” This means that once each week she makes the long trip outside her home city of Ayacucho, Perú to the rural countryside where she buys large supplies of cheeses and meats. Her method of transportation depends upon what she can find, though usually she is able to take the bus. These supplies she brings home to the city to sell in the markets and also door-to-door. Hipólita has been involved in this type of business for the past 15 years, when her friend invited her to join in the business.

As Hipólita is a single mother of three teenaged children, she also sells candy to supplement her income. During the frequent and very large city and national festivals, she brings huge supplies of candy to sell to those who are celebrating, often staying all night until very early the next morning. This she has also been involved in for the last 15 years, alongside her cousin.

Hipólita has been a part of her village bank as long as she has been a businesswoman. She says she loves taking part in the economic help provided and taking advantage of the opportunities it allows. Currently, it is helping her work toward a lifelong goal of hers: to buy her own house for herself and her children. They are presently living in a rented portion of her sister’s home. Without her village bank, she explains, doing business would be very hard, if not impossible, and goals like buying her own home with her own money would be unthinkable. Hipólita is requesting a loan of $300, with which she will pay for her weekly transportation into the countryside, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of meats and cheeses.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of meats and cheeses, and pay for weekly transportation into the countryside.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is 55 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo and region of La Libertad. She was unable to finish her studies due to lack of parental support. She has 9 children -3 of them are dependent on her.

She has a business in the Bellavista market, which is located in the same area in La Esperanza. She is the owner of a grocery store that sells items like potatoes, carrots, vegetables, and spices. Previously, María traveled along the streets and within the markets to sell her products but later had the opportunity to buy a place to set up her current business.

María joined Banco Comunal "Bellavista" after receiving an invitation from another business merchant. Her first loan of $100 was used to buy entire condiments at wholesale prices, which she ground, packaged, and sold in smaller quantities. The recent loan from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in installments over 6 months. It will be used to fix her store's roof. María dreams of having another store to sell other items or renting it for ultimately more income.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María tiene 55 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. No pudo estudiar por falta D. apoyo D. su padre, tiene 9 hijos D. los cuales 3 aún dependen D. ella.

Tiene su negocio en el mercado Bellavista ubicado en el sector del mismo nombre del distrito D. La Esperanza, ella es dueña D. un puesto en el cual venD. abarrotes, papas, zanahorias, verduras y especias Anteriormente la señora María vendía sus productos como ambulante por las calles y dentro del mercado pero tuvo la oportunidad D. comprar un puesto y es allí donD. ahora realiza su negocio.

La señora María ingresó al Banco Comunal “Bellavista” por invitación D. otra comerciante del mercado. Obtuvo su primer crédito D. S/.300.00 ($100) con los cuales compró condimentos enteros al por mayor para luego molerlos envasarlos y venderlos en cantidades pequeñas. El reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos para pagar en un plazo D. 6 meses, le sirvió para invertir en arreglar el techo D. su puesto. La señora María sueña con tener otro puesto para vender otras cosas o para alquilarlo y poder tener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To buy condiments at wholesale

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
For the past 24 years, Juana and her husband have been running a small saddlery business from a workshop in their home in Ayacucho, Perú. While her husband crafts exquisite leather saddles, Juana fashions the blinders and bits from leather and silver. As a young boy, Juana’s husband learned this craft, and when they got married, Juana began to learn as well. Every piece is handcrafted and the melting and molding is done with the wooden stove in the workshop. Located in the hills of Ayacucho, they have many customers, as horses and donkeys are a principal method of cargo transportation between city and country. All their work is done on a contract basis, filling orders as they arrive.

As a professional goal, Juana says she and her husband would love to one day open a store and workshop outside of their home. On a more personal note, Juana also plans to use the profits she has been saving in the bank to facilitate a university education for all four of her children and eventually construct a house of her own, as the one in which they currently live is rented. For all these reasons, Juana is very grateful to have been a part of her village bank for the past 13 years. It has been of immense help, she explains, teaching her how to save and assisting her in the realization of her many goals. Juana is requesting a loan of $800, with which she and her husband will buy leather to fashion and old coins to be melted and molded.

loans.use: Buy leather to fashion saddles and old coins to be melted and molded into blinders and bits.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita is 45 years old, lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo and region of La Libertad. She finished high school and has 3 children who are dependent on her.

She has a business in the Parque Industrial market, which is near the Manuel Arévalo development, in the district of La Esperanza. She sells chicken soup, patazca (a traditional Peruvian soup), drinks, newspapers, and gasoline. She started running a small store from her own house but she soon realized that she was capable of doing more. She was granted a loan from Manuela Ramos. She saw a store in the marketplace near her home and decided to buy it. This is how she started to her food business with a soup pot - this has led to increase in sales and menu variety.

Sarita has an account with Banco Comunal "Santa Elena" through a friend. She obtained her first loan of approximately 100 soles (Peruvian currency), which was used to buy soup pots and other cooking utensils. This last loan of 600 soles from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in 4 months. It will be used to purchase a sack of brown rice, carbonated beverages, beer, newspapers, gasoline. Sarita dreams of having a larger, more modern and established business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sarita tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió la secundaria completa; tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella.

Tiene su negocio en el mercado Parque Industrial ubicado en la urbanización Manuel Arévalo, Distrito de La Esperanza; vende caldo de gallina, caldo de cabeza, patazca, bebidas, periódicos y gas. Ella se inicia desde hace mucho con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su propia casa, pero se dio cuenta que podía hacer algo mas ya que ahora contaba con el préstamo que le había otorgado Manuela Ramos, así que ve un puesto en el mercado que esta cerca de su domicilio y decide comprarlo y es así como empieza el negocio de la venta de comida primero con una ollita de caldo y como veía que había venta fue aumentando y variando el menú.

La señora Sarita ingresa al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena” por medio de una amiga. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con los cuales compró ollas y otros utensilios para la preparación de los caldos. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, le servirá para comprar un saco de arroz, un saco de papas, gaseosas, cerveza, periódicos y gas. La señora Sarita sueña con un negocio más grande, moderno e implementado, y con ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies, newspapers, gas, etc.

loans.name: Flor Rosmery

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor Rosmery is 36 years old and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, which is in the province of Trujuillo and region of La Libertad. She only studied up to junior year in high school. She has 2 daughers who are dependent on her.

She has a grocery store in her own home but apart from that, she sells hair pins, earrings and accessories at schools nearby her home. Flor, her sister-in-law, and other neighbors formed a group called "La Pérbola". With her first loan of $100, she bought corn, sugar, salt, noodles, hygiene products and other basic goods to assemble her little store.

The recent loan of $200 from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in 4 months. It will be used to buy merchandise for the store inventory as well as cosmetics to sell together with her accessories. Flor dreams of having a larger store to move forward in life with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor Rosmery tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Estudió solo hasta el tercer año de secundaria; tiene 2 hijas los cuales aun dependen de ella. Tiene un negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa, pero a parte vende ganchos para cabello y aretes (accesorios) en las puertas de los colegios cerca de su casa. La señora Flor, junto con su cuñada y otras vecinas, formaron el Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Pérbola”. Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/ 300 soles ($100) compró arroz, azúcar, sal, fideos, papel higiénico y otros productos de primera necesidad para armar una pequeña bodega. El Reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00 (aproximadamente $200) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, le servirá para invertir en la compra de abarrotes y también cosméticos que quiere empezar a vender junto con los ganchos y aretes. La señora Flor sueña con tener un negocio más grande para poder sacar adelante a sus hijas.

loans.use: To buy a variety of grocery products as well as cosmetics and accessories for women

loans.name: Livia

texts.en:
Livia is the owner of a small grocery store in a quiet neighborhood just outside of the downtown bustle of Ayacucho, Perú. For three years she has been running the business, chatting with customers, and buying supplies. When one steps inside the store, it’s hard to believe Livia began so humbly. Before her grocery store, Livia was selling fruits from a small cart just outside a busy Ayacuchan market. It is an exceptionally difficult way to make a living and lacks the permanence and consistency necessary to support a family. This is why, when Livia’s second daughter was born, she decided to leave fruits behind and open a grocery store from her home. She began with only 300 Nuevo Soles in her pocket (about $100 USD), and with this she was able to buy 15 lbs. each of rice, oil, flour and a few other staple food items. It certainly wasn’t much, but little by little, Livia was able to save up her money, accumulate capital, and today she has an entire grocery store filled with large varieties of foods, beverages, and household items.

A principal element in the success of Livia’s grocery store has been her village bank. When she began with 300 Nuevo Soles, it was without any economic help. However, as soon as she joined her bank and began to take out loans, she was allowed incredible economic opportunities on which she capitalized with efficiency. Her village bank also taught her how to save her money formally in an account, instead of in her home where it is very difficult to save. Due to such lessons and opportunities, Livia is able to look forward to greater aspirations for her business and family. Professionally, Livia says she would love to renovate her store and maybe one day open in a new location in the city. As far as her family of 2 daughters and a husband is concerned, she plans to renovate their home from clay and straw thatching to sturdier and more comfortable materials.

Livia is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she will be able to buy and sell more of everything she stocks in her store, thus attracting more clients and earning greater profits.

loans.use: Increase the amount and variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Yenny Gertrudis

texts.es:
Yenny is a hardworking 22-year-old mother who since she had her son has dedicated herself to selling artisan crafts, always with her young baby by her side. Thanks to her dedication and perseverance, the work is helping her save for a new home. The goal of this young and enterprising mother is to improve the quality of her merchandise and with the extra income that will generate, she plans to save enough to purchase some land and build a small home. She is counting on your good heart and is requesting a loan in hopes of fulfilling her plans, and she plans to repay it within eight months. This young mother waits for your support in strengthening her business and helping her offer a better quality of life for her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yenny, es una joven madre luchadora de 22 años de edad, desde que tuvo a su pequeño hijo se dedicó arduamente a su negocio de venta de productos artesanales acompañada siempre de su querido e inquieto bebé, trabajo que gracias a su dedicación y perseverancia está brindándole la posibilidad de solventar satisfactoriamente los gastos de su nuevo hogar.El deseo de esta joven y emprendedora madre es aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y con las ganancias que genere la venta de estos productos ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un terrenito y construir su casita.Para concretar sus planes ella recurre a tu buen corazón y solicita un préstamo que le posibilitará adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y con la inversión de este capital obtener mayor beneficio económico.Ella se compromete a reembolsar tu ayuda en un lapso de ocho meses. Esta joven madre espera tu apoyo para fortalecer su negocio y así ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su querida familia.

loans.use: Acquire higher quality products to sell so she can improve the quality of life for her beloved infant son.

loans.name: Marizta

texts.en:
Maritza has been preparing and selling delicious Peruvian dishes from her two portable stands for the past 8 years. She prepares all the regional favorites of her hometown of Ayacucho, Perú including chicken soups, “puca picante” which is a dish containing beans, peanuts, beets and potatoes, and “modongo” a favorite weekend dish that contains corn and beef and cooks all night long. Although she cooks a variety of foods, Marizta’s specialty is “chicharrón,” which is deep fried pork. This she sells just around the corner from her home in a busy market area. “Mari,” as her friends and neighbors call her, sells here during the weekdays and her stand has become a very popular attraction for all in the area. Her second stand is set up in the rural countryside of Ayacucho, a few hours outside the city limits. Because it is very popular for families to take a relaxing day trip to the country during the weekends, Maritza has taken advantage of the weekend traffic, selling a wider variety of dishes to many passersby. Maritza also travels to all the festivals in the area, selling to the large celebrating crowds.

One day, Maritza says she would love to open a large restaurant in the city center of Ayacucho. This has been a dream of hers since she was a young girl, she explains, as cooking has always been her passion. This is where her village bank comes in. Two years ago, Maritza began taking out loans to increase her business and her profits, helping her circle in on the eventual accomplishment of the opening of her restaurant. She has loved being a part of her village bank because she says it has taught her how to save her money in the bank where it accumulates interest. The confidence and ease with which she is given a loan has also increased her self-confidence and motivated her to work even harder in the growth of her food business. Maritza is requesting a loan of $800. With this money, she will be able to buy larger amounts of pork for “chicharrones,” as well as firewood for her small stove and other necessary ingredients.

loans.use: To buy pork for “chicharrones”, as well as firewood and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Ilza

texts.es:
Ilza is 41 years, and only studied up to the 4th year of high school. She has three children and currently two of them depend on her. She lives in the District of Florence de Mora, Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad, Peru and belongs to the Communal Bank "God guides Our Steps II. " She had previously been engaged to sell beauty products and compile portfolios, but then with limited time because she had to meet her family's duties, she decided to devote herself solely to the sale of beauty products. Ilza has been engaged in this business for over 3 years, and has been gradually increasing the number of her customers. Because of this reason, she accepted to join her mother-in-law's invitation to join her Communal Bank "God Guide Our Steps". With her first loan, S/.300.00 ($ 100), she increased her inventory of cosmetics to meet her customers' needs. She did the same with the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S/.500.00 ($ 167), which she repaid in 4 months. Ilza wants to continue to increase her sales to fulfill her great dream "Being director of beauty industry products" - this is her passion. She feels great to be able to teach women today how to take care of themselves and how to feel good about themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ilza tiene 41 años, solo estudió hasta 4º grado de secundaria, tiene tres hijos y actualmente 2 dependen de ella, vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú, pertenece al banco comunal “Dios guía nuestros Pasos II”. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza y a confeccionar carteras pero con el tiempo limitado que tenia para atender a su familia decidió dedicarse solo a la venta de productos de belleza. La señora se dedica a este negocio hace más de 3 años; poco a poco fue aumentando la cantidad de sus clientes y muchos le solicitaban que les vendiera a crédito por lo que tenía necesidad de mayor capital por eso aceptó la invitación de su suegra de integrarse al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” Con su primer préstamo, de S/.300.00 ($100) aumentó su stock de cosméticos para poder atender a todos sus clientes. Lo mismo hizo el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.500.00 ($167) que obtuvo para pagarlo en 4 meses. La señora Ilza quiere seguir incrementando sus ventas para que se cumpla su gran sueño “Ser directora de su sector en los productos de Belleza”, es su pasión, y se siente muy bien proponiendo, a la mujer actual, cómo debe arreglarse y cómo sentirse bien con ella misma.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics. (Compra de cosméticos.)

loans.name: Ruth Cenaida

texts.es:
Ruth is the eldest daughter of Celso and Elvira. The low economic resources of her family didn't allow her to go to school and follow her dreams, and because of that, conscious of the necessities of her parents and her six younger siblings, she decided to support them economically. With this goal she rented a small site to sell fuels. Now the business, thanks to her dedication, customer service and low prices, has generated good income and helped improved the well being of her family. The new goal of this enterprising woman is to enlarge her site and improve the quality of the goods she offers, and with the increased sales from this she'll earn considerably more income and be able to afford to go to school. She's requesting a loan, which she promises to repay within six months, to meet this end and is counting on your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth, es la hija mayor de Celso y Elvira. Los bajos recursos económicos de su familia no le permitieron seguir la carrera que tanto deseaba aprender y desempeñar, desde entonces, consciente de las necesidades de sus padres y sus seis menores hermanos, decidió apoyarlos económicamente y con ese fin alquiló un pequeño local para ofrecer combustible, negocio que ahora gracias a su dedicación, buen trato y bajos precios le vienen generando buenos ingresos económicos para colaborar con el bienestar y satisfacción plena de las necesidades de su numerosa familia..El deseo de esta emprendedora muchacha es ampliar su local y aumentar la cantidad de productos que oferta y con la venta de estos obtener considerables ingresos económicos; para concretar sus planes de estudios.En esta oportunidad recurre a tu buen corazón y solicita un préstamo que promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Enlarge sales site and improve quality of goods so she can afford to go to school and live out her dreams.

loans.name: Marlube Jacoba

texts.en:
Marlube opened and runs her own small grocery store in the hills just outside the city center of Ayacucho, Perú. There, she sells basic food products in bulk such as sugar, rice, and flour. She also sells firewood, cleaning products, and kitchen items. Marlube explains that she makes sure to provide the largest variety of products in her small space in order to attract the largest number of clients, and her strategy is working. Just a short year-and-a-half after she opened her doors, Marlube caters to her whole neighborhood and is always busy helping clients.

Before she opened her grocery store, Marlube was working in the hotel business as a housecleaner. When she became pregnant and her baby was born, there was nobody at home to care for her newborn because her husband also works very hard. Facing this problem, Marlube decided to take the initiative and start her own small business. This way, she says, she is more independent and is able to spend all day caring for her daughter.

Marlube’s dream has always been to move her family out of the room she rents from her father and into their very own house. As far as her professional aspirations are concerned, Marlube would love to one day open a second grocery store. With the profits she is saving from her current business, she will soon be able to realize her goals, she says excitedly. Being a part of her village bank has been a major component in her ability to open a business and accumulate capital. She is very happy to be involved and receive loans from her bank. With the $300 loan, she is requesting, Marlube will increase the quantity and variety of the products she sells.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia knits sweaters and sells potatoes and chuños (freeze-dried potatoes) that she brings from her native hometown. Her husband receives a regular salary as an inter-region cab driver. These three activities make up the couple's income which covers the costs of providing for their 4 children who are still students. They live in the region of San Martín de Porres in the city of El Alto.

The loan she requests will be used to buy more wool for her sweater business as well as more potatoes and chuños for the other one, so their family income can be increased. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good credit behavior with the first loan approves her for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia trabaja como tejedora de chompas y comerciante de papa y chuño que trae de su pueblo natal; el esposo es chofer asalariado inter departamental y de estas tres actividades derivan sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos que están en edad escolar. Vive en la zona San Martín de Porres de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinara a la compra de más lana para sdu negocio de chompas y también comprará mas papa y chuño para su negocio de venta de dichos productos y así de esa forma intentar incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago del primer crédito le permite acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business's inventory

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a woman who sets goals and accomplishes them. This single mother of 2 children has owned a small grocery store or “tienda D. abarrotes” for the past ten years. Modesta began working as a “feriante,” which means that she would travel from the city of Ayacucho, Perú several hours to the rural countrysiD. to buy large supplies of cereals and other products to bring home and sell in the smaller city markets. It was an extremely difficult way of life, and one which did not allow the generation of much profit. It had always been a dream of Modesta’s to open a grocery store, and so one day she decided to change gears completely and accomplish her lifelong goal.

Today, 10 years later, Modesta is the proud owner of a beautiful grocery store in a neighborhood just outsiD. the city center of Ayacucho. As the keen businesswoman Modesta has grown to be, she is always looking for ways to increase the amount of business that passes through her doors. She began with a simple supply of “abarrotes,” or staple food items sold in bulk such as rice, flour and cooking oil. This grew to the supply of more specialized food items, candies, and sodas. Just recently, she has begun selling a wiD. selection of fresh vegetables and homemaD. condiments. Daily she prepares a variety of traditional Peruvian condiments such as chili and garlic sauces that greatly help her busy customers in the preparation of their daily meals. Modesta decided to add these new products to her grocery store because she says the only way to attract more customers is through offering new and different products. She happily reports that the vegetables and condiments have been a great success and she is serving even more customers than ever.

Modesta is currently working towards her goal of renovating her home and grocery store. It is the next step, she says, in the continual improvement of her business. It is very necessary that she turns over the greatest profit possible as she not only supports her two children, but also the three surviving grandchildren of her son who just recently passed away. For this reason, she is very happy to be a part of her village bank. There, she has learned how to save her money in the bank where it accumulates interest. It is also a place where she is able to socialize with friends and be distracted from the difficulties of life. Modesta is currently requesting a loan of $300, with which she will buy larger quantities of products to stock in her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of goods to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
We found Maruja very happily and eagerly cleaning her restaurant, which is the only source of income her and her husband, Cristóbal, count on to provide for their family. In this small but cosy restaurant they prepare the richest stews at the best prices in the area, thanks to their good seasoning and customer service. Maruja is pleased with the results, but her goal is to enlarge and refurbish her small rented site with the hope of providing more comfort and personal attention to their customers. With the increased income, they could also improve their own home and offer more comfort to their 9-year-old child. To carry out their plans in a short amount of time, they are requesting a loan and thank you for your generous heart and selfless support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Maruja, muy alegre y afanosa haciendo la limpieza de su restaurante, único ingreso económico con el que cuentan junto a su esposo, Cristóbal, para mantener a su familia; en este pequeño pero acogedor restaurante preparan los potajes más ricos y económicos de su zona, negocio que gracias a su buena sazón y trato que ofrece a sus clientes obtiene día a día asiduos comensales. Ella se siente contenta con los resultados que está obteniendo pero el deseo que tiene en mente es ampliar y refaccionar su pequeño local alquilado, con el fin de brindarles una mejor comodidad y atención a las personas que visitan día a día su pequeño espacio de ventas, así mismo con los beneficios que obtenga ofrecerle una morada cómoda y propia a su pequeño retoño de nueve años de edad.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo con el que gracias a tu generoso corazón y apoyo desinteresado podrá concretar en muy corto tiempo sus planes.

loans.use: Renovate and enlarge a small restaurant.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother. She has a 17 year old daughter who helps her with her junior clothing store. This generates income to cover their rent and her daughter's education. The store is located in the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. They live in the same city as the Fero Petrol.

The credit will be used to increase their inventory, which will meet the market's demands. This is her first loan with IMPRO. A completed credit evaluation has approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda, como mucha mujeres bolivianas, es madre soltera de una hija de 17 años de edad, quien le ayuda con el puesto comercial de ropa juvenil que cuentan para la sobre vivencia y la educación de la hija. El puesto esta ubicada en la zona Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la misma ciudad de la Zona de Fero Petrol.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar mercadería y de esa forma satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: buy products for her business's inventory

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is involved in a number of businesses in order to help support her husband and three children. On Sundays, her week begins with setting up her stand and filling it with as many shoes, shoe accessories, purses, and t-shirts as it can hold. This is done in one of the newer markets just outside the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. She and her fellow market vendors are slowly recruiting more vendors to this market in order to create a popular new destination for the Ayacuchan population. On Tuesdays, Nora returns to the market to sell shoes from her stand as well. Nora’s week ends on Saturday when she wakes up very early in the morning and travels to a chicken and fish farm in the city. There, she buys a large supply of meat which she transports via bus to the rural countryside. Once well outside the city, Nora sets up a stand selling the fresh meat by the kilo. She also makes sure, she says, to bring along supply of shoes to sell, because a variety of products is the key to attracting customers.

The days that Nora isn’t selling products from behind one of her three different stands are not spent idly. Her husband also works extremely hard, explains Nora, and while he is away, she takes care of their three children. In fact everything Nora does is for her kids. She is currently saving up her money to buy a house for herself and her husband, leaving the house they presently own for her sons and their families. Professionally, Nora says her dream is to leave the tiresome traveling behind and open a small grocery store.

All these dreams are possible thanks in large part to Nora’s involvement with her village bank. For the past 4 years, she has been learning how to save her money and accumulate capital. Nora is requesting a loan of $900. With this money, she will buy a larger supply and greater quantity of shoes and sandals to sell from her stand in the market.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply and greater quantity of shoes and sandals to sell from her stand in the market.

loans.name: Brígida

texts.es:
12 years ago Brígida and Eleuterio, natives of Cojata, decided to come together and form their own family. As a result of their love for each other, their two children were born. With their children they parted from the land where they were born, seeking a better future. Now they live in the city of Juliaca, the place where Eleuterio offers his services to the general population as a bicycle taxi driver, his only form of work. With this job he physically exerts himself in order to sustain his family. Meanwhile Brígida dedicates herself to the sale of dress garments, a business that she has been learning little by little. Now she has accumulated the experience and desires to expand and increase the quantity of her merchandise. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan that she will invest in her garment business. At this time this hard working and enthusiastic couple awaits your quick and generous response.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 12 años Brígida y Eleuterio naturales de la comunidad de Cojata, decidieron unirse y formar su familia, fruto de su amor nacieron dos niños y con ellos en brazos partieron de la tierra que los vió nacer, en busca de un mejor porvenir.Actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar en el que Eleuterio, ofrece servicio de movilidad a la población en su única herramienta de trabajo, su triciclo, para obtener a base de mucho esfuerzo físico el sustento familiar; en tanto Brígida se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que poco a poco fue aprendiendo y que ahora con la experiencia ya adquirida desea ampliar e incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería. Es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en su negocio de ventas prendas de vestir.Esta emprendedora y entusiasta pareja en estos momentos espera tu pronta y favorable respuesta.

loans.use: The purchase of a greater quantity and variety of garments to offer to the general public

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Well past the city limits of Ayacucho, Perú, in the beautiful green countrysiD. fed by a small river, one can find Rosa A. D. R. caring for her small vegetable field. This 69 year-old mother of nine children, harvests a large variety of crops according to the season such as spinach, carrots, onions, and even alfalfa, which she then sells in the busy city markets two times each week. When the large hacienda properties were redistributed among the people who labored them Rosa’s family received a large amount of land. Over the years, as her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren, and now Rosa and her husband have just a small piece of land to themselves alongsiD. their children.

Rosa says she is very grateful to have been a part of her village bank for the past several years because it has taught her how to save her money and accumulate interest in the bank. Unfortunately, in recent years both Rosa and her husband have fallen ill. Thanks to her savings, however, Rosa has been able to proviD. for the medicines and medical attention required, something which would have been unthinkable without her village bank. With the $300 loan Rosa is requesting, she and her husband will buy fertilizer and other materials for their small field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other materials for their small field.

loans.name: Josefina Altagracia

texts.en:
Josefina is 39 years old, married and mother of three children (two girls and a boy). Her husband is a farmer and cultivates cacao.

Nine months ago, Josefina took a loan from our organization and used it wisely and the loan has been repaid. She invested the money in the purchase of beauty products such as hand and body lotion, hair treatment lotion, shampoo, rinse and other products for nails and the skin. That activity had a very positive impact on her life and her family. With benefits from business, she could buy new uniforms and other school supplies so that her children could keep on going to school. She says that now she can put aside money for any emergency.

Now, the entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy more products, since supplies are running out in her small store. Josefina wants particularly to buy Jafra’s beauty products which are in demand in her zone. That way, she will increase her income and will better face the family’s economic issues.

loans.use: This second loan will be used to buy product to supply the entrepreneur's business, and to introduce Jafra's skin care products so that customers have more buying options.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Mrs. Agripina is 33 years old and is a happy and loving mother of three children. She noticed that the income that her husband was generating with his job as a bicycle taxi driver was insufficient to support her family. Therefore she decided to take up her own business selling rope, an indispensable commodity for livestock farmers that is sold at the markets of the many towns neighboring her birth town, Juliaca. This job has now transformed into a crucial form of economic income for Mrs. Agripina's family. Really this mother who is concerned for the wellbeing and education of her children just wants to keep generating these economic profits so that soon enough she will be able to provide her children with a superior education. With this purpose she is asking for a loan that will let her augment her investment money with the end goal of obtaining a larger income that will secure the wellbeing of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Agripina de 33 años de edad, es una madre muy alegre y amorosa de tres hijos. Observó que los ingresos económicos que su esposo, Alberto, obtenía como triciclista era insuficiente para mantener a su familia y decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de sogas, artículo indispensable para las familias ganaderas y agrícolas que ofrece en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca. Este oficio ahora se ha convertido en un ingreso económico muy importante para su familia. Actualmente esta madre preocupada por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos desea seguir generando beneficios económicos, para poder brindarles dentro de poco tiempo estudios superiores, con este propósito solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá aumentar su capital de inversión a fin de obtener mayores ingresos para procurarle bienestar a su querida familia.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to acquire a larger quantity of rope

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 50, is a disciplined, assiduous and persistent single mother. Her husband died fifteen years ago and left her with nine children to support. She says that she could hardly make ends meet. Shortly after her husband’s death, she opened a very small grocery store and had to close it two years later. In 1997, she started over the business which still exists in spite of everything.

Her grocery store offers various types of products such as rice, beans, flour, milk, rum and sugar. She says she makes a weekly profit of USD 120.00.

The entrepreneur has applied for a loan (her second one with our organization) to purchase more goods to supply her business. She will also remodel her locale in order to improve the hygienic conditions of the space where she runs the business.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will spend the funds in the buy or more products to supply her business and to remodel the local where she runs her grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda and José are a young married couple, ages 22 and 28. They are very hardworking and enterprising individuals with very high hopes of moving forward and providing a better quality of life for their three young children. They currently live in a house along with their parents and siblings. This place also serves as their shoe store, and thanks to their hard work, dedication and craftsmanship they are succeeding. They employ four people from the city to help them. The goal of this enthusiastic couple is to acquire two machines so they can continue making beautiful, innovative and comfortable shoes, which will help them generate more income so they can purchase some land and build their own home so they can live comfortably with their children, who are the reason they work so hard. At they same time, they want to support their beloved parents who have always gone out of their way to help them. Your financial support and selflessness will be a blessing to this young couple.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda y José, conforman una pareja de esposos jóvenes de 22 y 28 años de edad, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadores y emprendedores con muchísimas ganas de salir adelante y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres queridos pequeños.Actualmente viven en una casa junto a sus padres y hermanos, en este lugar funciona su taller de calzados, gracias a su empeño, dedicación y excelentes trabajos están teniendo éxito, ofreciendo trabajo a otras cuatro personas de su ciudad.El deseo de esta entusiasta pareja es adquirir dos máquinas para seguir fabricando hermosos, novedosos, y cómodos calzados; con los que a través de los beneficios económicos que genere puedan ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un terrenito y construir su casita para cobijar cómodamente a sus tres pequeños niños, quienes son la razón por lo que se esfuerzan y trabajan incansablemente y al mismo tiempo brindar apoyo a sus ancianos y queridos padres que siempre han estado prestos a ayudarlos.Tu apoyo económico y desinteresado será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta joven pareja, confía en ellos ¡no te defraudaran!.

loans.use: Purchase two extremely needed machines to make beautiful and comfortable shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a grinding machine for crushing tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and fabrics to resell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a 23-year old woman who, 6 years ago, already had her own notions sales stall, a traD. that she learned and inherited from her loving and self-sacrificing mother, Lucía. She works offering her products for sale as a street vendor in the commercial area of her native city, Juliaca, from 8:00am until 7:00pm. This work requires great willpower, dedication and perseverance, always with the goal of prospering besiD. her loving family. The desire of this enterprising and exemplary young woman is to save enough money to one day begin selling electric devices wholesale. In order to realize her dreams, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity and variety of merchandise. Beatriz promises to repay the loan over a period of six months. Let’s help this enterprising young woman to achieve her objectives in the least time possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es una joven D. 23 años D. edad, hace 6 años ya poseía su puesto D. venta D. mercerías, oficio que aprendió y heredó D. su querida y abnegada madre, Lucia. ElL. se dedica a ofertar sus productos en forma ambulatoria en una zona comercial D. su ciudad natal, Juliaca, desD. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 7:00 D. L. noche, trabajo que desempeña con mucha voluntad, dedicación y perseverancia, siempre con el objetivo D. prosperar junto a su amorosa familia. El deseo D. esta emprendedora y ejemplar joven es ahorrar lo suficiente para más adelante dedicarse a L. comercialización D. artefactos eléctricos, al por mayor y para concretar sus sueños solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en L. compra D. mayor cantidad y variedad D. mercadería. Beatriz promete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso D. seis meses. Apoyemos a esta emprendedora joven a lograr concretar en el menor tiempo posible sus objetivos.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida travels to all parts of Peru, buying clothing and bringing it home to sell in the small Andean city of Ayacucho, Perú. She explains that she has a passion for travel, having been to every corner of her country. For this reason, Soraida has truly found her niche in clothing sales, which allows her to travel all over. Every single day she wakes up early and leaves her home by 8 am. She then spends the entire day or several days traveling to different sites, buying and selling clothing. She sells all types from the very traditional to the most modern and fashionable.
