The majority of Soraida’s purchasing is done in either Cusco or the capital city of Lima, both of which are more than a 10 hour car trip outside of Ayacucho.

Before she sold clothing, Soraida was living in Lima, selling vegetables from a stand in one of the busy markets. It was an extremely difficult way to make a living, she explains, so she decided to move back to her hometown of Ayacucho where she has been able to buy her own home and begin her small business in clothing sales. For the past 6 years, her business has been growing steadily and she currently has many regular clients who come to her for all of their clothing needs. Soraida asserts happily that she is doing what she loves, and is always looking for new and better ways to increase the amount of clients she serves.

A key element in Soriada’s success has come from her involvement with her village bank. She says it has not only been a place to receive economic opportunities, but also it also serves as a distraction from the difficulties of life, as she has made many close friends. She also loves the lessons taught in her village bank regarding everything from business practices to self-esteem. Soraida is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she will pay for her transportation between Ayacucho and the rest of Perú, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of clothing to sell to larger quantities of clients.

loans.use: To pay for transportation between Ayacucho and the rest of Perú, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of clothing to sell to larger quantities of clients.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is 37 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department. She has only studied in primary school; she has one child who is a minor and depends on her.

She dedicates herself to the sale of gelatin and flan (desserts) which she prepares herself, and she has contracted employees to sell them in La Hermelinda market in the city of Trujillo. She doesn't do it herself because she has a child who needs her care. Bertha has spent 12 years working in this business, and it is thanks to friends that she got the idea to sell in this market. She decided to try and realized that it was a good business. Before, she worked in her cousin's house doing housework.

Bertha found out about Manuela Ramos through her mother who is a business associate of Communal Bank in the Carabamba district in the Julcan province. She formed her group "God guide our steps," obtained her first credit of S/. 300.00 (about $100) with which she bought supplies to make gelatin and flan and fixed her refrigerator which wasn't functioning well.

Her recent loan from Manuela Ramos of S/. 600.00 (about $200) to be repaid over four months, helped her invest in supplies she needed to prepare deserts, buy sugar and disposable cups and spoons.

Now Bertha dreams of having her own house and having a well-stocked store to make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by the Princeton University Language Project.

La señora Bertha tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad.

Estudió solo primaria completa; tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que dependen de ella.

Se dedica a la venta de gelatina y flan (postres) los cuales son preparados por ella misma; ha contratado empleados para venderlos en el mercado La Hermelinda de la ciudad de Trujillo; ella no lo hace porque tiene un hijo que necesita de su cuidado; la señora Bertha ya tiene 12 años trabajando en este negocio y fue gracias a unas amigas que le dieron la idea de vender en este mercado, ella decidió probar y se dio cuenta que había movimiento y que el negocio era bueno; antes ella trabajaba en la casa de su prima haciendo los quehaceres del hogar.

La señora Bertha se enteró de Manuela Ramos por medio de su mamá quien es socia de un Banco Comunal del distrito de Carabamba provincia de Julcán. Formó su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos”, obtuvo su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) con los que compró algunos insumos para la preparación de gelatina y flan e hizo reparar su refrigeradora que ya no estaba funcionando bien.

El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00 (aproximadamente $200) para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, le sirvió para invertir en los insumos que se necesita para la preparación de los postres; compró vasos descartables, cucharas descartables y azúcar.

Actualmente la señora Bertha sueña con tener casa propia y poner una tienda muy surtida para tener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare and sell desserts.

loans.name: Victoria Ursula

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Victoria has been the sole owner of her small grocery store in Ayacucho, Perú. This specific type of grocery store is known as a “tienda de abarrotes,” which is the name given to the sale of bulk food products such as rice, flour and cooking oil. However, upon entering her small “tienda,” it is obvious that Victoria puts a great deal of effort into the provision of a wide variety of products. She has a vegetable stand complete with several different types of potatoes as well as a small butchering corner where she can provide fresh cuts of meat to her customers. One can also find every type of snack food and candy on the fully stocked shelves lining the walls.

Before she opened her grocery store, Victoria was selling food products from a small stand in one of the many markets in Ayacucho. However, when she became pregnant with her first of two children, she decided to change professions to one which allowed her more free time to be with her children. For this reason, she opened her store from the front of her home. Additionally, Victoria’s husband owns a restaurant nearby, which she supplies with all of her food products.

As far as goals are concerned, Victoria has many. She says she is always looking for ways to grow her business and attract more customers as well as save diligently. Currently, she is saving capital to one day build a second story onto her home. For the past 3 years, Victoria has been a part of her village bank, and it is because of this that she has been able to grow even more rapidly and save her capital in the bank where it is accumulating interest. She is very happy within her bank, she says, because it has taught her how to be more responsible and she also enjoys the many friendships she has made there. Victoria is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she says she will buy a little more of everything to stock in her grocery store, thus attracting more customers and earning a greater profit.

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety of goods sold in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
About 10 months ago Lucía and Patricio suffered the painful loss of their only son, 17-year old Guillermo. His death caused a lot of suffering and pain, but thanks to God they are moving forward and getting past these hard moments that they have had to live through. Now Lucía, who is 52 years old, has decided to take refuge and distract herself in her daily work selling notions, which is work she has done for a long time. Lucía would like to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise and, with the profits, save enough money to have a secure and tranquil old age with her partner of her entire life, her husband Patricio. In order to realize these and other plans, Lucía is requesting a loan with the promise that she will repay it over a period of 6 months. Let’s help Lucía overcome these difficult times that she’s had to live through, and offer her the tranquility that she deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente diez meses Lucía y Patricio, sufrieron la penosa pérdida de su único hijo, Guillermo de 17 años; este hecho que les causó mucho sufrimiento y dolor, pero gracias a Dios están saliendo adelante y superando esos momentos difíciles que les tocó vivir. Ahora la señora Lucía de 52 años de edad, decidió refugiarse y distraerse en su labor diaria de venta de mercerías, trabajo a la que está dedicada desde hace mucho tiempo. El deseo de Lucía, es aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga ahorrar lo suficiente para tener una vejez tranquila y segura, ahora solo junto a su compañero de toda su vida su esposo, Patricio. Para concretar este y otros planes, Lucía, solicita un préstamo con el compromiso de reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Ayudemos a Lucía a superar los momentos difíciles que le tocó vivir y brindémosle la tranquilidad que se merece.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of to strengthen her little shop with the goal of having a tranquil old age.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma provdes delicious homemaD. Peruvian dishes to her community from her very own restaurant in Ayacucho, Perú. Her favorite and most popular dishes are foods traditional to her home region of Ayacucho. For example, “puca picante” is a very popular Ayacuchan dish that contains beef, potatoes, and peanuts in a red sauce and served over rice. She also says anything with beef, chicken, or fish sells extremely fast. Vilma prepares all the food herself, in order to ensure the highest quality, while her daughters help out with the other duties. Every single day of the week, one can enter her restaurant and for just 3 Nuevo Soles, or about $1.00 USD, buy the “menu,” which is a lunch including a large bowl of homemaD. soup and a huge second dish of meat and rice.

Although Vilma has been located in Ayacucho only about 4 years, she has been cooking and serving food for the majority of her life. For many years she was located in the Ayacuchan jungle. However due to past violence in the region, she moved herself and her 9 children to Ayacucho where she says she is very happy to stay. Vilma says she is always looking for ways to increase the amount of clients passing through her doors and that her dream is to one day open a seafood restaurant. She says she loves to cook with seafood and he market has a greater profit potential as it is very popular and more expensive in the region. In order for this dream to be realized, Vilma explains that the first step is to open up more space in her restaurant and renovate the roof from straw thatching to sturdier and longer lasting materials. >p> For the past three years, Vilma has been involved with her village bank, and it is there that she receives the economic opportunities that make the realization of her dreams possible. Within her village bank, Vilma says she is very happy. It has helped her greatly and she says she can’t imagine trying to grow her small business without the loans provided. She is presently requesting a loan of $200, with which she will buy all the ingredients necessary to continue preparing delicious foods everyday.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients necessary for preparing the food in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods  for her store

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Zenobia has been buying and selling a specific type traditional dress worn by the women in the region of Ayacucho, Perú. As one walks down a street in Ayacucho, it is very common to see the women wearing beautiful, brightly colored and intricately embroidered skirts. This skirt is called a “centro” and the slips that are worn underneath to add fullness are called “fustanes.” Zenobia has capitalized on the long standing popularity of these beautiful skirts and sells them to many clients in the area.

To obtain her supply of skirts, Zenobia travels to the nearby city of Huancayo, where the skirts are mass produced. These she brings to her stand in one of the markets just outside the city of Ayacucho to sell. Because the skirts are so finely detailed and of such high quality, they are very expensive. One skirt, she explains, sells for 400 Nuevo Soles, or about $130 USD. This is so prohibitively expensive for the majority of Zenobia’s, that many buy an outfit on credit or even pay her in food products, such as cereals instead of the Peruvian Nuevo Sol.

Zenobia explains that when she joined her village bank some 10 years earlier, she only had enough capital to request a loan of $50, an amount that doesn’t even come close to the purchase of a single skirt. Today, however, after much hard work and diligence, Zenobia is able to request a loan of $500. This growth, Zenobia explains, would not have been possible without the help from her village bank. Not only has it provided her with ample economic opportunities, it has also taught her how to be a confident female leader. All this has made the support of her 5 children and husband much easier. With the $500 she is requesting, Zenobia will be able to buy more skirts in Huancayo to sell in Ayacucho. She says she is constantly working toward her ultimate goal of opening her own store in downtown Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia, 47, is a loving mother of three. Her husband left her six years ago, and since then she has served as the father and mother for her children and has been their sole provider, thanks to her perseverance and dedication toward her work. She sells clothing items, and little by little the business has progressed and given Natalia favorable results and filled here with satisfaction and joy. Her hard work has helped improve the quality of life for her family. Of course, Natalia wants to keep prospering along with her business and keep advancing the family, helping her beloved children go to college and improve the situation in her country. To help her carry out her goals, Natalia is requesting a loan to purchase more articles for her business to sell so she can increase her income. This exemplary and courageous mother waits for your kind support and good heart to help move her and her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Natalia de 47 años, es madre de tres hijos a los que ama mucho, su esposo la abandonó hace siete años y desde entonces desempeño las funciones de padre y madre de sus retoños, siendo así el único sustento familiar, gracias a la perseverancia y dedicación que le puso a su negocio, la oferta de prendas de vestir.Poco a poco fue progresando obteniendo resultados favorables que la llenan de satisfacción y alegría, su buen desempeño en su noble labor ha podido contribuir notablemente a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Sin embargo Natalia desea seguir prosperando con su oficio que le está permitiendo sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciéndoles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos a fin de que muy pronto puedan contribuir con mejorar la situación de su familia y de su país..Para concretar sus planes Natalia solicita un préstamo para adquirir artículos para su comercialización y así obtener mayor beneficio económico. Esta ejemplar y valerosa madre espera el apoyo de tu gentil y buen corazón para salir adelante junto a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in more products to offer a wider quantity and variety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Catalina belongs to the Paltainas Communal Bank. She is 43 years old and is married with three children who attend the university. She lives in Paltay, in the Huaraz Provice, Ancash Department, where she sells flowers. She makes her sales weekly, on Wednesdays in Caraz. Thanks to this business, she has been able to pay for the education of her children. Her husband works growing flowers. With the recent loan which she has received from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase supplies for growing the flowers that she sells. (Insecticide, Manure, and Hormones)

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Catalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos que estudian en la Universidad. Vive en Centro Poblado de Paltay, Provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, se dedica a la venta de Flores, las vende semanalmente los días Miércoles en Caraz. Gracias a este negocio ella puede hacerse cargo de la educación de sus hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de flores. Con el reciente préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará insumos para el cultivo de las flores que a su vez vende (Insecticida, Guano y Hormonas).

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Doña Irma was talented in the kitchen. Her good seasoning to taste is the reason why her clients are always loyal to her after many years and buy their favorite dishes from her. After long years of making a living in the kitchen and selling all her food by delivery, three years ago she took action to have her own sales spot in the city market where she offers her cultural and varied dishes, from stews that are true delights prepared by the delicate hands of Doña Irma to desserts like gelatins and cakes. Thanks to her talent she can be a very important hero in providing for the household to give her kids the best quality education, forging a better future for them. Every day she wakes up very early to purchase the ingredients that she will serve in the preparation of her dishes and later set to cooking them so she may deliver the sales in the morning. The good seasoning and good taste in her food make all her prepared food sell by midday and she gets ready all her materials for tomorrow's preparations. She desires to continue improving the well being of her family and especially for her dear children, and it is for this reason that in the near future she plans to open a beauty center and practice the job that she learned in occupational school during her free hours. During it all she will continue working in her job of food sales, for which she has planned to make improvements to her sales space with the intention of offering more comfort and a greater variety of food. This is why she is requesting a loan with the plan to buy nonperishables in bulk and with the earnings that she attains she will continue paying the education expenses for her kids. Support Doña Irma so she may continue forward with her hopes.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Doña Irma, siempre fue talentosa en la cocina, su buena sazón a deleitado durante años a muchos de sus clientes que siempre le son fieles a la hora de comprar sus platillos favoritos, es por ello que tras largos años de dedicarse a la cocina vendiendo de manera ambulante hace tres se animó a tener su propio puesto de ventas en el mercado de su ciudad en el que ofrece sus acostumbrados y variados platos, desde caldos y segundos que son verdaderas delicias preparadas por las delicadas manos de Doña Irma hasta postres como gelatinas y tortas. Gracias a su talento puede ser una protagonista muy importante en el mantenimiento de su hogar para otorgar a sus hijos ya mayores una educación de calidad, forjando en ellos un mejor futuro. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para hacer las compras de los ingredientes que le servirán en la preparación de sus platos y luego se dedica a cocinarlos para llevarlos en la mañana a vender, el buen trato y la buena sazón hacen de que a medio día ya haya terminado toda la comida que preparó y alista todos sus materiales para la preparación del día siguiente.Ella desea seguir superándose por el bien de su familia y sobre todo el de sus queridos hijos y es por esta razón que piensa en un futuro no muy lejano abrir un centro de belleza y ejercer el oficio que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional durante sus horas libres; mientras tanto seguirá trabajando en su puesto de ventas de comidas para el cual ha planeado mejorar y acondicionar su espacio a fin de ofrecer mayor comodidad y variedad de comidas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar víveres no perecibles en mayor cantidad y con las ganancias que obtenga seguir afrontando los gastos educativos de sus hijos.Apoya a Doña Irma a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy nonperishables in bulk to continue offering exquisite dishes to her community.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 29 year-old mother of two who sells fruit in a beautiful park in downtown Ayacucho, Peru. As an “ambulante,” Sabina’s stand is mobile and she spends the majority of the day traveling throughout the park, stopping to sell her products wherever she can find the greatest concentration of hungry people. The fruit is shipped fresh weekly from Lima in huge loads. This she has been doing for the past year. Before, she prepared and sold “chicha,” a popular Peruvian beverage made from maize and sugar. Sabina explains that this was a difficult way to turn over a significant profit, so like any smart businesswoman would do, she analyzed the market and decided to change gears and sell fruit. She is very happy with her decision, as she is currently making much more money and better able to support her young family. Additionally, Sabina has also found work as a nanny for two children in the area. This she alternates monthly with fruit sales.

In the past year with her village bank, Sabina has learned how to save her money formally in the bank where it is safe and accumulates interest. Through the economic help she receives, Sabina is always looking for ways to improve her business and working toward her dream of one day opening a small grocery store. Sabina is currently requesting a loan of $350, which will help her to buy larger supplies of fruit to sell to larger amounts of clients.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia is a woman that works every day spiritedly and wants her family to progress. Since she was very young she has dedicated herself to commerce of various items and her experiences in various enterprises have prepared her to execute very well in the businesses that she begins; before she had a sales position in fresh vegetables and today she makes a living selling fruit juices. She already has five years dedication to this job and during this time she has been comfortably saving a lot thanks to her hard work and she has also fulfilled many of her desires with the earnings that she has obtained with this job. Now she has in mind great dreams, among them to possess a little business to continue exercising her management leadership that she has in each organization in which she forms a part of the means to make earnings and successes for all those that contribute. All these activities are motivated by her little children who every day encourage her to continue forward and offer the best of her self in every thing that she desires to do. She shares these life lessons daily with her kids to ensure that they will continue in the same steps of honor as her. Lucia requests a loan and thanks the hearts of those who strive to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Lucia, es una mujer que cada día trabaja esforzadamente y quiere que su familia progrese, desD. muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio D. artículos en diversos rubros y su experiencia en varias empresas la han preparado para hoy desempeñarse muy bien en los negocios que emprenD.; antes tenia un puesto D. venta D. verduras frescas y hoy se dedica a la venta D. jugos D. frutas; ya tiene cinco años dedicándose a esta labor y durante este período ha ido atesorando muchas satisfacciones gracias a su esfuerzo y también ha concretado muchos deseos con las ganancias que ha obtenido con esta ocupación.Ahora tiene en mente grandes anhelos, entre ellos el D. aperturar una pequeña empresa para seguir ejerciendo el liderazgo que tiene en cada organización en la que forma parte a fin D. obtener ganancias y éxitos para todos los que la conforman.Así mismo todas estas actividades son motivadas por sus pequeños que cada día la animan a seguir adelante y ofrecer lo mejor D. sí en cada cosa que desea emprender.Estas lecciones D. vida las comparte diariamente con sus hijos que D. seguro seguirán los mismos pasos D. valor que ella.Lucia solicita un préstamo y para ello toca la sensibilidad D. aquellos corazones solidarios que se apresuren a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy cooking goods to continue the preparation of her delicious juices with the objective of soon opening the doors of a new business.

loans.name: Yunely

texts.es:
Ms. Yunely belongs to the Progressive Womens' Mientras Tanto group. She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Banda de Shilcayo District. Her home and business are located in Jr. Las Palmeras, number 135. She provides internet services, and sells snacks and soft drinks to the customers who use her service.

She is a single woman who opened her business of her own initiative. Her home is located near the Technological Institute, and she serves the needs of students. She has the support of her parents, and has been open for two months. Every day she gains new customers, giving them personal service based on the training that she has received.

With the recent loan of 300.00 soles ($100.00) which she has received from Manuela Ramos to be repaid in 4 payments, she has purchased some printing material (paper), snacks, and soft drinks.

Ms Yunely's goals are to become independent, (operate without her parents' support,) and to with her own location, open a store selling clothing and shoes, while continuing her internet service, as she feels able to manage both businesses at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Yunely pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mujeres Progresivas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Las Palmeras Nº 135, se dedica a prestar servicios de Internet y en el mismo local vende algunos refrigerios y gaseosas para su clientela que utiliza este servicio.

Es soltera y su negocio lo puso con iniciativa propia ya que su domicilio está ubicado cerca de un Instituto Tecnológico y era una necesidad para los estudiantes, tiene el apoyo de sus padres, empezó hace 2 meses y cada día está incrementando sus clientes, la atención es personalizada y tiene estudios al respecto con el cual puede dar soporte a sus clientes.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 100.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró algunos materiales de impresión (papeles) y golosinas, gaseosas para la venta de refrigerios.

La señorita Yunely quiere, más adelante, independizarse (dejar el apoyo de sus padres) y teniendo su propio local piensa instalar una tienda de venta de ropas y zapatos sin dejar el servicio de Internet ya que se siente capaz de administrar los dos negocios a la vez.

loans.use: Purchase of paper.  Purchase of snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has been working in grocery sales since she created a market close to her home twenty-four years ago and today she continues dedicated to this activity because she wants to offer a better future to her three children who are the sole reason for her existence. She has always worked with dedication and effort and has known to allocate her time properly between caring for her kids and her business. She's been doing this for all these years so now she watches with satisfaction the positive response from her children who treat their studies with persistence and dedication. This fact encourages her to continue increasing her plans to improve her sales position at the market. So every day Antonia leaves very early from her home all prepared and with all the chores done so that she can dedicate her whole morning to the grocery sales, then later in the evening she can tend to all the demands of her kids and her home. Antonia wants to acquire a greater quantity and variety of merchandise to obtain a larger earnings and pay for college-prep and university studies for her two older children, who also support her in the market during the busiest hours. She is requesting a loan to invest in these goals. The possibility to support Antonia is in your hands; don't let this opportunity pass.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Antonia, viene trabajando desde hace muchos años en la venta de abarrotes, desde cuando se creó un mercado cerca de su localidad ya hace 24 años y hoy sigue inmersa en esta actividad porque quiere ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos que son toda la razón de su existencia.Ella siempre con dedicación y esfuerzo ha sabido repartir adecuadamente su tiempo para atender a sus hijos y su negocio, y lo ha estado haciendo durante todos estos años para ahora observar con satisfacción la respuesta positiva de sus hijos a través del empeño y dedicación en sus estudios, este hecho la anima a seguir incrementando sus planes para mejorar su puesto de ventas en el mercado. Así cada día, Antonia, sale muy temprano de su casa ya lista y con todos los quehaceres realizados para dedicarse toda la mañana a la venta de los abarrotes para luego por las tardes atender todas y cada una de las demandas de sus hijos y hogar.Antonia desea adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para obtener mayores ganancias y pagar los estudios universitarios y preparación preuniversitaria de sus dos hijos mayores, quienes también la apoyan en la atención de su puesto de ventas en el mercado durante las horas de mayor demanda; para ello solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en estos fines.Recuerda la posibilidad de apoyar a Antonia, está en tus manos no dejes pasar esta oportunidad.

loans.use: Capital to acquire a greater quantity and variety of everyday goods for her market sales.

loans.name: Lucila Máxima

texts.es:
Doña Lucila is a woman who has always found a way to take care of her kids on her own. Today after many years have gone by, she watches with satisfaction the independence of her older children within their society and now she just shares her longings and her little home with her last daughter, who is eighteen years old. Everyday she motivates her. Doña Lucila had worked for over twenty years as a domestic employee and in payment for her services the family, with whom she worked, left her to inherit the house in which she lives today. In this house she saw the best way for her to obtain an income to care for her kids. Making use of part of this beautiful house she opened a little grocery store. Fifteen years have already passed since then and now she can see the fruits of her labor. Because she is at such an advanced age, she cannot lift objects of much weight and has a slightly limited physical capability, but it is more than the constant physical efforts that her life demands of her. Doña Lucila desires to see her last daughter graduated as a professor and so she will continue making the effort in her store, where she sells groceries and the everyday necessities. This is why she requests a loan with the objective of investing it in the purchase of a great quantity and variety of the articles that her clients demand daily. Let's support these noble desires of forging a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucila, es una mujer que siempre ha visto la manera de sostener sola a sus hijos, hoy ya después de muchos años transcurridos ve con satisfacción el desenvolvimiento de sus hijos mayores dentro de su sociedad y ahora sólo comparte sus anhelos y pequeña morada con su última hija de 18 años que cada día la motiva a seguir adelante.Doña Lucila ha trabajado por más de veinte años como empleada doméstica y en retribución de sus servicios la familia con la cual trabajaba le dejó en herencia la casa donde hoy habita y por ello vió la mejor manera de obtener ganancias para sostener a sus hijos.Es por ello que haciendo uso de las instalaciones de esta bella casa aperturó una pequeña bodega, ya han pasado 15 años desde aquel entonces y ahora puede observar los frutos de su labor. Por su avanzada edad ya no puede cargar objetos de mucho peso y tiene un poco limitado el esfuerzo físico más no los esfuerzos de ánimo que son ilimitados en la vida de Doña Lucila.Doña Lucia desea ver a su última hija graduada de profesora y por ello seguirá esforzándose en su tienda de venta de abarrotes y víveres de primera necesidad, es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos que le demandan a diario sus exigentes clientes.Apoyemos estos nobles deseos de forjar un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Capital to acquire a great quantity and variety of everyday goods.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Mrs. Marleney is a member of the Las Estrellitas II Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. Her address is located in Jr. Progreso number 282 or Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, and her business is at Jr. Tahuantinsuyo, block 8 (market no. 2). She sells groceries in small amounts, including products such as rice, sugar, beans, crackers, noodles, potatoes, and greens, among others. She is a single mother and as such has worked hard to grow her business. She has 2 small children who depend on her for support, but thanks to the support of Manuela R., her business continues to grow. In the beginning, she sold furniture, but sales were slow and she needed to have a business with daily sales to allow her feed her children and send them to school. She has all manner of customers now that her business is in the market. Now that she offers a greater variety of products, she also has other larger clients (restaurants) who request their orders on set schedules. With the latest loan that she received from Manuela R., which will be paid in 4 months, she will purchase a variety of products, including bulk rice and sugar, and tubers and produce from the coast, and by doing so she will be able to meet the needs of her varied clientele. Mrs Marleny is 25 years old, and her dream is to purchase land where she can build her own store and grow her business to provide more security for her children; her greatest motive to work. She says that by working as hard as she does, she is able to show that women can progress with strength and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 282 del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril y su negocio en el Jr. Tahuantinsuyo Cdra. 8 (mercado Nº 02), se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor tales como arroz, azúcar, menestras, galletas, fideos, papas, verduras, entre otros. Es madre soltera y por lo tanto trabaja sola para sacar adelante su negocio, tiene 2 hijos que aún son pequeños y dependen de ella, pero gracias a su gran esfuerzo y al apoyo de Manuela R. cada vez su negocio está creciendo. Al principio vendía muebles pero el negocio es lento y ella necesitaba tener un negocio con un movimiento diario para poder alimentar y hacer estudiar a sus hijos, actualmente tiene clientes de todo sitio ya que su establecimiento está situado en el mercado y a parte tiene clientes grandes que le hacen pedidos en horarios determinados (restaurantes) ya que tiene variedad en sus productos. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela R., el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará variedad de productos como arroz y azúcar en sacos, tubérculos y verduras que vienen de la costa, y así satisfacer las necesidades de su variada clientela. La señora Marleny tiene 25 años y su anhelo es comprar un terreno para construir su propio local y ampliar su negocio en un local propio dándoles seguridad a sus hijos que son el motivo de su trabajo, ella dice que trabajando como lo hace se puede demostrar a las mujeres que sí podemos salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries). Purchase of greens and tubers

loans.name: Elmith

texts.es:
Mrs. Elmith belongs to the Las Cucardas II Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, San Martin Province, Banda Shilcayo district in the Las Flores housing association. Her business is located at her hom on Jr. Las Margaritas, block F, lot 15. She sells groceries in small amounts, including products such as rice, sugar, beans, crackers, noodles, among others. She gets help from her children and husband, who also sell plastics door to door. Thanks to their support and a loan from Manuela Ramos she has been able to grow her business. She began her business with just a few products which she sold from a table. Now she is equipped with cabinets, and a variety of products which meet the needs of the clientele in her area. With the most recent loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 4 months, she will purchase more fast-selling products in greater quantity, including rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and other items which she has singled out based on her customers’ orders. Mrs Elmith is 33. She lives with her husband and children and has a great desire to continue working. She enjoys her job and would like to increase her business to include the sales of plastic products in her home as well. Her close-knit family assures her success.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elmith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo y Asociación de Vivienda Las Flores, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr. Las Margaritas Mz. F Lote 15 y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor tales como arroz, azúcar, menestras, galletas, fideos entre otros. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, quienes también tienen la venta ambulatoria de plásticos, gracias a este apoyo y a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado incrementar su negocio. Ella se inició con pocos productos y con una mesa donde ofrecer sus productos y actualmente ya cuenta con armarios y variados productos que satisfacen la necesidad de los clientes de su localidad. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos que tienen más movimiento y en mayor cantidad como por ejemplo, arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos y otros que ha ido anotando de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes. La señora Elmith tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo e hijos, ella se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, le gusta lo que hace y piensa ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con la venta de plásticos en un espacio de su casa. Está segura de lograrlo porque tiene una familia unida.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (Groceries)

loans.name: Rosario Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosario is a young mother who day after day seeks to offer the best in health and well being to the members of her family. This fact made her decide a year ago to set up on the side of their home a little candy shop and juice shop, with the intention of providing economically for her six year-old daughter. Previosuly, Rosario was just dedicated to studying. When she married her partner and gave birth to her little daughter, the responsibilities became a lot greater and she saw the obligation to postpone her managerial studies for a period, with the hope of beginning them again in the future. Today she has been able to meet both her goals by satisfactorily finishing her studies without neglecting her role as a mother, so she may now look to the future with optimism. For this reason she will continue working and managing her own business with the longing to make it grow and create her own enterprise that will generate resources for her family and a group of families in her neighborhood. Rosario wants to open a store where she sells medical materials and instruments commercially because her house is located close to a hospital, but meanwhile she will continue working in her convenient store and extending the same quality of service as always. For this purpose she needs to invest a small amount of money in her present business to cover the expenses of her young daughter's education. Support Rosario to continue steadily in her longings to excel.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Rosario, es una joven madre que día a día busca lo mejor para brindarle salud y bienestar a los miembros de su familia. Esta realidad hizo que hace un año decidiera emprender al lado de su pareja el establecimiento de una pequeña juguería y confitería, a fin de poder sostener económicamente a su pequeña de seis años.Anteriormente, Rosario, sólo se dedicaba a estudiar; cuando se unió a su pareja y nació su pequeña las responsabilidades fueron más grandes y es así que ella se vió en la obligación de postergar por un tiempo sus estudios de administración con la esperanza de reanudarlos nuevamente en un futuro.Hoy ha podido concretar ese anhelo y pudo terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y no descuidar su rol de madre y mira el futuro con optimismo. Por esta razón seguirá trabajando y administrando su propio negocio con el anhelo de hacerla crecer y no quedarse sin crear su propia empresa que le genere recursos a su familia y a un grupo de familias de su localidad.Rosario desea abrir una tienda donde comercializar materiales e instrumentos médicos por estar ubicado su casa cerca de un hospital, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando en su juguería, atendiendo con la misma calidad de siempre y para este fin necesita invertir una pequeña cantidad de dinero en la implementación de su actual negocio para cubrir los gastos educativos de su pequeña.Apoya a Rosario a continuar firme en sus anhelos de sobresalir.

loans.use: Improve her little sales space for the convenience and loyalty of her clients.

loans.name: Domitila Teodora

texts.es:
Ever since she was a little girl, Domitila has always been committed to the agricultural activities because she comes from a family distinctly of farmers and cattlemen. All the life lessons that she received in her home have taught her to practice efficient labor in the fields of cultivation, dedicating herself to sowing potatoes, corn, and vegetables. She also raises cows and grows alfalfa for them year after year. Thanks to this activity she can satisfactorily meet the needs of her family and be a very important leader in the maintenance of her home, along with her husband who also aids her in these activities. Although last year she lost her entire harvest and earnings when an unending winter force fell over her fields, this did not discourage her and she continues forward by having planned to grow spinach and carrots this year during the wait period for the potato and corn harvests. Domitilia does all these activities for her three children who motivate her to continue forward with her longings to offer them the best so that they can achieve higher education. For this reason she is requesting a loan for this growing season to buy seeds and fertilizer and also improve her little cattle stable. All this and each of these earnings will be for the benefit and education of her children. Let's support Domitila in her noble mission to prepare her children for the life ahead of them.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Domitila, desde muy niña ha estado siempre ligada a las actividades agrícolas ya que proviene de una familia netamente agrícola y ganadera, todas las lecciones de vida que recibió en su hogar han hecho que ella ejerza de una manera eficiente su labor en sus campos de cultivo, dedicándose a sembrar papa, maíz y verduras, así mismo cría vacas y para ellas cultiva la alfalfa, año tras año. Gracias a esta actividad puede solventar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su familia y ser una protagonista muy importante en la manutención de su hogar, junto a su esposo que ahora también la apoya en estas actividades.A pesar de que el año pasado perdió totalmente su cosecha y ganancias cuando cayó sobre sus campos de cultivo la implacable fuerza del invierno, esto no la desanimó y sigue adelante y ha planeado para este año sembrar espinacas y zanahorias durante el tiempo de espera de la cosecha de papa y maíz. Todas estas actividades, Domitila, las realiza por el bien de sus tres hijos que la motivan a seguir adelante con sus anhelos a fin de ofrecerles lo mejor para que lleguen a superarse estudiando.Es por ello que para esta época de siembra solicita un préstamo con el propósito de comprar semillas y abonos y también para mejorar su pequeño establo de vacas, así mismo todas y cada una de estas ganancias serán en beneficio y para la educación de sus hijos.Apoyemos a Domitila en su noble misión de preparar a sus hijos para la vida.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, and improvements for the stalls in her little stable.

loans.name: Herbakkuk Group

texts.en:
The Herbakkuk Trust Group is a group of 13 members from the small community of Atwedie, near Nkawkaw. It is the type of town where everyone says hello to each other using their names. Needless to say, the members of this group have known each other for many years. They came together based on their shared desire and enthusiasm to expand their businesses. Members of this group are involved in a variety of businesses including grocery shops, meat stores, pharmacies, and sandal making. Another member of the group, Stephen B., owns the first of two pharmacies in town. He opened the pharmacy in 1964. The community depends mostly on his store for their medicine. Therefore, he would like to expand his inventory with new medicine including medicine for malaria. Aside from providing the community with medicine, Stephen also takes care of his 16 children! 2 of them are in middle school and he hopes that they will continue their education to university level.

(*Photo Note: Asiedu is in the bottom row in white and Stephen is in the back row in green.)

loans.use: To purchase tin fish, tomatoes, milk, sugar, leather, glue, fresh meats, medicine, and various other inventory

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Orfelina de Jesus is a member of the Creative Women’s Communal Bank. She sells bakery products in the Moyobamba food market, where she also sells long coriander, green onions, avocados, lettuce, aromatic herbs, etc. She offers fruit, including papaya and bananas, honey, and medicinal plants such as noni,(also called Great Morinda) jagua (also called Huito), etc. She also sells beans, and a variety of flowers, taking advantage of whatever is in season. Having been taught business skills by her mother since she was a child, she decided to open a business. She was brought up with a desire to earn her own income - to grow as a person and a woman, and by doing so provide support in paying the household bills. With the most recent loan from Manuela Ramos, which she will fulfill in 6 payments, she will purchase bulk beans, banana clusters, bulk honey, and large quantities of regional fruits, including papaya, coconut, noni, along with other products that she has needed to purchase almost daily, including long coriander, green onions, Chinese cabbage, lettuce, avocados, yucca, etc. To maintain her clientele, she makes sure that her stand is in order and that the product that she offers is fresh. She has 6 children and is 61 years old. Nearly all of her children anre independent now, and she now only supports the youngest. She enjoys her daily activities in her home, and her work in market, now that she has established a strong clientele by offering quality products. Her goal is to have her business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfelina de Jesús pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica la venta de productos de pan llevar en el mercado de abastos de Moyobamba, en donde ella ofrece desde verduras como culantro, cebolla china, paltas, lechuga, yerbas aromáticas, etc; también vende frutas como papaya, plátanos, así mismo vende miel de abeja, plantas medicinales como el Noni, jagua, etc. Complementa su negocio con menestras de toda variedad y flores, ella aprovecha los productos que están en temporada de producción. Decidió iniciarse en este negocio por que desde pequeña su mamá le enseño algunas habilidades para el negocio y también generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer, y así aportar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará menestras en sacos, plátano en racimos, grandes cantidades de miel de abeja, frutas de la región en grandes cantidades como papaya, cocona, noni y los demás productos que tiene que comprar casi a diario como culantro, cebolla china, col china, lechuga, paltas, yucas, etc. que pone a la venta todos los días, para mantener a su clientela ella tiene que surtir bien su puesto y vender productos en buen estado. Tiene 61 años y 6 hijos, casi todos ya independientes, en la actualidad sólo la última está a su cargo quien le apoya en sus actividades diarias, en la venta en el mercado y en las actividades de la casa, está contenta con lo que hace, porque disfruta de ello ya que tiene sus clientes seguros por la calidad de los productos que vende, su meta es tener su propio negocio en su propia casa .

loans.use: Purchase of bulk beans, fruit, aromatic herbs, honey, etc.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina belongs to the Creative Women's Cooperative Bank. She has a stand at the Ayaymaman Market in Moyobamba where she sells fruit juices and typical prepared foods like tamales and rice and meat dumplings cooked in leaves. She decided on her own to open the business, and enjoys the daily contact with her customers and being able to earn money and grow as a person. With this loan of 500 soles, or about $175, to be repaid in four installments, Sabina will buy the groceries she needs to prepare the food and drinks she sells--rice, sugar, flour, milk, and fruit. She will also buy glasses and table cloths to make a nice place for her customers to sit and enjoy their food. Sabina is 41 years old and has 4 children. She is happy in her work and enjoys the support of her husband and children. She has earned a good reputation for the quality of her food and strives to serve it higienically.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sabina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica la venta de jugos de diferentes frutas, refrigerios como juanes, tamales, humitas, sanguches de todo tipo, también vende golosinas en su puesto que tiene en el mercado Ayaymaman de Moyobamba en donde atiende a sus amistades y demás clientes que acuden a diario. Decidió iniciar su negocio por su propia iniciativa y por que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 soles ($ 167.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios y jugos como azúcar y arroz en sacos, harina para la preparación de kekes, vasos y jarritas pequeñas de vidrio, leche en cajas, y frutas para la preparación de jugos, también comprará manteles para sus mesas y así tener un ambiente limpio y agradable para que sus clientes se sientan cómodos y satisfechos. Tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, también esta satisfecha con los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, por la calidad de sus productos. Su meta es seguir mejorando en el negocio vendiendo productos preparados en buenas condiciones higiénicas, lo cual es necesario cuando se vende productos de consumo humano.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and glassware for a juice and snack stand.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina belongs to the Calzadina Cooperative Bank in Moyobamba. She sells groceries from her home and cold soft drinks at a stand at a nearby school. She also bakes bread and pastries. She is a hard-working woman who enjoys and challenge and being able to support herself. With this loan for 400 soles, or about $150, to be repaid in four installments. Orfelina will stock groceries including rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, soda, and other household goods like detergent. She is 49 years and has four children. Two of her daughters help with the businesses. Orfelina is very proud of her success and hopes to continue to offer her customers everything they need from a single location.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfelina pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidad Calzadina, vive en Moyobamba, Región San Martín. Se dedica la venta D. abarrotes en su casa, pero también ella venD. refrigerios en un kiosko que alquiló en el colegio D. su localidad, así mismo se dedica a la preparación y venta D. panes y dulces. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque es una persona muy dinámica que le encanta los retos y tiene habilidades para el negocio, con su dinamismo ella genera sus propios ingresos lo cual incrementa su autoestima así como su crecimiento como persona y mujer. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 400.00 soles ($ 134.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar en sacos, cajas D. leche D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, aceite en cajas, paquetes D. detergentes, fideos, gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, y demás productos para surtir mejor su negocio. Tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, dos D. sus hijas le apoyan en el negocio y en las actividades D. la casa, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha su clientela aumentó, su meta es contar con un negocio bien implementado para que el cliente encuentre todo lo que busca en un solo lugar.

loans.use: To stock groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Odomankoma Group

texts.en:
The Odomankoma group is from a small town on top of the mountains near Nkawkaw. The group is comprised of mostly farmers, a few shop owners, and a hairdresser. Aside from being guarantors of their loans for each other, the group provides peer support for their businesses. For example, the store owners purchase their vegetables from the farmers when they harvest their crops.

Constence Kessewa is one of the leaders of the group. She is a single mother of 6 and owns a small farm of tomatoes, garden eggs, pepper, onion, corn, plantains, and cassava (used to make fou-fou, a staple of Ghanaian cuisine). Constence is now 55 years old, and hopes to save enough money for her children’s education before she becomes too old to farm. She is using her loan to purchase more crops because there is a demand for them.

Another farmer of the group, Ernestina O. (now 57), is also wanting to stop farming because she is getting old. Ernestina grows cassava, plantains, coco yam, and tigernuts. She is using her loan to purchase a new variety of tigernuts. Tigernuts are normally sold in Ghana to eat by itself and is the size of an almond, but tastes like coconuts. This new variety of tigernuts is in high demand because they can be used to make biscuits, cakes, and gin. Sadly, Ernestina’s daughter just passed away in a motor accident. She left behind a store, which Ernestina hopes to renovate with her profits from the farm. This will allow her to work indoors with less physical labor. (*photo note: Several members of a different lending group from the community joined in the photo out of excitement)

loans.use: Mostly to purchase crops such as tigernuts, plantains, cassava, tomatoes, garden eggs, corn, pepper, and onions

loans.name: Nelida Esperanza

texts.es:
Nelida Esperanza belongs to the Creative Women's Cooperative Bank. She has a stand at the Moyobamba market where she sells vegetables including carrots, beets, yuca, potatoes, onions, cabbage, corn, and herbs like rue, cilantro and camomile. She makes an effort to stock a good assortment of fresh produce. She decided to open the stand in order to be an independent woman and to proviD. for her family. Nelida will use this loan of 1,300 soles, or about $450, to be repaid in six installments, to buy all of the vegetables she needs. Nelida is 47 and the mother of six. Four of her children still live at home and help her with the business and in maintaining the home. She is happy with the work she is doing, enjoys the daily contact with her customers, and is proud to have grown this business. Her customers really appreciate the quality of her produce. Nelida's dream is some day to open a similar shop in her home so she can tend to both the business and the home without neglecting her children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nélida Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica a la venta D. verduras en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. abastos D. Moyobamba, en donD. ella ofrece desD. culantro, zanahoria, betarraga, cebollas, papas, yucas, repollo, col china, maíz, yerbas aromáticas hasta ruda, manzanilla, etc., trata D. tener bien surtido su negocio con productos frescos. Decidió iniciarse en este negocio por que tenia la necesidad D. trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer, así como aportar económicamente en los gastos D. su hogar. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/ 1,300 soles ($ 434.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará sacos D. papas, cebolla, betarraga, yuca, repollo, zanahoria, y los demás productos que tiene que comprar a diario, como maíz, hierbas aromáticas, etc., para que puedan estar frescos y D. esa manera mantener a su clientela. Tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, D. los cuales 4 aun viven con ella y son quienes le apoyan en el negocio y la casa, está contenta con lo que hace, por que venD. en un lugar donD. acuD. bastante gente y pueD. estar en contacto con las personas y sus amistades, por eso disfruta D. su trabajo, desD. sus inicios, su negocio a crecido, ahora tiene buena clientela por la calidad D. los productos que venD., su meta es tener su propio negocio en su casa para poder compartir las actividades D. la casa con su negocio y sobre todo no descuidar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy wholesale vegetables and herbs.

loans.name: Melita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Melita del Carmen belongs to the Creative Women's Cooperative Bank. At her shop located at one of Moyobamba's bus stops she sells prepared foodstuffs typical to her region, candy and soft drinks. She is happy she decided to open the shop because she enjoys her work and has the support of her husband. She is proud to generate income for the family, and fortunate in that she has no nearby competition. With this loan for 1000 soles, or about $300, Melita plans to outfit a semi-professional kitchen where she can cook in greater volume. She also plans to stock the shop with all kinds of soft drinks, cookies and sweets, chocolate, toilet paper and all the bulk ingredients she uses for her cooking--rice, noodles, sugar, milk and canned goods. With this she'll have everything she needs to continue to satisfy her customers. Melita is 40 years old and the mother of six. Her children assist her in the operation of the store and in keeping their home. She hopes to expand and improve her store to attend to the travellers who arrive, and some day to buy a car so she can earn more money and provide for her children's education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Melita del Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica a la venta de refrigerios como juanes, tamales, humitas, también ofrece comida de la región, golosinas y bebidas gasificadas de todos los tamaños y marcas en su kiosko que tiene en uno de los paraderos de autos de la ciudad de Moyobamba, en donde atiende a sus clientes con carisma y buen trato. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque se dio cuenta que le gusta esta actividad y cuando se le presentó la oportunidad no la desaprovechó sobretodo porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, de esta manera ella pone en práctica sus habilidades y genera sus propios ingresos, por que en este lugar no tiene competencia. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1000.00 soles ($ 300), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará una cocina semi industrial para que pueda cocinar en mayores cantidades, también comprará bebidas gasificadas de varias marcas y tamaños, golosinas como galletas, chocolates, frugos de varias marcas y tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y productos que ella utiliza en la preparación de comida que vende todos los días (arroz en sacos, azúcar, cajas de conservas, aceite, fideos, leche en cajas, café, etc.), y así no le falte nada para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Tiene 40 años y 6 hijos quienes ahora ya le apoyan en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, su meta es implementar más y mejor su negocio para poder atender bien a sus clientes que llegan de diferentes partes de la región, una de sus metas también es la compra de un carro para generar otros ingresos y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy a professional kitchen, soft drinks,  juices, and groceries.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe C. is 45-years-old, has been separated for more than 12 years, and lives in his own house with his two daughters, one who is 15, and the oldest, who is 17. His daughters go to high school and are now in their last years there. Felipe used to sell electronic products on the border market with Argentina, but he had to close his business due to the decline in value of the Argentine peso, since most of his clients came from Argentina.

Now he has a business where he sells drinks, including soft drinks, beer, wine, liquor, whisky, etc., and he has all of the necessary equipment for this type of work. He has had his store right in the middle of the city for two years now. The business is attended to personally by Felipe, and of course, with the constant help of his two daughters. Since his business is getting better every day, Felipe's current project is to finance a hamburger restaurant to be able to attract more clients and to have a larger income.

Felipe is a very hard-working and sacrificing person, since he had to raise his two daughters by himself. But even then he was still able to give them the best. He is requesting a loan to expand his store and to arrange it better to give space to his clients who come to eat and drink there.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Felipe C. tiene 45 años de edad, esta separado hace más de 12 años y vive en su casa propia junto con sus dos hijas, una de 15 años y la mayor de 17 años. Sus hijas van al colegio cursando ya los últimos años.

Felipe se dedicaba a la venta de productos electrónicos en el mercado fronterizo con Argentina, pero tuvo que cerrar su negocio por la caída del valor del peso argentino, de donde provenían la mayor parte de sus clientes.

Hoy día posee un negocio de ventas de bebidas, en donde comercializa gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, licores, wiskies, etc. y cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para este tipo de trabajo. El local esta ubicado en pleno centro de la ciudad y de esto ya va 2 años. El negocio es atendido personalmente por el señor Felipe y claro, con la ayuda constante de sus dos hijas. Como el negocio va cada día mejor, el proyecto de Felipe es habilitar mas adelante una hamburguesería, para así captar más clientelas y tener mayor ingreso.

Felipe es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada por el hecho que tuvo que criar solo sus dos hijas, pero aun así pudo darle siempre lo mejor. El solicita el crédito para hacer una ampliación del local comercial, de este modo distribuir mejor su tienda y dar espacio a los clientes que vienen a consumir en su local.

loans.use: Expansion of his store (to pay for labor and construction materials like bricks, cement, sand, and whitewash).

loans.name: Lucia Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia belongs to the communal bank of Unidad Calzadina. She manufactures and sells handicrafts made out of straw such as hats, baskets and fans of several models and colours. She also complements her activity with the manufacturing of bags and hats made in macramé which she delivers to the stores that sell handicrafts in the provinces of Rioja and Moyobamba.

She decided to start her own business because she had the need to work and she had trained herself in the trade. This way she is now able to generate her own income and grow as a person and woman.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for S/ 300 soles (Aprox. $300 USD), which will be paid in 4 instalments, she will purchase different coloured straw and also molds for hats and baskets of different sizes. She needs these materials so that she can do the good quality work which is one of the reasons why she has a good amount of orders.

She is 41 years old and has 3 children. She is content with what she does and satisfied because her crafts are well accepted by her clientèle which are now looking for her at home to put in orders. Her goal is to have her own store to sell straw handicrafts and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidad Calzadina, se dedica a la confección y venta de artesanía en paja (material utilizado para confección) como sombreros, canastas y abanicos de varios modelos y colores, también complementa su actividad con la confección de bolsas y sombreros hechos en macramé que ella entrega a las tiendas que venden artesanías de la provincia de Rioja y Moyobamba. Decidió iniciar su negocio por que tenía la necesidad de trabajar y por que se capacitó para ello, y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 soles ($ 100.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, con este préstamo ella comprará paja de diferentes colores, también moldes para los sombreros y canastas de diferentes tamaños, para poder realizar un buen trabajo con un delicado acabado, que es uno de los motivos por el cual tiene buena cantidad de pedidos. Tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por que sus trabajos son bien aceptados por sus clientes que ahora la buscan en su domicilio para realizar sus pedidos, su meta es poner su propia tienda de artesanía en paja y aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchasing of straw and molds / Compra de paja y moldes.

loans.name: Mili Piedad

texts.es:
Mili Piedad belongs to the Communal Bank of Lumbreras of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and has two sons. Her husband is a lumberjack. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos, she wants to start a small stand for selling cookies and candy.

She currently has one stand, which she runs with her sons. She takes a lot of time to look after them and tend to the warehouse.

With this recent loan from Manuela Ramos of $367.00, which will be paid in four months, she will make improvements in her shop and will buy three boxes of milk, two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, five boxes of soda, and one drum of oil.

Mili Piedad is very happy to have her business in her own house which allows her to also look after her children.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

La señora Mili Piedad pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lumbreras, del A. H. Jr. Las Begonias del A. H. Odicio Roman del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es maderero. Con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 100.00 soles decide poner un pequeño puesto para la venta de galletas y golosinas.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, ella se da tiempo para atenderlos y también atender la bodega

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, hará mejoras en su local y comprará 3 caja de leche, 2 saco de arroz, 2 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite.

Mili Piedad está muy contenta de tener su negocio en su misma casa lo que le permite también atender a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of various products. Business infrastructure.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor de María belongs to the communal bank of Las Lumbreras, of Jr. Tupac Amaru of the AH New Sunrise District of Callería, Deparment of Ucayali. She is 49 years old ans is a mother of 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman, and henceforth with her first loan from Manuela Ramos decided to start her own general store.

She currently has a general store which she serves together with her children. She gets up very early to make breakfast for the children who are still going to school and later looks after her business.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for S. 1,200 (Aprox. $400 USD), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will expand the shop and will buy 2 boxes of milk, 1 sack of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of sodas, and 1 container of oil.

Flor de María is very happy to have her 6 children healthy and has the great challenge of keeping them in school and is always supportive of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Flor de María pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lumbreras, del Jr. Tupac Amaru del Del A. H. Nuevo Amanecer Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es pescador, es así que Flor de María, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de abarrotes. En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto de abarrotes, el mismo que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan muy temprano para hacer el desayuno para sus hijos que van a la escuela y después atiende su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200 (US$ 400.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 2 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite. Flor de María está muy contenta de tener a sus 6 hijos sanos y tiene el gran reto de mantenerlos en la escuela, y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchasing general products and expanding the shop / Compra de productos variados (abarrotes).  Ampliación del local.

loans.name: Esther Marina

texts.es:
Esther works every day to better her family and has always been in search of new business opportunities that offer benefits for the wellbeing of her family. She is the mother of 6 children of whom three are still under her tutelage. To support them better, she made the decision to open in her home a space that offers Internet services to the whole community and also allows her to pay attention to the care of her children. With them she has organized a work plan in teams. This has allowed her to see the growth of her business and the benefits that come along with it. Now she is looking to the future to install another Internet establishment. Esther knows that this will require hard work, and she will continued to be motivated by seeing her children improve in their studies. She wants to buy another computer that will allow her to increase her service capacity and prepare the small establishment for the comfort and greater permanence of her clients and for this she needs a loan. Esther is greatful in advance for your collaboration.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Doña Ester, trabaja cada día para ver superada a su familia y siempre ha estado en búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades de negocio que le ofrezca ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.Ella es madre de seis hijos de las cuales tres todavía están bajo su tutela y continuo deseo de otorgarles lo mejor ha posibilitado la decisión de abrir en su casa un espacio en el que ofrece los servicios de Internet a su comunidad entera y que además le permite permanecer atenta al cuidado de sus hijos, con ellos ha organizado todo un esquema de trabajo en equipo, esto les ha permitido observar el crecimiento de su negocio además de los beneficios que acarrea consigo. Ahora piensa a futuro instalar otro establecimiento de Internet, Doña Ester, sabe que todo esto requiere de un trabajo arduo y es por ello que seguirá motivándose al ver a sus hijos superándose mediante el estudio. Ella desea comprar otra computadora que le permita acrecentar su capacidad de servicio y acondicionar el pequeño establecimiento para comodidad y mayor permanencia de sus clientes y para ello necesita de un préstamo. Doña Ester agradece por anticipado tu solidaria colaboración..

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and preparation of a small internet service center.

loans.name: Irma Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Irma is a brave woman. After her separation from her husband many years ago she has assumed the role of mother and father for her four children. Now that her oldest children already have their own home she stays in the company of her youngest son, 16 years old. She previously worked in diverse jobs and was encouraged by a niece to dedicate herself to the raising of turkeys. Once her niece left the city in search of better opportunities she left Doña Irma with the entire infrastructure for a farm and encouraged her to maintain it in order to gain position of it as her own farm. This is how she started: she bought only a dozen chickens, and now she has 50 for sale; at the same time she received a training talk in order to raise them adequately in captivity. Now she has great wishes to do better and wishes in the future to make her chicken farm grow even more, bettering her infrastructure in order to become linked with other institutions so that she can obtain more sales and in the future open a sewing workshop, practicing an occupation that also pleases her. In order to continue forcing herself onward, Doña Irma is soliciting a loan in order to buy chicks and raise them. With the earnings she will be able to settle the educational expenses of her son in order to prepare him to go to the university. Show your solidarity with an entrepreneurial woman; your contribution is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project.

Doña Irma, es una mujer valiente, tras la separación de su esposo hace muchos años ella ha asumido el rol de madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos. Ahora que sus hijos mayores ya tienen su propio hogar se queda en compañía de su último hijo de 16 años.Ella trabajaba mucho en diversos oficios y fue animada por una sobrina a dedicarse a la crianza de pavos y una vez que su sobrina dejó la ciudad en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades la dejó con toda la infraestructura para una granja y la animó a mantenerle para poseerla como su propia granja y es así como empezó compro sólo una docena de pollos y ahora cuenta con 50 para su venta, a la vez recibió una charla de capacitación para criarlos adecuadamente en cautiverio. Ahora tiene grandes deseos de superación y desea a futuro hacer crecer aún más su granja de pollos mejorando su infraestructura para enlazarse con otras instituciones a fin de obtener más ventas y a futuro abrir un taller de costura ejerciendo uno de los oficios que también le agrada.Para seguir esforzándose, Doña Irma solicita un préstamo para comprar pollos bebés y criarlos, con las ganancias podrá solventar los gastos educativos de su hijo para prepararse y postular a la universidad.Solidarízate con una mujer emprendedor a, tu aporte es muy importante

loans.use: Purchase of a greater number of chicks and materials to develop of her area for raising them.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana H. belongs to the Community Bank Las Lumbreras and the local assembly of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has four sons. Her husband is a laborer and often cannot find work. Because of this, Juana, with the first loan of Manuela Ramos, decided to start up a small business of raising and selling chickens.

At the present time, she has a small cage of chickens which she tends to with her husband. They wake up very early in the morning to sell the chickens on the market.

With the recent loan they received from Manuela Ramos of $367.00, which will be paid in four months, she will expand and maintain the warehouse for the chickens, and will also buy 50 kg of chicken feed.

Juana is very content with having this business, which helps her pay for her family’s basic living costs.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lumbreras, del Pasaje las Begonias Mz B Lt 14 del A. H. Junta Vecinal del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es peón y muchas veces no encuentra trabajo, es así que Juana, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño negocio de la crianza y venta de pollos.

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña jaula de pollos, la misma que atiende junto a su esposo, se levantan muy temprano para venderlos en el mercado.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,100 (US$ 367.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará y dará el mantenimiento respectivo del galpón de los pollos, además comprará alimento balanceado (50 kilos) para pollos.

loans.use: Expansion and maintenance of warehouse. Purchase of chicken feed.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María is a woman who works hard to succeed and do her best. Thanks to her persistence she has made progress that has filled her with satisfaction. Today she has grand aspirations in mind, that her small children will have a prominent future. Five years ago María’s siblings supported her and encouraged her to open in her house a garment workshop, they taught her this noble trade, and today she works in the most efficient manner. With time and the quality works that she produces, she has acquired many tools that permit her to produce the orders in the greatest quantity and in a very rapid manner, moving what she produces daily through continuous trips to other cities. Later she returns with profit to obtain premium materials in order to continue the manufacture of garments that are in the highest demand. At the present time she aspires to grow her workshop in order to continue producing profits not only for her but also for young people. She wishes to equip her workshop with a small number of semi-industrial overlockers so that she can fulfill her wishes. We support María in continuing on the road to victory.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project.
