María, es una mujer que se esfuerza por seguir adelante y dar de ella lo mejor; su empeño la ha ayudado a conseguir logros que la llenan de satisfacción y hoy tiene grandes aspiraciones en mente para que sus pequeños hijos tengan un futuro prominente.Hace cinco años los hermanos de Maria la apoyaron y la animaron a aperturar en su casa un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, le enseñaron este noble oficio y hoy se desempeña de la manera más eficiente y con el tiempo y los trabajos de calidad que produce ha adquirido muchas herramientas que le permiten producir los pedidos en mayor cantidad y de manera muy rápida; trasladando lo que produce diariamente mediante viajes continuos a otras ciudades y luego regresa con la ganancia para obtener materia prima para continuar con la fabricación de las prendas de mayor demanda.En la actualidad tiene muchas aspiraciones de acrecentar su taller para seguir produciendo beneficios no sólo para ella sino también para más jóvenes. Desea equipar su taller con un pequeño número de remalladotas semi industriales para que pueda cumplir sus deseos.Apoyemos a Maria a continuar por el camino del triunfo.

loans.use: Purchase of a small number of semi-industrial overlockers in order to increase her production and the number of employees in her small workshop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan G. is 34 years old and is married to Margarita Ocampos, who is 32 years old. They live in their own house in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood and have a six year old son, who lives at school.

Juan began to work when he was very young as an employee in a very important and well=known auto repair shop in Encarnación, and over time acquired the necessary knowledge to open his own shop.

With some savings that he managed to put together, Juan bought some equipment and tools to start his own business. He began providing services changing and patching inner tubes for motorcycles, cars, trucks etc. Over time, thanks to his dedication and good management, he capitalized and started selling new and used tires for all kinds of vehicles.

The loan he is asking for is to purchase materials such as tires and inner tubes for cars and motorcycles to match his daily growing demand, since he can obtain valuable discounts by buying in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

El señor Juan G. de 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Margarita Ocampos de 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Barrio Arroyo Pora y tienen un hijo varón de 6 años, quien va a la escuela.

Juan empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, como empleado en una gomería muy importante y conocida en Encarnación, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo los conocimientos necesarios por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio en ese rubro, la gomería.

Con unos ahorro que logro juntar, Juan compro algunos equipos y herramientas para habilitar su negocio propio, empezó realizando servicios de parchados de cubiertas y cámaras de motos, autos, camiones, etc. Con el tiempo, gracias a su dedicación y buena administración fue capitalizándose e incorporo a su negocio la venta de cubiertas nuevas y usadas, para todo tipo de vehículos.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderías, como ser cubiertas y cámaras en oferta para motos y autos, ya que la demanda aumenta cada día mas, y al comprar en grandes cantidades obtiene buenos descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase of larger amounts of tires and inner tubes for automobiles.

loans.name: Yolanda Felícita

texts.es:
Yolanda is a hardworking mother who works herself selling construction materials and steel in her small hardware store for twenty years, with the passing of time she has improved and stocked her store with a greater variety, quality and quantity of products. Now she sees the fruit of her labor when she observes the inmense work ethic of her three children. In spite of the economic problems that arose and failures in previous years with this project she never lost the will to push forward and to continue improving the well-being of her family with the help of her beloved husband. Today they have a new set of goals that they wish to accomplish and they are on the right path to achieving these goals. On a day-to-day basis Yolanda works in the hardware store, her husband works selling aggregates, and her children in their free time to help out in the family business. One of Yolanda's dreams is to convert part of the land she owns into a place where people can hold receptions and parties and in the meantime, she will continue in her hardware store improving the supply of her products and improving the infrastructure of her store. For this purpose she needs a loan. Yolanda and her family appreciate your valuable support.

Yolanda, es una trabajadora y esforzada madre D. familia que hace durante veinte años se dedica a la venta D. materiales D. construcción y fierros en su pequeña ferretería; con el paso del tiempo la ha ido mejorado y ha surtido con mayor variedad, calidad y cantidad su stock D. productos y hoy con satisfacción ve el fruto D. su trabajo cuando observa los inmensos deseos D. trabajo y superación D. sus tres hijos. A pesar D. los problemas económicos que surgieron y tras fracasar en años anteriores en esta labor jamás perdió los ánimos D. continuar y seguir adelante para completo bienestar D. su familia con la ayuda D. su querido esposo.Hoy planifican metas que desean alcanzar con constancia y mucho esfuerzo están en la senda segura para lograrlo.Día a día Yolanda se dedica a la atención D. la ferretería, su esposo a la venta D. agregados y sus hijos en sus tiempos libres se dedican a apoyar el negocio familiar. Uno D. los deseos D. Yolanda es habilitar parte D. su terreno para acondicionarlo como un local D. recepciones y arrendarlo; mientras tanto seguirá trabajando para mejorar los productos D. su ferretería y mejorar las instalaciones D. su local y para ello solicita un préstamo.Yolanda y su familia agradecen tu valioso aporte

loans.use:
Purchase of a greater variety of articles for construction and to furnish her store.

Compra de mayor variedad de artículos de construcción y acondicionamiento del espacio de ventas.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Mr. Leoncio E. is 36 years old. He is in a relationship and they have two kids who are 6 and 2 years old.

They live together in a house that they built over three years ago on land belonging to his father-in-law, a house that they were able to build thanks to sacrifice on both their parts. Leoncio has a local shop for natural remedies where his wife also helps out, and which already has a large local clientele.

Leoncio works selling medicinal products like herbs, creams, liquids, essences and other articles. The loan he is asking for is to purchase creams that are highly demanded in the summer months, and he wishes to acquire these creams in large quantities in order to obtain important buyer discounts.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

El señor Leoncio E. tiene 36 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años respectivamente.

Ellos viven juntos en su casa que construyeron en el terreno de su suegro hace mas de tres años, casa que lograron obtener gracias al sacrificio de ambos. Leoncio posee un local de ventas de remedios naturales y donde su señora ayuda también a atender, ya que es un local que posee gran cantidad de clientela.

Leoncio se dedica a vender productos medicinales, por ejemplo: hierbas, cremas, líquidos, esencias y otros artículos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías (cremas) que tienen mucha salida en el verano, y desea adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades de modo a obtener importantes descuentos en las compras.

loans.use: Purchase of natural remedies and various herbs and ointments.

loans.name: Felix Gaspar

texts.pt:
Feliz Gaspar T. is married and father of 5. He is 48 years old and studied until the 4th grade. He started working in 1974 in the district of Moamba in a company called Kodamo. In 1975 he started working as a mechanic.

He was introduced to hluvuku-Adsema micro-credit program through co-workers. He requested a loan of 15.000mt. In the future he wants to request another loan to buy a mini-bus.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizacao: Boane Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,00mzm ( 600usd) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Início: 12/09/2007 Fim: 05/12/2008 Feliz Gaspar T., casado maritalmente, tem 5 filhos e 48 anos de idade. Estudou ate 4ª classe do antigo sistema tendo depois começado a trabalhar em 1974 no Distrito da Moamba numa empresa de nome kodamo. Em 1975, começou a trabalhar na lomaco como mecânico ate então, com a categoria de chefe das oficinas. Conheceu a hluvuku-Adsema através de uma conversa com os colegas. Depois teve a curiosidade de ca chegar para melhor informar se sobre os serviços da instituição. Teve o seu primeiro contacto com o credito na hluvuku , onde auferiu o valor de15.000,00MT.Pensa em pedir outro empréstimo mais tarde para recondiccionar a sua viatura de tipo mini-bus.

loans.use: To buy material to build his house

loans.name: Lucas

texts.pt:
Lucas Bezeque M. was born on January 1st, 1957 in the district of Chemba in the province of Sofala. He is 50 years old, and single father of 7 children. His oldest son is 27 years old and the youngest 5. He was raised by his parents in Sofala and went to school until the 6th grade. In 1979, he completed his military service and started to work small business to provide for his family. His business today employs 3 people. He joined other credit programs such as the Gueguegue –Boane. But these credit programs only offered group loans, and the loans were much smaller. Lucas was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema through his neighbors. He requested his first loan in 2006 which he repaid in full.

With the loan of 50.00mt he plans in increasing his inventory to increase his business volume. His business is the only one in the neighborhood to sell supplies. He manages the business with his 3 sons. With the income he supports his family and the schooling of his sons and grandsons. In the future Lucas wants to buy a store and save. .

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao : Bairro 4 –Gueguegue -Boane Cliente : Lucas Bezeque M. Actividade : Comercio Valor de emprestimo :50.000,00mzm ( 2.000usd) Aplicaçao : compra de produtos para revenda Inicio : 01/10/2007 Fim: 19/03/2009

Lucas Bezeque M., nasceu aos 01 de Janeiro de 1957 no distrito de Chemba ,Provincia de Sofala, tem actualmente 50 anos de idade, solteiro pai de 7 filhos o mais velho tem 27 anos e o mais novo tem 5 anos, viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais em Sofala ,frequentou a escola até 6ª classe . Em 1979 foi a tropa. findo o serviço militar tendo ficado desempregado comecou a dedicar-se aos pequenos negocios de forma a sobreviver. A sua actividade conta hoje com 3 trabalhadores. Teve o 1º contacto de credito com associaçao Gueguegue –Boane de onde è membro Cujos creditos eram grupais, não tendo sido boa experiencia de credito para alem de os valores cedidos serem reduzidos, para tal a responsabilidade ser grupal . Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema ,atravez de conversa com os vizinhos e dai aproximou- se e solicitou o seu 1º emprestimo em 2006 e pagou sem dificuldades .Com o emprestimo de 50.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Actualmente está explorando um estabelecimento comercial pessoal sendo o único no local que oferece um bom ambiente de negocio .

Ele dirige pessoalmente o negocio juntamente com os seus 3 filhos, Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares escolares e de saude dos seus filhos e netos. Futuramente pretende ter um estabelecimento proprio e poupar algum valor para os momentos criticos do negocio.

loans.use: To buy stock to cover the demand during the christmas

payments.comment:
Lucas has successfully decided to pay back this loan in advance in order to raise a higher loan to help his business grow.

Lucas would like to personally thank Kiva and especially all his lenders for the support given to his business.

loans.name: Julia Miriam

texts.es:
Julia Miriam is receiver of microcredit who has established with her own money the sale of homemade food, and who has offered her clients the delicious Sopa de Res or Meat Soup, rice, Meat prepared in special ways, plaintains and fried plaintains both with cheese, tortillas, etc.

She has worked 34 years in this business, and she comments that she began selling bean soup in her house as a way to receive extra income from other sources because her husband was unemployed. Due to the great demand for her product she has established herself successfully in the Mercado Central de León to offer the workers of this area a place to eat healthy food close to work.

She has been using these systems of credit for a year and six months, and her own words are:

"To work with credits has helped me, it has allowed my family and I to continue forward in this business. I continue with my clients while attracting new ones who enjoy typical nicaraguan food that I prepare for them. My dream is to continue forward and to accumulate earnings to buy my own space to establish a restaurant. Julia Miriam es una microempresaria que ha establecido con dinero propio la venta de comidería, comida preparada en casa, ofrece a sus clientes la riquísima Sopa de Res, arroz, Carne en sus diferentes maneras de preparar, maduro frito con queso (platanos fritos con queso), tortillas, etc.

Tiene aproximadamente 34 años de laborar en este negocio, ella nos comenta que inició vendiendo sopa de frijoles en su casa como una manera de buscar otros ingresos ya que su esposo habia quedado desempleado. Debido a la gran demanda que tiene su producto y a petición de los cliientes, ella se ha establecido en el Mercado Central de León para ofrecer a los trabajadores de esta zona un lugar donde comer sanamente y cerca de sus trabajos.

Trabaja con los sistemas de crédito desde hace un año y seis meses, sus palabras textuales son las siguientes:

"Trabajar con créditos me ha ayudado, nos ha permitido a mi y a la familia a salir adelante con este negocio, sigo manteniendo mi clientela y ganando clientes nuevos que gustan de la comida típica nicaragüense que yo les preparo, mi deseo es seguir adelante y lograr acumular mas ganancias para comprar mi propio módulo y llegar a tener un restaurante".

loans.use:
To purchase supplies like rice, oil, beans, beef, chicken, etc. to prepare food to sell in her business.

Compra de Insumos como Arro, Aceite, Frijoles, carne de res, Pollo, etc. para preparar la comida que ofrece en el negocio.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha N. sells all kinds of cosmetics and music on cds. She inherited this business from her mother. Before they sold linens, molenillos (Nicaraguan kitchen utensils), typical products and some other things at the edge of the road in the León central market. She remembers that they set out a wooden table to display their products. Later with their savings and their first loan ($100, one hundred dollars), they were able to move their business to a market stall, and this gave her more to invest in the business in order to offer other types of products. She started to sell cosmetics for women, which are in high demand.

Martha Alicia has worked with loans for three years and has obtained 17 loans with a good payment record, thanks to the good money management. The management of her business has economically helped her son, who studies medicine in a good university. This type of loan has helped her a great deal because as a merchant it is necessary to frequently invest in her business and she hopes to continue to expand her business with this enterprising spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project.

Doña Martha N. vende todo tipo de cosméticos y música en cd. Ella hereda de su madre este negocio, anteriormente vendían hilos, molenillos(utencilio de cocina nicaragüense), productos típicos y algunas otras cosas a orillas de la calle en el MERCADO CENTRAL DE LEÓN, recuerda que ponian una mesa de madera para exponer sus productos. <> Luego con sus ahorros y su primer préstamo($100, cien dólares), lograron ubicarse en un módulo del mercado, y esto le dió mas seguridad para invertir en el negocio ofreciendo otro tipo de productos, comenzó a vender cosméticos para damas ya que esto tiene mucha demanda.

Martha Alicia tiene 3 años de trabajar con los créditos y ha sacado 17 créditos con un buen record de pago, gracias a el buen uso de este dinero y el manejo de su negocio le ha ayudado economicamente a su hijo que estudia Medicina en una buena universidad, este tipo de créditos le ha ayudado mucho pues como comerciante se necesita invertir en el negocio con frecuencia y espera seguir siempre adelante con este espíritu emprendedor.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 45-year-old lady from the village of Gagaifo Lefaga. She has 3 children and this will be her 6th loan from SPBD. She plans to use the loan to help with her plantation, her shop business, and also for renovating her house.  Her grocery shop is open from 7am to 8pm. She’s now focusing more on her goods as her prices are competitive and fair. Tina earns 400 Tala ($160 US) profit from her shop a week and she makes 280 Tala ($112 US) from her plantation by selling 2 sacks of taro at the Fugalei market every Friday.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, knives, cement, and timber for her plantation and small shop

loans.name: Saturdina De Los Ang

texts.es:
Miss H. makes both spices (an example: little onions in vinegar) and 'chileros.' Furthermore, she buys the artisans some products to decorate and improve the presentation of her products, having prepared all these spices by herself.

She has been in this business for twenty five years, and her mother helped her with the initial capital. She prepared the spices in her mother's house, and then they took a little table outside the door of their house and the exposed their product in plastic bags, selling also in the sidewalks of the Central de León market.

With time she began to elaborate other products and she took advantag the clients she had in order to sell national products made by hand like 'jicaras,' 'comales,' wooden spoons, piggybanks, etc. All these objects would be exposed in some sweaters on the floor just by the little table. Her first credit was 3 years ago and she invested it to complete the money and to buy her space within the market we mentioned, and with this she began to produce.

She comments that before she worked in this business she worked as a maid, cleaning and ironing clothes in domicile. When she changed jobs, however, all her family saw how profitable this business was and how much support she got from this organization who has given her the credits. Thanks to the things she has been able to do with these credits she has been able to mantain her business active and she is very thankful to those individuals for their help.

La señora H. elabora por una parte especies como Encurtidos (un ejemplo; cebollitas en vinagre) y tambien chileros. Además compra a los artesanos algunos productos para decorar y mejorar la presentación de su producto, todas las especies son preparadas por ella misma.

Lleva 25 años de tener el negocio, su madre le ayudo con el capital inicial. Ellas preparaban en su casa los encurtidos, luego sacaban a la puerta de su casa una mesita de madera y exponian su producto en bolsas de plástico, tambien vendian en las aceras del mercado Central de León.

Con el tiempo empezaba a elaborar otros productos y aprovechaba la clientela que tenia para vender productos nacionales hechos a mano como JÍCARAS, COMALES, CUCHARAS DE MADERA, ALCANCIAS DE BARRO etc. Todo eso lo extendía en unos sacos en el suelo a lado de su mesita. Su primer crédito fué hace tres años y lo invirtió para completar el dinero y comprar su tramo(módulo) dentro del Mercado, ya con esto ella comenzó a surtir más el negocio.

Ella nos comenta que antes de trabajar en este negocio se desempeñaba como doméstica, lavaba ropa y planchaba a domicilio. Toda la familia ha visto lo rentabnle que es este negocio y cuanto apoyo ha recibido con la organización que le ha brindado los créditos. Gracias al trabajo con los créditos ha podido mantener activo este negocio y esta muy agradecida por su ayuda.

loans.use:
To buy vegetables to prepare 'chileros' and other spices

Destinado a comprar las verduras para preparar sus chileros y encurtidos

loans.name: Laloanea

texts.en: Laloanea is a mother of 35 years of age and married with one child. Her talent of making Elei prints has allowed her to earn money for her family’s needs. She is now apply for her second loan to buy specialized equipment for her business. She delivers her products to various shops at the flea market at Savalalo and Fugalei 4 times a week. She makes 400 Tala ($160 US) a week ,and after all expenses she is left with a profit of 180 Tala ($72 US).

loans.use: To buy materials such as paint, screens, and brushes for her Elei (a traditional Samoan craft) printing business

loans.name: Lemoe

texts.en: Lemoe is a mother whose child helps out her and her husband in running the family plantation.  Lemoe plans to use her loan to expand the plantation. She sells 2 sacks of taro and yams every Friday at the Fugalei market, where she can usually earn more than 300 Tala ($120 US) of profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, tools, cement, and timber for her family plantation

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 58-year-old mother from the village of Vaimoso. Her first loan allowed her to start a BBQ business, and now she’s on her 5th loan. She plans to use it to open a small grocery shop in front of her house. Malia has 6 children. Three of her kids are still in school and the other three are working and help out their mother with the business. She earns around 300 Tala ($120 US) of profit per week.

loans.use: To buy inventory and supplies for her new grocery store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Victoria has been selling clothes in Pichanaki market for three years. She is a modest mother who through many sacrifices has been able to save enough to buy various garments and sell them in this busy market.

Currently, the municipality is moving her in different stands without having a fixed place and charge her a high price for the space. Without a doubt this has thwarted the income she managed to gain through her job, and is therefore wanting to buy a stand in the market so that she stops being the object of maltreatment and the constant evictions.

Beside the sale of clothing, she also wishes to start selling shoes in her new stand so that she makes money to save enough and achieve her future goals.

She is requesting a loan and is asking us to collaborate with the crystallization of her goals to establish herself promptly in a safe and comfortable place.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Doña Victoria, hace ya tres años vende ropa en el mercado de Pichanaki, ella es una modesta madre de familia que a costa de mucho sacrificio ha logrado reunir una considerable cantidad de dinero para comprar prendas de vestir muy variadas y trabajar en este mercado muy concurrido.Actualmente, la municipalidad viene ubicándola en distintos puestos sin tener un lugar definido donde desempeñarse, además de los elevados precios que le cobran por su permanencia, sin duda estos hechos han mermado considerablemente los ingresos económicos que obtenía con su trabajo, por lo que ella desea mucho comprar un puesto de ventas en el mercado para dejar de ser objeto de maltratos y desalojos.Además de la venta de ropa desea ofrecer también zapatos en su nuevo pequeño establecimiento, para que pueda ahorrar dinero con el objeto de alcanzar sus metas futuras.Solicita un préstamo y nos pide colaboremos con la cristalización de su ansiado para establecerse pronto en un lugar cómodo y seguro.

loans.use:
Purchasing small store space in the most busy market to continue offering her garments /
Compra de un pequeño espacio de ventas en el mercado más concurrido de su ciudad para continuar ofreciendo sus bellas prendas.

loans.name: Maybe Liz

texts.es:
Sra. Maybe belongs to the Yungay Hermosura ("Yungay Beauty") group. Her business, a restaurant, is located in Yungay, northern Peru. Her persistence and drive to get ahead have allowed her to contribute to paying the family's expenses. The restaurant is located in a rented space. She manages to cover, thanks to her sales, the cost of rent, water and light.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), which will be repaid in 4 installments, she's purchased basic supplies for preparing meals (rice, cooking oil, pasta) for 6 regular customers and the approximately 35 others who eat in the restaurant.

Sra. Maybe has a 5-year old son. Her husband is a casual laborer and, consequently, she started this business to generate extra income for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maybe pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Yungay Hermosura, su negocio esta ubicado en la localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash, su empeño y espíritu de trabajar para poder salir adelante le ha permitido aportar en los gastos de su familia. Su negocio se encuentra en un local alquilado, esta actividad le permite, gracias a las ventas, cubrir los gastos de alquiler, agua y luz.

Con el reciente préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 99) el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado insumos de primera necesidad para la elaboración de alimentos, (un saco de arroz, una caja de aceite, un paquete de fideos), cuenta con 6 pensionistas fijos y 35 clientes (aprox.) que consumen directamente en su local.

La señoa Maybe tiene un hijo de 5 años y su esposo tiene trabajo eventual y por esta razón ella se dedica a este negocio, generando así mas ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Elena Isabel

texts.es:
Sra. Elena is a member of the Amigos Marcarinos ("Marcara-Area Friends") community bank. She raises and sells "cuyes" (a guinea pig-like animal, native to Peru). Her shop is located in her house in the "distrito" of Marcara in northern Peru. She sells the cuyes in the nearby city of Huaraz, some 30 minutes from Marcara, and to tourists who come to Marcara. She especially values her role as homemaker and she takes special care to tend to her family.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.200 (200 Peruvian soles or about US$66), to be repaid in 4 installments, she's purchased breeding cuyes so that she can improve the stock of the rest.

Sra. Elena, 39, a thriving businesswoman, aspires to keep on growing her business with help from Manuela Ramos and her family. Thanks to her husband's many skills, as gasfitter, electrician, etc., he has many short-term opportunites to work. Their two incomes allow them to plan a better future for their two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes (animales caseros oriundos del Perú), su local se encuentra en su domicilio ubicado en el Distrito de Marcara, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash. La venta de cuyes la hace en la ciudad de Huaraz, localidad que está a 30 minutos de Marcara, también los vende directo a los Recreos turísticos de su Localidad, en su afán de sobresalir como madre se esfuerza mucho para casar adelante a su familia.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 200.00 ($ 66) el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado cuyes reproductores, para mejorar la calidad de sus otros cuyes.

La señora Elena tiene 39 años, prospera negociante, aspira seguir incrementando su negocio con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos y su familia, gracias a que su esposo desempeña varios oficios, como gasfitería, electricista, tiene varios trabajos que son eventuales, ambos ingresos le permite sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Buy breeding animals.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Sra. Rufina belongs to the Las Rosas de Yungay ("Roses of Yungay") group. She earns a living selling "papas rellenas" (a local stuffed potato dish). Her business is located in Yungay, northern Peru.

Sra. Rufina started her business with very little capital. With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy bulk supplies of potatoes, cooking oil and eggs. The supplies will increase her business, she thinks, and add to her earnings.

Sra. Rufina, 41, is separated and has two children. She has to be father and mother to her children and they give her the strength and spirit to push ahead as she's the sole breadwinner for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rufina pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de papa rellena (comida), su negocio está ubicado en la localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash,.

Ella inició su negocio con un pequeño capital y con el préstamo recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 99), que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará un saco de papa, una caja de aceite y una caja de huevos, con esto piensa incrementar su negocio y tener mas ganancias.

La señora Rufina tiene 41 años, es separada y tiene dos hijos, ellos hacen que tenga espíritu y fuerzas para salir adelante, es madre y padre para ellos, ella es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Sra. Victoria belongs to the Juan Pablo II ("John Paul II") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of Huaraz. She's an environmental engineer and works for MINSA ("Ministerio de Salud" or the Peruvian Ministry of Health). She has a business making and selling yogurt. She started making yogurt for her family, then for friends and neighbors. They used to tell her that her product was very pleasant and natural. She now fills a weekly order from Lima for 20 litres of yogurt in additional to local orders. With this business, she was able to win a grant to pursue her master's degree, something that she's now doing. She's organized herself so that she can study, work and still find time to make her yogurt.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$332), to be repaid in 6 installments, she's purchased supplies of skimmed milk and a thousand cups. Part of the loan will be used to buy 20 litres of milk (twice a week).

At 42 years old, with four children, this lady is following a dream to expand her business and identify new markets, to increase her income and educate her children, the oldest of whom is studying medicine at the University of Trujillo. She, the daughter, is an example for her family and friends. Thanks to her dedication and efforts, she's fulfilling her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, vive en el distrito de Huaraz, Provincia Huaraz. Es Ingeniera del Ambiente y trabaja en el MINSA, tiene el negocio de preparación y venta de yogurt, se inició preparando yogurt para consumo de su familia, empezó ofreciendo a sus amistades y vecinas, sus clientes le decían que su producto era muy agradable y natural. En la actualidad atiende pedidos locales y 20 litros semanales para la ciudad de Lima. Con este negocio ha sido ganadora de una beca para hacer su maestría y a la fecha esta estudiando dicha maestría. Se organiza para estudiar, trabajar y elaborar su yogurt.

Con el préstamo recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00 soles ($332), que será pagado en 6 cuotas, ha comprado un saco de leche descremada y un millar de vasijas. Parte de este dinero será para la compra de 20 litros de leche (dos veces en la semana).

A sus 42 años y con cuatro hijos, la señora continua con el sueño de seguir ampliando su negocio y buscar nuevos mercados, para incrementar sus ingresos y educar a sus hijos, la mayor de sus hijas estudia medicina en la Universidad de Trujillo. Es un ejemplo de vida para su familia y amistades, gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo esta logrando sus metas.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Sra. Ruth belongs to the Amigos Marcarinos ("Marcara-Area Friends") community bank. Her shop is located in her house in Marcara, northern Peru. She sells groceries and soft drinks, at retail, a business that she's developed over the last three years.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she purchased bulk supplies of soft drinks (of various brands) to supply and grow her business.

Sra. Ruth, 39, lives her son and mother. She's thriving at business, like anyone who aspires to get ahead. Her mother and 12-year old son help her with the business, as well as everything else in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Ruth pertener al Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, su local se encuentra en su domicilio, ubicado en el Distrito de Marcara, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash, ella vende un poco de abarrotes y gaseosas al por menor, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace tres años,

Con el reciente préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 99), que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compro 10 cajas de gaseosas medianas, 10 paquetes de gaseosas de 3 litros (varias marcas), ello permitirá surtir e incrementar su negocio.

La señora tiene 39 años, vive con su único hijo y con su madre, es una prospera negociante como cualquier persona que aspira seguir superándose. En el negocio, recibe el apoyo de su hijo, que ya tiene 12 años y su madre, quienes la apoyan en todo.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Sra. Zenaida is a founding member of the Manuela Ramos de Tinco community bank. She earns a living raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, ducks, geese and pigs). Her stall is located in the Carhuaz district market in northern Peru.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$330), to be repaid in 6 installments, Sra. Zenaida has purchased feed, vaccines and other supplies to better care for her animals and sell them for a good price.

Sra. Zenaida, 43, is married and has 2 children. With the earnings from her business, she sends her children to school and propels her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Zenaida, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos de Tinco, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (cuyes, conejos, gallinas, patos, pavos y chanchos”, su lugar de venta es en el mercado del Distrito de Carhuaz y en las ferias del Distrito de Yungay, de la región Ancash.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00 soles ($ 330) que pagara en 6 cuotas, ha comprado, granos, vacunas, afrecho de cebada para alimentar mejor a sus animales y poder venderlos a buen precio.

La señora tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos de su negocio educa a sus hijos y saca adelante a su hogar.

loans.use: Buy feed and vaccines for animal farming business.

loans.name: Janet Roxana

texts.es:
Sra. Janet is a member of the Amigos Marcarinos ("Marcara-Area Friends") community bank. Her shop is located in Marcara's town market in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She sells general merchandise, at retail, along with fruits and vegetables, a business that she's been developing for four years. She has an enterprising, self-sacrificing spirit which has allowed her to fully commit to her family and customers.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.400 (400 Peruvian soles or about US$132), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy more products (rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil and vegetables) to better stock her business.

Sra. Janet, 25, thriving at business, like anyone who aspires to improve themselves, has two small children. Her husband is a bus driver on a route that ends at the Banos Termales de Chancos ("Chancos Thermal Baths"). This has allowed her to meet more people and increase her customer base. She tries not to miss a chance to add new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Janet es socia del Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, su local de venta se encuentra dentro del mercado del Distrito de Marcara, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash, vende abarrotes al por menor combinando con verduras y frutas, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace cuatro años. Ella tiene espíritu emprendedor y abnegado, ello le ha permitido que hoy se sienta comprometida con su familia y con sus clientes.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 400.00 ($ 132) que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más productos (un saco de Arroz, un saco de Azúcar, una bolsa de fideos, una caja de aceite y diversas verduras), con estos productos podrá surtir mejor su negocio.

La señora Janet tiene 25 años, prospera negociante como cualquier persona que aspira seguir superándose, tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo es chofer de colectivos que tienen como destino los Baños Termales de Chancos. Esta actividad le ha permitido conocer mas personas e incrementar sus clientes, trata de no perder la oportunidad de aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Sra. Flor, 27, has one son. She belongs to the Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso ("Forward-Looking Women of Yungay") community bank. Her business operates in the Yungay market in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash.

Sra. Flor says that her bakery used to only make bread. Thanks to loans, she has improved her production and now makes a range of breads, along with pastries, cakes, tortes, empanadas, etc. Consequently, she's able to meet the demands of her customers. Her fondest wish is to open bakeries in the Peruvian city of Huaraz and other outlets.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,200 (1,200 Peruvian soles or about US$398), to be repaid in 6 installments, Sra. Flor will buy bulk supplies of flour, butter, sugar and salt.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo. Pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Yungaínas al Progreso, su negocio se encuentra en el mercado de la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash.

La señora Flor manifiesta que en su Panadería solo producía panes, luego gracias a los créditos ha mejorado su producción, ahora elabora más variedades de panes, pasteles, kekes, tortas, empanadas, etc., de esta manera puede atender la demanda de sus clientes, su anhelo es abrir una Panadería en la Ciudad de Huaraz y otras Sucursales.

Con el reciente préstamo que le otorgo Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200.00 ($ 398) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 6 sacos de harina, 2 cajas de manteca, 3 sacos de azúcar y 1 saco de sal.

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Sra. Clara belongs to the Las Rosas de Yungay group. She earns a living selling men's and women's clothing. She was a street vendor for 2 years, but now she has a stall at a local market in the Peruvian region of Yungay.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she's bought children's clothing for the upcoming Christmas season.

Sra. Clara, 57, is married and has 6 children, all of whom live away from home. She works to help her grandchidren and to pay household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Clara pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, estuvo 2 años vendiendo en un triciclo ambulante y ahora tiene un local ubicado en el Campo ferial del Distrito y Provincia de Yungay.

Con el préstamo recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 Soles ($ 99) que pagara en 4 cuotas, ha comprado ropa para ñiños(as) para las fiestas navideñas.

Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos que son independientes, trabaja para apoyar a sus nietos y sostener los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
Sra. Aparicia started her business carrying regional products (herbs, fruits, wheat flour, beans, peas) from the Sierra region of northern Peru to Lima for sale there. Her business was going well until her oldest daughter died, the pain of which lead her to stop working for a while. Once she overcame that terrible tragedy, she opened a shop in the "ovalo" (presumably, an oval-shaped market) in her local region of Ancash in Peru. The store attracted many shoppers and is now the largest shop in the area. Sra. Aparicia is a member of the Manuela Ramos de Tinco community bank and the loans that she's received from the bank have hugely helped her to grow her business.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$332), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy bulk supplies of 1.5-litre soft drinks, pasta, cookies, snacks, chocolates and milk.

Sra. Aparicia, 57, is married and has 4 children. Her husband raises peaches and both work hard for the good of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Aparicia inició su negocio haciendo viajes a la ciudad de Lima llevaba productos de la sierra ( hierbas, frutas, harina preparada de trigo, de haba, arveja) al cono norte de Lima. Su negocio le fue bien hasta que murió su hija mayor, este dolor hizo que un tiempo deje de trabajar, una ves superado ese dolor, abrió una bodega en el ovalo del Distrito de Tinco, Provincia de Carhuaz, Región Ancash, tuvo gran acogida por la población, hasta la fecha es la bodega mas grande del distrito. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos de Tinco, los prestamos que le otorgó esta institución le ayudó mucho para hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 1000.00 soles ($ 332), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 paquetes de gaseosa de un litro y medio, dos paquetes de fideos, 5 cajas de galletas, 5 tiras de chisitos (bocaditos), 2 cajas de chocolate y una caja de leche).

La señora Aparicia tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la producción de melocotones, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Alicia Maritza

texts.es:
Sra. Alicia belongs to the Senor de los Milagros de Yungay group. She sells general merchandise at retail in the Peruvian "departamento" or region of Ancash, her charisma having helped her launch the business. She started the store to help her husband with household expenses.

She says that she began with little money, but with help from Manuela Ramos and a recent loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she's bought sugar, rice, and pasta. She's expanding her business, her goal being to grow it a little more everyday and to make it a hub for the neighborhood.

Sra. Alicia, 22, has an 8-month old daughter; she receives help and support from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay, su actividad es la venta de abarrotes al por menor, esta ubicado en el campo Ferial de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash, su carisma hace que ella pueda tener su propio negocio, para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos.

Ella manifiesta que empezó con poco capital y con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos y el reciente crédito obtenido de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($99), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado una bolsa de azúcar, un saco de arroz y dos paquetes de fideos. Esta incrementando su negocio, teniendo como objetivo que crezca cada día más y ser un centro comercial

La señora Alicia tiene 22 años, y tiene una hija de 8 meses, ella recibe el apoyo y ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Katherine Viviana

texts.es:
Sra. Katherine belongs to the Mujer Jepelacina community bank. She lives in Moyobamba, Peru. She sells fruit drinks and cakes, along with sweets and drinks of various brands and sizes, from a stall at a local market. Her mother encouraged her to start the business and helped her get started. She's a person with a strong drive to get ahead, someone who likes work because she wants to manage her own way in the world and to grow as a person and as a woman.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$334), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy the ingredients that she needs to make her cakes (flour, milk, sugar), along with fruits--bananas and papayas; various brands of cookies; chocolates; soft drinks of various brands and sizes; Frugos (a local juice brand); glasses and glass mugs; and fruits to make everyday juice drinks so that she can keep her business well-stocked.

Katherine, 28, has 2 young daughters but that hasn't kept her from continuing with her business. She's happy with what she's done because her husband supports her efforts. Furthermore, the market is next to her house so she can easily share time to care for her kids and the household. She's also pleased with her results so far: her customer base has grown, something that pushes her to keep on improving the business. Her goal is to stock and improve her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Katherine pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujer Jepelacina, vive en Moyobamba, enn Region de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de jugos de diferentes frutas y Kekes, también vende golosinas y bebidas de diferentes marcas y tamaños en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad. Decidió iniciar su negocio por iniciativa de su mamá quien le facilitó este puesto, es una persona con muchas ganas de superación, que le gusta el trabajo por que le gusta manejar su propio capital, y crecer como persona y mujer.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000 soles ($ 334.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus kekes ( harina en paquetes, leche en caja, azúcar en sacos), también comprará frutas como plátano en racimos, papaya en cantidad, golosinas como galletas en paquetes y de diferentes marcas, chocolates, bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, frugos de igual forma, vasos y jarritas pequeñas de vidrio y frutas para la preparación de jugos todos los días, de esa manera mantener su negocio bien surtido.

Tiene 28 años y 2 hijas aún pequeñas, pero eso no le desmotiva para seguir en el negocio, esta contenta con lo que hace porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, ademas el mercado queda junto a su casa y puede compartir muy bien su tiempo para dedicarse al cuidado de sus niñas y de su casa, también esta satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, y eso la motiva a seguir mejorando cada día, su meta es surtir y mejorar su puesto de venta.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Sra. Martha belongs to the Mujer Jepelacina community bank. She lives in Moyobamba, Peru. She earns a living selling general merchandise in a local market. She started the business with a loan from the community bank and, little by little, it's grown. She started with little more than a table but now she has a bigger space where she has a stand to show off her products, something that allows her to better serve her customers. She's a hardworking person, skilled at business. She decided to start her business because she wanted to earn an income of her own, something that would boost her self-esteem and help her grow as a person and as a woman.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles or about US$833), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, milk (of different brands and sizes), cooking oil, detergent, pasta, onions, garlic and other products. She wants her customers to be able to find what they're looking for and she knows that offering a wide range of products will increase her sales.

Sra. Martha, 46, has 5 children. She has the support of her husband, something that she didn't have at the outset. She's happy with what she's accomplished to date: her customer base has grown, she's improved her economic situation and she can help with household expenses. Her goal is to ensure that the business is well-established in a bigger and more secure place.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujer Jepelacina, vive en Moyobamba, en la Región de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad, ella se inició con el crédito del banco comunal y poco a poco fue creciendo. Se inicio con una mesa y ahora ya tiene un puesto más amplio en donde puede tener un estante para exhibir y acomodar mejor sus productos, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil para el negocio, además le gusta generar sus propios ingresos para alimentar su autoestima y así crecer como persona y mujer.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 soles ($ 833), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar en sacos, cajas de leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, aceite en cajas, paquetes de detergentes, fideos en cajas, cebolla , ajos en sacos, y demás productos para surtir mejor su negocio, por que quiere que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, cuando hay variedad el negocio aumentan las ventas .

Tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, por que en un inicio no fue así, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, eso también ayudó a que mejore su situación económica y pueda ayudar en los gastos de su casa, su meta es contar con un negocio bien implementado y en un lugar mas amplio y seguro.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria sells all types of goods in her general store. There are a variety of eye-catching products in her store for her customers. She has been in the business 15 years and started with the help of her sister. Together they saved $100 and started selling goods on the streets near the central market.

Little by little, with the earnings she built a shop out of tin sheets and displayed her products on wooden stands and others on the floor when there wasn't space. But when it rained, streams of waters entered and soaked her goods.

Maria has received more than 20 loans over time and we have been part of her growth. She knows how to run her business and has done this with pride, and has been able with a lot of hard work to acquire her own shop located at a strategic spot in the market. Her development has encouraged a selling atmosphere, and her products are well organized and visible to customers.

Her family is pleased because they have seen Maria's personal, moral and economic growth. Her son is equally happy because thanks to the business his mother is helping him attend college. In her own words, Maria says, "I'm very grateful for the loans you have given me, your support in the good times and the bad, and above all, … for behind there when I need it."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria Lourdes López T. vende todo tipo de bisuteria (retrateras, peluches, adornos, cosméticos, collares, etc). Existe una variedad de productos en su tienda que son llamativos para los clientes. Cumple 15 años de tener el negocio, nos comenta que ella inició con la ayuda de su hermana, juntas lograron ahorrar U$100 (cien dólares netos). Inicialmente no tenian un módulo, asi que comenzaron a la interperie, vendiendo a la orilla de la calle del Mercado Central en León.

Poco a poco, con sus ganancias fué construyendo su módulo con láminas de zinc, pero los productos estaban puestos en unos estantes de madera y algunos otros en el suelo cuando no alcanzaban. Aguantaban sol y agua, porque cuando llovía, las corrientes de agua entraban en el lugar y mojaban todos los productos, deteriorando de esta manera su mercadería.

Ella ha accesado a mas de 20 créditos y somos partícipes de su crecimiento. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y lo demuestra con orgullo, pues logró con mucho esfuerzo adquirir su propio módulo ubicado en un punto estratégico del mercado. La actividad se desarrolla en un ambiente de movimiento, sus productos están ordenados y visibles al cliente.

Su familia se siente contenta porque han visto como ha crecido personal, moral y economicamente, su hijo igual está feliz porque con este negocio su mamá le esta ayudando con sus estudios universitarios, las palabras de doña Maria son las siguientes: "Les estoy muy agradecida con los créditos que me han brindado, su apoyo en los buenos y en los malos momentos y sobre todo...estar ahi cuando lo necesito"

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (women's purses, clocks, all types of gifts, etc.)

loans.name: Sose

texts.en: Sose is an old widowed woman, 61 years old, and has 3 kids. She is very talented in sewing different clothes such shorts, T-shirts, blouses, puletasi (a traditional Samoan garment) and skirts. Her loan is for buying supplies such as a new sewing machine, threads, needles and fabrics. Her clients usually come to her, but during slow periods, she sews garments and sells them to the flea markets.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Talalelei Merita

texts.en: Talalelei is a lady of 49 years old, married with four children. She is very good in making pork buns which she has made for five years now. Her loan is for buying ingredients such as flour, salt, yeast, drippings (fat) and meats. She sells them at school and at the village five days a week, and makes a net profit of 120 Tala ($48) per day, which ishe thinks is good. She said she is very happy about her business because it helps with family financial obligations and especially school fees for her children. And she is thankful for the loan program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pork bun business

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa is 49 years old and is widowed with three kids. She is very talented in sewing different kinds of clothes, which she learned from her mother who passed away. She is using this loan to buy materials such as fabrics, threads and needles, as well as to repair the roof of her house. Most of her clients come to her but during slow periods she takes her garments to the flea markets. She is very happy to help support her family with her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business and for home improvement

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Doña Ricarda has a workshop in her house in which they create rustic furniture, such as wardrobes and wooden chairs. In addition, she buys fine arts and crafts of bright colors. She has been working on this business for 33 years, having started with a working capital of US$286 (two hundred eighty six dollars). She started in some stone benches with wooden shelves in which she would place small things she could get out of her workshop, which at the time was still newly built. The shop was out in the open, under the sun, and she would sell there all day... but that was before the central market of Leon was remodeled.

As a result of working with loans, she has been able to invest in her business, have her own stand, and fill it with typical Nicaraguan merchandise, as well as being able to buy raw material to create her own products. She is married and has a minor grandchild living with her. She is the only one in her household who works and the sole support of her home. Her dream is that this business will grow and her workshop can move to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Ricarda tiene un taller en su casa ya que elaboran artículos rústicos como roperos, sillas de madera, además de eso compra artesania fina de vistosos colores. Lleva 33 años de tener este negocio y inició con un capital de trabajo de U$ 286 (doscientos ochenta y seis dolares). Inició en unas bancas de piedra con estantes de madera donde colocaba cositas pequeñas que podia sacar en el día de su taller que aun estaba recien construido. El negocio se encontraba al aire libre bajo el sol, vendía todo el día...pero esto fue antes de que remodelaran el mercado central de León

A raiz de trabajar con los créditos ella ha logrado invertir en su negocio, tener su propio módulo y surtir su venta con mercaderia típica nicaragüense asi como la compra de materiales para fabricar sus propios productos. Ella está casada y tiene un nieto menor de edad viviendo con ella, es la única que trabajo, es quien mantiene su hogar. Su sueño es que este negocio logre crecer y su fábrica sea trasladada a la ciudad.

loans.use: Buying guacanaste wood to create her own arts and crafts products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria S. is a woman who likes to fight for her three small children so they can get ahead in spite of the adversities that they are presently living. This is why Gloria tries to earn money to be able to pay their school expenses, so they don't start to work. After a child starts to earn money, he/she doesn't care anymore about doing better in school and little by little he/she stops studying. This is why Gloria doesn't let her children work like other families do, without worrying that their children won't amount to be anybody in the world. Gloria sells clothes among her family members and neighbors in addition to offering them naturist products. She started this business five years ago, when her children started to grow up.

Nevertheless, the fight continues to get more clientele that buy from her and that don't go to the competition. This is why she is requesting a loan of $925, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy the merchandise that her clients are asking her for a lot and to buy a better assortment for the winter season so her clients don't go to the competition. With your help, Gloria will be able to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria S. es una mujer, que le gusta luchar por sus tres pequeños hijos para que salgan adelante a pesar de las adversidades con las que viven actualmente. Es por eso que Gloria trata de sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de sus escuelas, y que no empiecen a trabajar, puesto que después de que un niño comienza a ganar dinero, no les importa superarse en la escuela y poco a poco dejan de estudiar. Por eso Gloria no permite que sus hijos trabajen como otras familias lo hacen, sin importarles que un niño sin educación no llegará a ser nadie en el mundo. Gloria se dedica a vender ropa entre sus familiares y vecinos, además de ofrecerles productos naturistas. Hace cinco años que comenzó en este negocio, desde que sus hijos comenzaron a crecer.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue por conseguir más clientela que le compre a ella y no se vaya con la competencia es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar la mercancía que tanto le están pidiendo unas clientas, y comprar más surtido para la temporada de invierno y que sus clientas no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda Gloria podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to supply her business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
Maria was tired of having household expenses use up all of her husband's income, and even in some occasions not having enough money to pay for services like gas or electricity. Maria decided to start selling some product which would not take too much time so she would not neglect her two little boys who need her care. And so it was that she started with a small catalogue with shoes and cosmetics which she would offer her neighbors and friends, "And little by little, without realizing it, I had clients who would request shoes and cosmetic products so I stopped letting orders go by and started moving them in such a way that this activity is now part of our family economy."

However, she recently had to pay for many things because of a lull in her sales. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $275 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to fulfill the requests that she already has for the Christmas season and buy more merchandise to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

María, cansada de que los gastos absorbieran todo el sueldo de su esposo, y les faltara en muchas ocasiones para pagar los servicios como la luz o el gas. Se decide a comenzar a vender algún producto que no le quitara tanto tiempo para no descuidar a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes necesitan del cuidado de María. Fue así como comenzó con un pequeño catálogo de zapatos y cosméticos que fue ofreciéndole a sus vecinas, y sus amigas, “Y poco a poco sin darme cuenta ya tenia clientes que me solicitaban calzado y productos cosméticos por lo que ya no deje caer los pedidos y les fui dando movimiento de tal manera que ya forma parte de la economía de nuestra familia”.

Sin embargo hace poco tuvo que pagar muchas cosas, debido a una baja que hubo en sus ventas. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 275 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar los pedidos que ya le hicieron para la temporada navideña y para poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientas.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for Christmas season.

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra Luz is a single mother of a small girl. To be able to take good care of her daughter, she used to work all day; nevertheless, she was neglecting her a lot. One day she made a small piñata for her daughter to celebrate her birthday, and everybody that saw it asked her where she bought it. She noticed that people liked the way she made piñatas, so she decided to begin selling them full-time. Little by little, the people in her town noticed that Sandra made piñatas, and that's how she formed her clientele.

Today Sandra is requesting a credit of $925, to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money she will be able to buy more material to make her piñatas and to prepare herself adequately for the Christmas season when many people buy piñatas. With your help, Sandra will be able to take good care of her daughter without the need of the girl's father. And she will be able to show her daughter that everything in life can be accomplished with the right effort and attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

. Sandra Luz, es madre soltera de una pequeñita niña, para poder sacar adelante a su hija trabajaba todo el día sin embargo la descuidaba mucho. Un día que le hizo una pequeña piñatita a su hija para festejarle su cumpleaños, le hizo una piñata, y todos los que vieron esta piñatita, le preguntaban el lugar dónde compró la piñata y ella se dio cuenta que a la gente le gustaba la forma en que ella estaba haciendo las piñatas. Por lo que decidió ponerse a vender piñatas de tiempo completo y así poco a poco las personas de su colonia se fueron dando cuenta que Sandra hacía piñatas, y fue formando su clientela.

Hoy Sandra está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más materia prima para fabricar sus piñatas para prepararse suficientemente en esta temporada navideña, en que muchas personas compran piñatas. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá sacar a su hija adelante sin la necesidad del padre de la niña. Y le mostrará que en la vida todo se puede a base de esfuerzo y actitud.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to make more piñatas.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina started helping her mom at a seamstress shop two years ago, because her mom had many orders and could not fulfill all of them. That is how her interest in this type of business started. Little by little Karina got clients who want her to make clothes for them, and so, two sewing machines provide Karina's livelihood.

Karina is very hopeful to be able to get married and have children to teach them how good life can be when one works hard. She also wants to help her mother with the household expenses because her mom cannot do much sewing anymore because this work hurts her back. This is why Karina is requesting a loan for US$1,100 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Karina will be able to buy a new sewing machine and so she will finish her jobs more quickly, because one of the sewing machines she has is now very old and it takes a long time to sew an article of clothing. With your help, Karina will be able to help her mom and save money to get married.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Karina comenzó a ayudarle a su mamá hace dos años, en un taller de costura, puesto que su mamá tenía muchos pedidos y no podía sacarlos todos. Y fue así como comenzó por interesarse en este tipo de negocios. Y poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientas que quieren que les fabrique ropa. Y con dos máquinas de coser es con lo que vive Karina.

Karina está muy ilusionada por poder en un futuro casarse y tener hijos para enseñarles los bueno que es la vida si se trabaja duro. Y también desea ayudar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar, puesto que ya no puede mucho con la costura, porque este oficio molesta mucho la espalda. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $1,100 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Karina podrá comprar una nueva máquina de coser para terminar más rápido sus trabajos. Puesto que una de las que tiene está ya muy viejita y tarda mucho en coser una prenda. Con tu ayuda Karina podrá ayudar a su mamá y juntar dinero para poder casarse.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine to sew clothing more quickly.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
One time, when Roberto went out to the streets looking for a job, he found a business in which they made socks and the person in charge let him pick up left over socks. When he took them home and noticed that they had small defects, missing seams. Roberto's wife fixed them and started selling them in a roving market, and using what was left over to stuff pillows they handmade themselves. Little by little they became known as sellers of socks and pillows and he would like to see their business keep growing.

The interesting thing is that he now knows how to make these socks. That is why he is requesting a loan for US $1,150 to be paid in a period of 3 months. With this money he will be able to buy more socks and buy more merchandise to keep making and selling socks and have more variety to offer to his clients. With your help, Roberto will be able to support his family and overcome the hardship they suffered when Roberto didn't have a job.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

En una ocasión cuando Roberto salía a las calles a buscar trabajo encontró un negocio en dónde hacen calcetas y el encargado le dio oportunidad de levantar los retazos de las calcetas y las llevó a su casa y notó que tenían un pequeño defecto, les faltaban unas costuras, la esposa de Roberto las remendó y empezó a venderlas, en un mercado rodante y con lo que no se puede reparar lo utilizan para el relleno de almohadas que fabrican ellos mismos. Poco a poco se está dando a conocer como un vendedor de calcetines y almohadas, y desea que su negocio siga creciendo.

Lo interesante es que ya aprendió la manera en que se hacen estos calcetines. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $1,150 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más calcetines y comprar más mercancía para poder seguir haciendo y/o vendiendo calcetines y tener más variedad para su clientela. Con tu ayuda Roberto podrá sacar a su familia adelante y superar las penas que pasaron cuando Roberto no tenía trabajo.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise and raw material to have more variety in his business.

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.es:
Lino Ventura is a responsible father of his family who cares for his son, due to the fact that his son’s mother died, leaving only the two of them. Nonetheless, his son gives Lino the strength to keep moving forward in life. Currently his son is married and is a good man. However, Lino wants to keep working, as it is already a passion for him, and in the future he would like his son to inherit the business and keep growing it.

For this reason, Lino is requesting a loan of $375, which he will repay over a period of 5 months. With this money, Lino wants to buy a new welding machine, which will allow him to offer better service to his customers. In this way he will grow his business so it will be well-known in his community as a business that does very good work. With your help, Lino will feel he has the power to grow his business, and because of this he will have the peace of mind that his son will be able to continue to guide the business that Lino began on a good path.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lino Ventura, es un padre de familia responsable, que cuida de su hijo, puesto que la madre de él murió y se quedaron solos los dos. Sin embargo el hijo le da la fuerza a Lino para seguir saliendo adelante en la vida. Actualmente su hijo se encuentra casado y es un hombre de bien. Sin embargo don Lino desea seguir trabajando. Puesto que esta ya es una pasión para él y para que en un futuro pueda heredarle el negocio a su hijo y este siga creciendo.

Es por esto que Lino está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero Lino desea comprar una Máquina nueva para soldar, y con esto podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y así crecer su negocio para que este quede consolidado en su comunidad como un negocio que hace muy bien sus trabajos. Con tu ayuda Lino podrá sentirse superado al crecer su negocio y así tener la tranquilidad de que su hijo podrá continuar por el buen camino el negocio que con mucho esfuerzo comenzó Lino.

loans.use: Buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is a retired man who wants to feel useful and at the same time earn an income in addition to his pension. For this reason he decided to begin to look for a job that would not require much effort, but would require a lot of dedication, like all jobs. Eduardo sells used clothing in the area outside his house, and in this way he is able to dedicate his time to being with his family and at the same time feel useful, working to make a little bit of extra money and pay the household bills.

Nonetheless, he has not yet bought any used clothing, as the earnings have been used little by little to pay for household expenses and his three children. Because of this, he is requesting a loan of $325 that he plans to repay over a period of 3 months. With this money Eduardo will be able to buy two bales of winter clothing, to be able to offer something new to his customers. With your help Eduardo can have a dignified job and at the same time give him the opportunity to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo es un señor jubilado, que desea sentirse útil y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso extra al de su pensión. Es por esto que decidió comenzar a buscar un trabajo para desarrollar, que no le requiera de mucho esfuerzo pero sí de mucha dedicación como todos los trabajos. Eduardo se dedica a vender ropa usada en las afueras de su casa, y así puede dedicar su tiempo a estar con la familia y al mismo tiempo sentirse útil, trabajando para poder sacar un dinerito extra y pagar las cuentas de su casa.

Sin embargo ya no ha comprado ropa usada, puesto que las ganancias se le han ido poco a poco en los gastos de su casa y sus 3 hijos. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que piensa pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y así con este dinero Eduardo podrá comprar dos pacas de ropa de invierno, para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Eduardo podrá tener un trabajo digno y al mismo tiempo darle la oportunidad de pagar los gastos de su casa.

loans.use: Buy winter clothing

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is a woman who works hard for her two little children of 5 and 2 years, who need a lot of care from her. Maria's husband is a temporary employee, and so they cannot always be sure that they can count no having the job. Thinking about the worse case scenario, and to have a income in addition of what her husband makes, Maria decided to start selling merchandise and she came across shoe catalogues, which is what she is currently selling. Little by little her clientele has grown, and she has more and more orders for shoes.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US$275 to be paid in a period of 5 months. With this money, Maria Magdalena will be able to cover the orders she already has for the winter season that is starting. In addition, she will be able to buy a few more shoes to have in inventory to offer to her clients. With your help, Maria will be able to support her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

María Magdalena, es una mujer que lucha por sus dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 2 años, quienes necesitan de mucho cuidado por parte de ella. El esposo de María es empleado temporal, y por lo tanto no están seguros de que siempre pueda contar con ese trabajo. Previniendo que lo peor pase y para poder un ingreso extra a lo que gana el esposo. María decidió comenzar a vender mercancía, y se topó con los catálogos de zapatos, que es lo que está vendiendo actualmente, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su cartera de clientes, y cada vez son más los que le hacen pedidos de zapatos.

Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $275 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero María Magdalena podrá surtir los pedidos que le han hecho hasta el día de hoy. Para la temporada de invierno que ya está comenzando. Además de poder comprar un poco de más zapatos para tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar a sus dos hijos adelante.

loans.use: Covering existing orders and buying winter inventory.

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es:
Martha Francisca has three children for whom she and her husband work very hard, so they become good men. Martha's husband works as a bricklayer so his income is not very good. That is why Francisca decided to start selling things to be able to make money and help with the household expenses. Martha started selling used clothing among her neighbors and friends, and she is now trying to sell new clothing, since that is a more profitable market. So, she goes to Villa Hidalgo to get new clothes so she can have more to offer her clients.

However, the clothing she has now is for the Fall season, and she would like to buy more clothes to have more variety to show her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $550, which she has decided she will pay in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more used and new clothing to offer her clients. With your help, Martha and her husband will be able to support their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Francisca tiene tres hijos por quienes su esposo y ella trabajan muy duro para que sean hombres D. bien. El esposo D. Martha trabaja como obrero así que sus ingresos no son muy buenos. Y es por eso que Francisca decidió comenzar a vender cosas para poder sacar dinero y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Martha comenzó por vender ropa usada entre sus vecinas y amigos, y hoy está tratando D. vender ropa nueva, puesto que en esta se encuentra mucha ganancia, y se va a Villa Hidalgo a surtir D. ropa nueva para poder tener algo qué ofrecerle a sus clientas.

Sin embargo la ropa que tiene ya es la que le queda D. la temporada D. Otoño, y desea comprar más ropa para poder tener surtido que mostrarle a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito D. US $550 que está propuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses, y con este dinero podrá comprar más ropa usada y nueva para ofrecerle a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda Martha sacará adelante a sus tres hijos junto con su esposo.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for the Winter season.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a single mother and she wants her daughter to go to college so that she can have a better future than her own. To support herself and her daughter, Rosaura has worked selling used clothing in a roving market, and from that job she makes money for her home, her daughter's school and herself.

However, Rosaura would like to start selling new clothing to have more variety to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $550 to be paid in 6 months. With that money she will be able to buy merchandise in Villa Hidalgo, where clothing is manufactured and sold for less money, so she can sell it in the small market. With your help, Rosaura will be able to support her daughter's success.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosaura, tiene una responsabilidad que la hace luchar por superarse. Es madre soltera, y desea que su hija estudie hasta la licenciatura para que pueda tener un mejor futuro que el de ella. Para poder mantenerse a ella y a su hija Rosaura tiene 10 años trabajando como vendedora de ropa usada en un mercado ambulante, y de ahí saca para la casa, la escuela de su hija y ella.

Sin embargo Rosaura desea comenzar a vender ropa nueva para tener más variedad qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá ir a comprar mercancía a Villa Hidalgo, en dónde fabrican ropa y la venden económica, para vender en el mercadito. Con tu ayuda Rosaura podrá sacar a su hija adelante.

loans.use: Buying new clothing to offer variety to her clients.

loans.name: Molimaufou

texts.en: Molimaufou is a 45-year-old married mother of 7 children who are all in school. Having a big family means financial obligations, especially education. She been has running her flea market stall for about a year. With the support of her husband they have managed to overcome their financial problems. Molimaufou is planning to extend the size of her flea market.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Paugata
