texts.en: Paugata is a young single lady of 18 years of age. Her mother has her own flea market stall, which she has been running for almost two years. She lived with her parents, 2 brothers and 2 sisters; then her father passed away a year ago. Her mother has a hard time in supporting her siblings and her. When Paugata left school she decided to do something so she could help her mother in supporting the family. She heard of SPBD (the lending agency) through her relatives. She is very thankful that she has able to get a loan and contribute financially to her family.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Aima

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Djouromfouk-Houssel group, led by Ms. Aima S..  

This group sells things like cashew wine (very popular in this region), palm oil, and dried fish. They buy big quantities of these products in Ziguinchor cities and resell them here in M’Lomp and surrounding villages at a mark-up.


The group had a previous tontine, or a type of social security system where the various group members contribute a fixed amount of money to a pooled account in case of emergency. This same group decided to take a SEM loan to support their various business endeavors. The skills learned in a tontine can be very useful in a group loan situation, as both rely heavily on group decision-making, group governance and management of money. With almost no social systems to look out for the elderly, this type of group cohesion is extremely beneficial.


When it comes time to spend the profits in the pooled account, the group will have a group meeting. Money from their past business activities has been spent on such things as: buying seeds for the garden, buying material to tend to the garden, building a well, and cost associated with illness. 

This is the group's second Kiva loan.   To learn more, see Djouroumfouk-Houssel's previous Kiva business page at  http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=707.


Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.  Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of cashew nuts, palm oil and dried fish and transportation to village for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Balandite 1 group, led by Ms. Jacqueline D.. This is the women's second Kiva loan. When the first loan was repaid, Balandite divided into two groups, Balandite 1 and Balandite 2, each of which is requesting a second Kiva loan.

When the group received their first loan they partitioned the money into portions of 25,000 CFA ($50), of 50,000 CFA ($100), or 75,000 CFA ($150), which were then distributed to the different group members. The different members work and function independently, while sharing the responsibility of repayment. They all sell mainly household products, but they do not all sell the same things.

Jacqueline sells soap, pens, erasers, notebooks, basins, SOS pads, among other things. Other group members sell things like palm oil, peanuts and limes. Jaquline buys her products in Dakar where they are cheap, and sells them at a mark-up here in M’Lomp. As an example, she can buy a pack of 24 SOS pads for 1,200 CFA ($3.00). She then sells each SOS pad individually for 100 CFA, or 2,400 CFA for the 12 (a 100% mark-up!). Goods are shipped from Dakar to this region via a cargo boat.

When asked to discuss the difficulties associated with this business, Jacqueline states that poverty is everywhere. I asked her to explain what she meant. She told me that it is very common for someone to pay for a more expensive good like a basin (which sells for 1,000 CFA or $2.00) in three payments. What this means for Jacqueline is that she has capital tied up and is chasing for payments.

As far as future business plans, Jacqueline would like to take another loan and continue to expand her business. One thought for expansion is to sell products indigenous to this region in Dakar. She proudly states that she knows this type of business well and has the skill set to manage this type of expansion. Another idea is to build a proper shop outside of her home (she lives just off the main road). At the moment people know that she has these types of products and will come seek her out to buys goods, but she would love to formalize and with a larger quantity of goods in a traditional store.

To learn more about Ms. D. and her colleagues, see Balandite's former Kiva business description at http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=670.

The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of miscellaneous household goods and transport to village for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Balandite 1 group, led by Ms. Jacqueline M.. This is the women's second Kiva loan. When the first loan was repaid, Balandite divided into two groups, Balandite 1 and Balandite 2, each of which is requesting a second Kiva loan.

To learn more about this group, see Balandite's former Kiva business description at http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=670.

loans.use: Purchase of miscellaneous household goods and transportation to village for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. was born in the district of Changalane in Namaacha, province of Maputo. He studied until the 10th grade. When he was 17 years old, he married and had 4 children. He worked in agriculture cultivating vegetables and raising cattle.

He was introduced to Hluvuku through friends. Manuel requested a loan of 20.000mt to buy more cattle. Today he is selling his products from his shop. It brings the products close to the residents saving the cost of travelling to buy meat. He manages the business with his wife. In the future, Manuel wants his business to grow.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. Actividade: Comércio Valor De Empréstimo: 20.000,00Mt(800.00USS) Aplicação:Compra de cabeças de gaD. pra revenda Inicio:12/09/2007 Fim: 04/01/2009

Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. Nasceu em Changalane distrito de Namaacha Provincia de Maputo,Estudou até a 10 classe deviD. a debelidade financeira.. Aos 17 anos juntou se maritalmente, o qual resultou 4 filhos estanD. ainda juntos até o Ano corrente, para a sua sobrevivência dedicou-se a agricultura na produção de hortícolas donde acabou por criar o talho pra venda de carne de vaca. Conhece a Hluvuku através de conversas com amigos no distrito e dai aproximou-se e solicitou empréstimo, com este empréstimo de 20.000,00Mt pretende incrementar o volume D. seu negocio de venda de carne de vaca compranD. cabeças de gaD. para abate.

Actualmente, esta exploranD. um talho que é o único na vila de boane que oferece bom ambiente de negocio e tem contribuíD. pra colocar o Produto mais perto D. consumidor reduzinD. desta forma os custos deslocação . Ele dirige pessoalmente o seu estabelecimento e na sua ausência a sua esposa e os rendimento da venda encrementa na renda familiar E no crescimento D. seu estabelecimento. Pretende futuramente ampliar o seu estabelecimento e as suas machambas.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Judite Jacinto M. is married and has 5 children. The oldest son is 18 years old and the youngest 9. She was born on April 29th 1972 in the Boane District in the province of Maputo. She was raised by her parents and studied until the 6th grade. At the age of 16 she moved in with her husband and started a small business. She joined the Gueguegue and GGLS credit programs before, but they only offered loans to groups and group members were responsible for payments of others.

She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and requested a loan to invest on her business. With the loan of 15.000mt Judite plans to increase her inventory. She buys goods in Swaziland and sells them to the Burundese. She manages her business with her son. With income for the business she supports the schooling of her younger children. In the future, Judite plans on increasing her inventory and opening another store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao : Bairro 03 Gueguegue Cliente : Judite Jacinto M. Actividade : Comercio Valor de empréstimo : 15.000,00 MT ( 600.00 USS) Aplicação : compra e venda de produtos alimentatres Inicio: 05-11-07 Fim: 27-02-09

Judite Jacinto M., casada maritalmente ,tem 5 filhos ,o mais velho tem 18 anos e mais novo 9 anos ,tem 35 anos de idade ,nasceu a 29 de Abril de 1972 no distrito de Boane ,província de Maputo ,viveu com os pais ate aos 16 anos ,estudou ate 6ªclasse e ainda com os seus 16 anos conheceu o seu marido e passou a viver com ele ,depois começou a exercer um pequeno negocio de venda de produtos alimentares como forma de ajudar nas despesas familiares. Teve o 1ºcontacto de empréstimo com as Associações de credito que funcionam no bairro vizinho de Gueguegue e outra, G.G.L.S, ambas ofereciam créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma boa experiência porque para alem dos valores financiados serem menores tinham de assumir responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos elementos do grupo não efectuar o pagamento .

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas tendo aproximado e solicitado o seu 1º empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio . Com o credito de 15.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o stock dos produtos no seu negocio .Actualmente esta explorando um estabelecimento e as vezes vai a Swaziland comprar outros produtos e faz entrega aos Burundeses.Ela dirige pessoalmente o negocio e na sua ausença o filho é que tem tomado conta do mesmo e com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos escolares dos seus filhos . No futuro pretende aumentar mais mercadoria e abrir outro estabelecimento comercial.

loans.use: To buy stock to increase her business

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mr. L. La (aged 47) and his wife, Keat Pov (aged 39) got married in 1986. They have three daughters and two sons, two of whom still study in school and two who work in a garment factory. They are requesting their first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. They will use this loan to purchase three cows, a boat and a fishing net.

Currently, they grow food such as rice and raise chickens and a few pigs. La also does construction work when he can find employment. As is typical here in Cambodia, we met beneath their stilt house in the area that serves as an indoor/outdoor live/work space. La explained that he actually built his family’s home in 1994 using salvaged lumber. The many tunnels and voids gnawed by termites testified to both the decrepitude of the prior dwelling that was the source of the lumber and the imminent need for replacement of this one. When they save enough money, Pov and La said they hope to replace their very modest house with a new one.

La learned to raise cows many years ago before the Pol Pot regime here in Cambodia. Because it is relatively expensive, beef has fallen down the list of sources of protein. Nonetheless, as the economy joins in the growth of the other countries in this region, beef is regaining popularity. Pov and Las's use mosquito netting to protect the animals from murderous bites and have already walled off a space beneath their house to use as a stall.

Pov and La explained that there is a breeder near their village who sells a bovine “starter pack” of sorts – one adult male and one adult female for US $400 each plus one calf free of charge. La and Pov say that it takes one year to raise a cow to maturity. In that time, it will eat approximately $200 worth of food – mostly grass and rice straw. These both need to be purchased due to high population density and to flooding during monsoon season (both factors limiting grazing space). When the cow is mature, they sell it either for slaughter or for further husbandry.

By far the most popular source of protein here is fish. This country is graced with an abundance of freshwater lakes from which Cambodians harvest two-thirds of the protein they consume. La has fished for many years but has never owned his own boat. A used boat and a net will cost them about $200.

loans.use: Purchasing three cows and a boat & fishing net.

loans.name: Domingos Francisco

texts.pt:
Domingos Francisco F. is 54 years old and a native of Buzi, Sofala province. He lived with his parents until the age of six. After the death of his father in 1959, he stayed with his mother until attending the 9th grade.

In 1979, he entered the National Defense Ministry as a soldier and was later transferred to the Ministry of Security where he worked until retirement. He married his wife in 1987 and moved in with her in the city of Matola. He currently has two children.

In 1994, he worked in the accounting department of the Guestetner warehouse in the harbor of the city of Maputo. In 2000 he moved to Boane and took his first loan from a credit association known as Tchuma that offered individual loans.

He came to know Hluvuku-Adsema in 2006 through a neighbor and applied for his first loan to purchase construction materials. With this loan of 15,000 MT he plans to finish building his home. He later plans to build a protection wall for his future house.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao : Bairro 5 Cliente: Domingos Francisco F. Actividade :Habitação Valor de empréstimo :15.000,00 MT (600.00 USS) Aplicação : compra de material de construção Domingos Francisco F. ,de 54 anos de idade ,natural de Buzi ,província de Sofala ,cresceu com os seus pais ate aos 6 anos .Apos a morte do seu pai em 1959 continuou a viver com a mãe ate frequentar a 9ª classe. Em 1979 entrou no ministério da defesa nacional como militar e depois foi transferido para o ministério de segurança onde trabalhou ate ter a reforma . Juntou-se com a esposa em 1987 e passou a viver com ela na cidade da Matola ,tem actualmente 2 filhos . Em 1994 trabalhou como fiel do armazém na Guestetner na baixa da cidade do Maputo ,t No ano de 2000 começou a viver em Boane e teve o seu 1º empréstimo com uma associação de credito TCHUMA que oferecia créditos individuais . Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema desde 2006 através do vizinho e dai aproximou-se e solicitou o seu empréstimo para compra de material de construção .Com este credito de 15.000, 00 MT pretende concluir a sua obra. Futuramente a prespectiva é de construir um muro para vedar a sua futura casa.

loans.use: To buy material to build his house

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. T. Ly (aged 53) and his wife Chhet Srey (aged 50) got married in 1981. They have nine children, seven of whom still live at home and four who are still in school. This $700 loan is their first loan from MAXIMA. They will use this loan to purchase seed for vegetable produce, fertilizer and pesticide. They have been farming for fifteen years.

Ly and his family live on the edge of a large, shallow depression just west of the Tonle Bassac (river) south of Phnom Penh. During the wet season, the depression fills with water for about three months. As the water recedes, local people plow and plant vegetables in the very fertile soil. To make the most of the growing season, they start seedlings in protected areas in their front yards (see photo). As soon as the plots are ready, they transfer the seedlings to the open depression.

The main vegetable Ly and his family grow is a leafy green similar to broccoli. In a normal season, they can get five cuttings. Over the nine-month dry season they can plant three times. They also grow some cucumbers, cabbage and corn. They irrigate using a gas powered pump. Many people in the area still carry water in large sprinkler cans carried one to a shoulder.

They sell their produce to buyers who, in-turn, sell it in the large markets of Phnom Penh. They both say that farming has been a good livelihood and they’ll continue to do it as long as they can. Their farming future is not guaranteed. They explained that the government is considering building a large port facility along the Tonle Bassac which could encroach on their farming plot. If this happens, they would have to sell their land and move elsewhere to farm. As of now, those development plans remain speculative and the farming continues. Other than continuing to farm and save, both Srey and her husband expressed the hope of having their children study in school to the highest possible level.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ousmak

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Ousamak is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. Kob Mat, is 34 years old. The couple got married in 1996 and have four children, 3 of whom still live at home while the youngest is still in school. The family has been raising ducks for fifteen years. Beside helping her raise ducks, her husband also sells fish for sale in the village.

Mrs M. is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA of $800. She plans to use the loan to purchase baby ducks and duck feed.

loans.use: Purchasing 200 baby ducks

loans.name: Hot

texts.en:
Mr. Y. Hot (aged 46) and his wife Mrs. Ly Mai Som (aged 40) got married in 1979. They have 6 children: 4 sons and 2 daughters. Hot and his family are in the fishing business, which he started in 1979. His wife helps him with selling fish in the village. The couple both did not finish primary school. Four of his children live with him and help him with his fishing. Two children were married and are also in fishing.

Mr Hot has borrowed money from MAXIMA thrice before. He is now requesting a $1,000 loan. He will use this money to purchase a fishing net and one new boat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and fisher-boat .

loans.name: Eva Fenias

texts.pt:
Eva Fenias C. was born in Chilembene, Chokwé district, Gaza province, in 1950. She lived with her parents until the age of 15. She attended school until the 2nd grade under the old system in Chilembene. She married in 1975 at the age of 16 and now has five children and two grandchildren. She lives with her husband, two grandchildren and three children.

In 1990, she left Chokwé for Maputo due to the war, and in mid-1990 she started selling a variety of products as a way of becoming self-employed and supporting her family. In 1991, she left Maputo for Mafuiane and continued the business. Seeing that it was profitable, she decided to settle permanently in Mafuiane with her husband and children. In 2000, she discovered a credit union named GGLS offering 1800 MT. She worked for them for 5 years.

She came to know Hluvuku-Adsema in 2006 through Ms. Isaura. She came to us to get more information about our services and applied for her first loan of 20,000 MT. After paying back the first loan, she requested an additional 16,000 MT to buy materials for wiring her home for electricity. She manages the loan with the help of her husband and two children, as well as with the profits from the business. In the future, she plans to take a loan of 20,000 MT to purchase construction materials for building a home for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização:Mafuiane Cliente:Eva Fenias C. Actividade:Habitacao Valor do empréstimo:16000MT Aplicação:Compra de material para eletrificação da casa Inicio:12/11/07 Fim:05/05/09 Eva Fenias C.,nasceu em Chilembene ,Distrito de Chokwé,Província de Gaza em 1950.Viveu com os pais ate os 15 anos. Eestudou ate a 2ª classe do antigo sistema em Chilembene. Casou em 1975 com 16 anos de idade tem 5 filhos e 2 netos,Vive Ate então com o seu marido , mais dois netos e três filhos. Em 1990 saiu de Chokwé para Maputo por causa da guerra,e nos meados de 1990 começou a vender diversos produtos como forma de obter o seu auto emprego para o sustento da sua familia. Em 1991 saiu de Maputo para Mafuiane continuando com o negócio,viu que o negocio era rentável dai pensou em ficar para o resto da vida com o marido e os filhos e assim fixarão-se definitivamente em Mafuiane. Em 2000 descobre uma cooperativa de créditos de nome G.G.L.S onde oferia 1800MT onde trabalhou durante 5 anos com eles. Conheceu a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA em 2006,atraves da dona Isaura,dai aproximou se para melhor imformar se sobre os nossos serviços,tendo solicitado pela primeira vez um empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00MT.Findo o pagamento do primeiro credito pediu mais um valor de 16000MT referente a compra de material para electrificar a casa. Sustenta o empréstimo com a ajuda do marido e dos filhos, assim como com os rendimentos do seu negocio. Futuramente pretende ter um empréstimo no valor de 20000MT referente a compra de material de construção para fazer ac

loans.use: To buy material to build a house for the family

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mr. S. El is 65 years old and his wife Mrs. Tres Sio is 56 years old. The couple got married in 1979 and have 3 daughters. El and his family are currently in the fishing business. He started his fishing business in 1979. His wife helps him with selling fish in the local village. They both did not finish primary school. All of his daughters are married and help with the fishing too.

This is Mr S.'s first loan with MAXIMA. He will use this $500 loan to purchase fishing nets and a new fisher boat.

loans.use: Purchasing fishing net and one boat for fishing.

loans.name: Virginia Benzane

texts.pt:
Virgínia Benzane Xirindza is a 40-year-old married mother of five. She was born on January 24, 1967, in the district of Namaacha, Maputo province, and lived with her parents until the age of 18. She attended school only until the 6th grade due to her family's financial situation.

She met her husband in 1985 and moved in with her mother-in-law in the Massaca neighborhood, where she busied herself solely with the housework. The following year, she felt the need to obtain employment to help with the household expenses, so she worked as a domestic worker at a home in the city of Maputo for a year and a half.

In 1987, she and her husband purchased a parcel of land in the town of Boane. There they built a house and moved in a year later. Since then, she has devoted herself to money-making activities, specifically the sale of essential products. In 2006, she rented a space in the town of Boane where she continued to sell a variety of products.

Three months later, the owner decided to sell her the space. As she was determined to own her own business, she purchased it and operates from there to this day. Through some of her friends and neighbors who were Hluvuku clients, she came to know of this institution. She applied for her first loan of 30,000 MT in 2006 and repaid it without incident. With the loan of 15,000 MT she plans to increase stock. She currently employs one worker, thereby helping to reduce the high local unemployment rate. The profits from the business help her care for her family as well as cover expenses for her children’s school and healthcare.

This client’s business has had a positive impact on the community. The business is located in a passenger terminal, where she offers thirst-quenching refreshments to travelers and students. She also provides an appropriate environment where goods can be consumed under minimal hygienic conditions. In the future she aspires to acquire a mode of transportation to facilitate the acquisition of her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 03 Boane Cliente: Virgínia Benzane C. Actividade: Comercio Valor do Empréstimo: 15.000,00mt ( 600 usd) Aplicação: Compra de produtos para revenda Inicio: 05-11-07 Fim: 27-02-09 Virgínia Benzane Xirindza, casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos, com 40 anos de idade, nasceu a 24 de Janeiro de 1967 no distrito de Namaacha província de Maputo e viveu com os seus pais até aos 18 anos estudou até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira da família. Conheceu o marido em 1985 e passou a viver com sua sogra no bairro da Massaca, e ela só fazia trabalho domésticos, no ano seguinte sentiu-se obrigada a procurar emprego para ajudar nas despesas familiares, trabalhou como empregada domestica numa residência de um cooperante na cidade de Maputo durante 1 ano e meio. Em 1987 junto com o marido adquiriram uma parcela na vila de Boane construíram uma residência e um ano mais tarde passaram a nova residência. Desde então passou a dedicar-se a actividades de geração de rendimentos concretamente a venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade. Em 2006 alugou um estabelecimento na vila de Boane, continuou o se negocio vendendo variedades de produtos, passados 3 meses o proprietário decidiu vender lhe o estabelecimento, no entanto como estava decidida a ter emprego próprio comprou, e vem fazendo os seus negócios até hoje, com ajuda de amigos vizinhos clientes da Hluvuku teve conhecimento desta instituição, aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt em 2006 e pagou-o sem problemas. Com o crédito de 15.000.00mt pretende aumentar o stock dos produtos do seu negócio actualmente emprega 1 trabalhadora contribuindo para a reduçâo dos índices já elevados de desemprego.Com os rendimentos do negocio, suporta os encargos da família, as despesas escolares e de saúde dos seus filhos. A actividade desenvolvida por esta cliente tem um impacto na comunidade pois alivia os transportadores de passageiros, alunos para compra de refeições e matar a sede uma vez que as instalações estão localizadas na terminal de passageiro e cria cultura das pessoas consumirem em locais apropriados com mínimas condições de higiene. No futuro aspira ter uma viatura para melhor facilitar o movimento do seu negócio na aquisição dos produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Touch, who is 52 years old, married her husband Mr. Mok Veng in 1980. They have 5 children. Currently, Touch and her husband run a business selling dessert, raising pigs, and growing rice. She started her business in 1995. Two of her children are married and the youngest works in a garment factory. Touch and her husband did not manage to complete primary school.

This $500 loan is Mrs Touch's first loan. She will use this money to purchase 4 piglets, feed for pigs, and some rice.

loans.use: Purchasing 4 piglets, feed for pigs, and to grow rice

loans.name: Truy

texts.en:
Mr. C. Truy and his wife Mrs. Pov Kimloin got married in 1991 and have two sons and a daughter. All three of their children attend school. The couple has been raising pigs and brewing rice wine since 2000. Besides raising pigs and brewing rice’s wine, Truy also grows rice. Truy and his wife were not able finish primary school.

This is Mr C.'s first loan from MAXIMA. Heis requesting $1,000 to purchase 2 pigs, repair the existing pigpen and grow rice.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 pigs, repairing pigpen, and growing rice.

loans.name: Avelino Cadeira

texts.pt:
Location: Picoco Client: Avelino Cadeira M. Business Sector: Construction Loan Amount: 12.500,00 (500,00US$) Loan Use: Construction Material Purchase Start Date: 10/15/07 End Date: 02/06/09

Avelino Cadeira M. was born in Meluco, a province of Cabo Delgado. He lived with his parents until he as 13 years old. At the age of 14, in 1975, he was drafted by the Frelimo and sent to the Chingueia military base in Nampula. In 1976 he went to Boane, a year later he was sent to Chicualacuala where he stayed until 1982. He was released in 1986 from his batallion and returned to Cabo Delgado. In 1990 he decided to move to Maputo. In 1991 he started workin for Sosep Oil, a private security company, as a supervisor for customs affairs. In that same year he got his first loan from a new bank. He became aware of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA in 2006 through Mr. Matola Regulo from Boane, and he decided to make contact and ask for his first loan, which was used to purchase construction material. He had no difficulties making the payments. This time he is requesting another loan in the amount of 12.500,00MT that will be used to purchase additional construction material to finish up his job. In the future he wishes to build a small retail store for basic need goods and a place where he can raise chicks.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Avelino Cadeira M., nasceu em Meluco, pronvícia de Cabo Delgado, cresceu e viveu com os pais até os 13 anos. Em 1975, com 14 anos foi capturado pela Frelimo para a base de Chingueia, na provincial de Nampula como militar, em 1976 esteve em Boane, em 1977 em Chicualacuala até 1982. Em 1986 sai de tropa e regressa a Cabo Delgado, onde decidiu regressar a Maputo em 1990 . Em 1991 começa a trabalhar numa empresa de segurança sosep coil como supervisor do projecto das alfândegas. Teve o seu primeiro empréstimo com o Banco novo que oferecia créditos individuais. Conheceu a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA em 2006, através do senhor Matola regulo de Boane, e daí aproximou-se solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo nesta instituição referente a compra de material de construção e pagou-o sem problemas. Veio novamente solicitar um outro empréstimo no valor de 12.500,00MT referente a compra de material de construção para concluir a sua obra. Futuramente pretende construir um pequeno estabelecimento para a venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e um pavilhão de capoeiras para a criação de pintos.

loans.use: To buy material to build his house for the family

payments.comment: Avelino decided to finish the loan as soon as possible. Therefore he made a second larger payment this month.

Avelino has successfully made a final payment and finished his loan. Avelino would like to ask for a new loan in order to pursue his dream of building his house.

He would like to personally thank Kiva and especially all his lenders for the support given to his house construction.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en:
Mr. Van Savuth got married in 1982 and has 6 children: five sons and one daughter. His father taught him construction skills and he started his own business in 1987. He is a construction contractor and his wife stays at home to take care of their children. One of his son works as a construction worker with him and his daughter works in a garment factory while the other sons are in school. Savuth and his wife finished just primary school.

Mr Van has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. He is now requesting a $1,000 loan to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thouk got married in 1976 and has four children: two daughters and two sons. She learned to weave silk from her parents in 1966 and started her silk production production in the same year. Her husband growns rice and food crops in the village. One of her sons is a blacksmith and one of her daughters weaves silk while other two children are married.

Mrs V. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. She is now requesting a $300 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Soeun and her husband Mr. Chan Mov got married in 1976 and have seven children: three daughters and four sons. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1971 and started her own silk production business in the same year. Her husband builds wooden houses and also grows rice and food crops in the village. One of her sons weaves silk and one of her daughters is studying, while the other five children are married.

Mrs S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times prior to this. She is now requesting a $200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread,  paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar K. is 44 years old, he is college educated, is married and has four children. He is currently receiving a pension and at the same time is working as a chef. Safar has been raising, feeding and selling large and small horned domesticated animals for 2 years in his home, in his village Dastgirak in the Yavan region.

Safar plans to use this loan to purchase 3 large animals and their feed. After 40-45 days of feeding them, Safar sells the animals and uses his revenues to purchase new animals; he uses the profits to support his family. By taking out a loan he will be able to increase his earnings and the loan will also give local butchers the opportunity to purchase animals for slaughter and to supply meat products to local residents. Safar plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Сафар, возраст – 44 года, образование высшее, женат, имеет 4-х детей, в настоящий момент находится на пенсии и одновременно работает шеф – поваром в Обществе с Ограниченной Ответственностью «Чжунда». Сафар уже в течение 2-х лет занимается разведением, откормкой и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота у себя дома в кишлаке Дастгирак Яванского района. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. Через 40-45 дней после откормки Сафар продает купленный ранее скот, на вырученные деньги приобретает новый молодняк, а полученную прибыль направляет на содержание своей семьи. Получив кредит он во-первых сможет увеличить свой доход, во-вторых даст возможность местным мясникам приобретать упитанный скот и поставлять жителям района мясные продукты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of horned animals

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Aun and her husband Pich Thach got married in 1979 and have eight children: six daughters and two sons. She learned to weave silk from a neighbor in 2004 and started her own silk production business in the same year. Her husband is a fisherman. Two of her daughters also weave silk, one son is a security guard, two are married and the rest are still in school.

Mrs D. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. She is now requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy a new loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Alzira Salvador

texts.pt:
Location: Zone 7 Client: Alzira Salvador Sitoe Business Sector: Retail Loan Amount: 13.000,00 (US$520.00) Loan Use: Clothing Purchase and Retail

Alzira Salvador Sitoe was born on August 20th, 1974 in the city of Maputo. In 1992 she met her husband with whom she has had 6 children. She lived with her parents until the age of 18 and, due to financial hardship, she only attended school until the fifth grade. In 1993 she launched and witnessed her small business venture fail caused by complications she faced with her first pregnancy. She then decided to look for a financial institution willing to help. She first borrowed money from the Associação Gueguegue (Gueguegue Association) located in Boane, which offered credit to group applicants. It turned out not to be a good experience because the amount granted was smaller than the amount requested and she had to be responsible for the payments in case one of the other partners defaulted. She became aware of Hluvuku-Adsema existence through a friend and because she wanted to expand her business, she requested her first loan. The loan amount of 13.000,00MT will be used to increase stock inventory. Currently, she is running her business with help from her husband. Her children help around also anytime they are unable to be present. The profit generated is used to cover household expenses such as school costs and health care for her children. Her business has a positive impact in the community because it provides employment to herself and her husband and also it brings needed products closer to customers. In the future she intends to open up a new location under her name.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Alzira Salvador Sitoe,casada maritalmente ,tem 6 filhos ,tem 34 anos de idade ,nasceu a 20 de Agosto de 1974 na cidade de Maputo ,viveu e creceu com os seus pais ate 18 anos de idade ,estudou ate 5ªclasse devido a fragilidade da situçao financeira da família . Conheceu o seu marido em 1992 . Em 1993 comecou a exercer um pequeno negocio pessoal de venda de produtos da 1ªnecessidade e no mesmo ano teve a sua 1ª gravidez onde devido a complicações da mesma viu o seu negocio fracassar e decidiu recorrer a uma organização financeira. Teve o seu 1º contacto de empréstimo com Associação Gueguegue localizada dentro de Boane que oferecia créditos em grupos ,não tendo sido boa experiência porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir a responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em caso de um dos elementos não efectuar o pagamento . Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através da amiga e dai aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Com este empréstimo de 13.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o stock de produtos do seu negocio . Actualmente esta explorando um estabelecimento junto com o marido .Eles dirigem pessoalmente e na sua ausencia os filhos é que tem tomado conta do mesmo ,com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta os encargos familiares, desde despesas escolares e de saúde para os seus filhos. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria mais o marido colocam o produto mais perto do cliente . No futuro pretemde abrir um outro estabelecimento próprio em nome dela.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale

loans.name: Kurbonhol

texts.ru:
Kurbonhol S. is 65 years old, he is college educated and is an agronomist by profession. He is married, has 6 children and is currently receiving a pension. Kurbonhol owns a business that sells food. He has transformed part of his house into a store that is located in Beshkapa village in the Yavan region. The store is open 24 hours a day.

Kurbonhol plans to use his loan to increase his inventory and product selection. The loan will help the residents of the village and nearby areas to purchase necessary food items as the closest stores are several kilometers away, closer to the center of the region and close around 5pm. Kurbonhol plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Курбонхол, возраст – 65 года, образование высшее, по специальности – агроном, женат, имеет 6-х детей, в настоящий момент находится на пенсии. Курбонхол имеет торговую точку по продаже продуктов питания. Для этого он переделал часть одну часть своего дома под магазин, который находится в кишлаке Бешкаппа Яванского района. Магазин работает круглосутосчно. На полученный кредит клиент планирутет увеличить товарооборот, а увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Данный кредит поможет жителям этого кишлака и близлежащих районов приобретать необходимые им продукты питания, так как близлежащий магазин находится на рассточние нескольких километров, ближе к центру района, которые закрываютя около 17:00 вечера. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product inventory

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Sopheak and her husband, Mr. Pi Bunthoeun, got married in 1999 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Two of their children attend the primary school in the village. Sopheak opened her own grocery store in 2004. Her husband is a construction worker who picked up the trade from his brother. Besides construction work, he also fishes.

Mrs T. is requesting a $300 loan from MAXIMA, her second loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her store so that she can expand her grocery business.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling grocery iterms at her store

loans.name: Sokphoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Sokphoeun and her husband Mr. Pun Sothea married in 1997 and have four daughters. She learned to weave silk from a relative in 1998 and started her silk production business in the same year. Her husband has been teaching in the local junior high school since 1992. Two of Sokphoeun’s daughters are studying in primary school and other two as yet too young to attend school.

Sokphoeun has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times alreaD.. She is now requesting a $400 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Nurali S. is 22 years old and has a secondary education. Nurali owns a business at the Tidzhorat market in Yavan. He has been selling fabrics for women’s clothing for 8 years. Nurali plans to use the loan to purchase new kinds of fabric for making autumn, ethnic, women’s clothing.

Because ethnic fabrics are in demand in Tajikistan, the residents of the Yavan region will be able to purchase fabrics at the local market without having to leave their city and the prices will be comparable to those at the wholesale market in Dushanbe, which is 80 kilometers away and where Nurali travels to purchase his products. Nurali plans to pay the loan back over an 8 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Саидов Нурали, возраст – 22 лет, образование среднее. Саидов Нурали имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Бизнес которым он занимается уже в течение 8 лет – это продажа тканей для пошимва женской одежды. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый вид тканей для пошива осенней женской национальной одежды. Так как в Республике Таджикистан большим спросом пользуются ткани национального характера, жители данного района смогут приобретать ткани на местном рынке, не выезжая за пределы города, при этом цены на ткани почти схожие с ценами на оптовом рынке в городе Душанбе, находящийся на расстояние 80 км, где производит закуп товара Саидов Нурали. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal products

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mr. P. Vanny is 44 years old and his wife Mrs. Ros Yan is 38 years old. The couple was married in 1989 and have 3 daughters and 3 sons. Vanny is currently in the fishing business. He also makes Prohok (a kind of Cambodian dish made from fish) that he sells in the market. He started his fishing business in 1989. His wife assists him with selling fish and prohok, raising pigs and growing rice in the village. They both attended but did not complete primary school.

Vanny has borrowed money from MAXIMA thrice. He is now requesting a $1,100 loan to purchase a machine that produces prohok to help boost his sales.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce Prohok (a kind of Cambodian dish made from fish)

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.ru:
Oltinoy H. is 49 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 4 children. She sells children’s clothing and shoes. Oltinoy sells her products at two markets in the Yavan regions – “Panchshanbe” and “Shurcha,” where trading happens once a week and residents of the entire Yavan region and nearby regions travel.

Oltinoy plans to use the loan to purchase winter children’s clothing. Because the markets where Oltinoy trades attracts a lot of people and the products there have lower prices then those at the central markets of the regions, Oltinoy will be able to offer childern’s clothing and shoes to shoppers at lower prices. She plans to pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Олтиной, возраст – 49 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Занимается торговлей детскими вещами и обувью. Торгует на двух рынках Яванского района – «Панчшанбе» и «Шурча», торговля на которых проводится один раз в неделю, но на них съежаются жители всего Яванского и близлежайщих районов. Торгует два раза в неделю на этих рынках. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести зимний ассортимент детской одежды. Так как в дни торговли на эти рынки съезжается большое количество людей и товар здесь предлагают по ценам ниже, чем на центральных рынках района, Олтиной увеличив свой товар даст возможность всем посетителям рынка, которые приехали за покупкой детских вещей и обуви приобрести ее по более низким ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing and shoes

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Korng is 52 years old and her husband Mr. Chem Chhin is 54 years old. The couples was married in 1977 and have seven children: 3 daughters and 4 sons. Korng operates a business selling snacks in her village and doing farming work with her husband. Besides farming, her husband also plays classical Khmer music with his band in the village. They have both never attended school.

This is Korng's first loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $1,000 to buy a bull to help plough ricefields.

loans.use: Buy a bull to help plough the soil

loans.name: Sophallin

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sophallin got married in 1989 and has one daughter and three sons. She is currently in the business of selling custard apples. She buys custard apples from her district and resells them in a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does construction work , grows rice, and raises chickens and pigs. With these businesses, the couple has been able to support their children's education and pay for a new house to be built. She is in the process of building her new house and is short of money to finish it.

She is therefore seeking her first loan from MAXIMA, for about $1,200, with which to complete her house.

loans.use: Repairing her house.

loans.name: Sadbargul

texts.ru:
Sadbargul K. is 41 years old, has a secondary education is married and has 4 children. Sadbargul has a sales point at one of the markets in Yavan, “Tichorat.” She sells wedding supplies, including ethnic wedding dresses and accessories. She will use the loan to purchase new products.

Sadbargul purchases products in Dushanbe from private manufacturers. She has been in this business for 9 years. Wedding season starts in the spring and those getting ready for weddings start purchasing items 3-4 months according to local custom. By purchasing products for sale, Sadbargul will provide a selection of wedding products for her clients in their own region. She plans to pay the loan back over an 8 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Комилова Садбаргул, возраст – 41 год, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Садбаргул имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Явана под названием «Тичорат». Вид товара который она продает это свадебные принадлежности, которые включают в себя национальные свадебные платья и аксессуары к ним. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе у частных производителей. Данным видом деятельности клиентка занимается уже в течение 9 лет. Так как весной начинается пора свадеб, тот кто готовится к этому мероприятию начинают приобратать необходимые вещи для свадеб за 3-4 месяцев вперед, согласно национальным обычаем. Приобретя новый товар на полученный кредит для жителей данного района будет существовать выбор при покупке свадебнных принадлежностей, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего района. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product offering

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Saroeun got married in 1982 and has two daughters and four sons. Saroeun has never attended school.She is currently in the business of selling food and beverages in the evening, a business she began in 1987. She is currently in the process of rebuilding her small restaurant but is short of money to finish it. Her husband is a marine.

This is Mrs Saroeun's first loan from MAXIMA. She hopes touse the $1,100 she is requesting to finish building her restaurant.

loans.use: Rebuilding a small restaurant.

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Phall and her husband Mr. Phoung Phat got married in 1985 and have five children; one daughter and four sons. She learned to weave silk from a relative in 2003 and started her silk production that year itself. Her husband fishes, grows rice, and rears cattle.

Mrs Phall has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. She is now requesting a $200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru:
Sanovbar N. is 32 years old, has a secondary education and 1 child. Sanovbar works at a market in Nurek, “Farovon,” where she sells salads, vegetables, marinated vegetables and fabrics for making women’s clothing. She has been in this business for 8 years. Sanovbar plans to use the loan to purchase fabrics for autumn ethnic clothing and to temporarily stop selling vegetables which require travel to the Dushanbe market which is too expensive. She will continue to sell salads and marinated vegetables, because she has regular customers for these.

Because residents of Nurek mostly work at the Nurek Hydro Electricity Station they cannot always travel to Dushanbe to make purchases. This loan will allow the residents of Nurek, specifically women to purchase fabric to make women’s ethnic clothing which is in high demand. Sanovbar plans to repay the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нозимова Сановбар, возраст – 32 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Сановбар имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Нурека под названием «Фаровон», где занимается продажей салатов, овощей, солений и женского материала для пошива одежды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Та как наступил сезон осенней одежды, Сановбар на полученный кредит хочет приобрести ткани для пошива осенней национальной одежды, временно приостановить продажу только овощей, так как за ними надо ездить в город Душанбе и это ей обходится слишком дорого. Торговля салатами и соленьями будет продолжаться, так как у неё есть постоянные клиенты Так как в данном городе жители в основном работают на Нурекской Гидроэлектростанции, они не всегда имеют возможность выехать в город Душанбе за необходимыми покупками. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям данного города, а в именно женщинам приобрести необходимый материал для пошива женской национальной одежды пользующийся большим спросом у местного населения. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mok and her husband Mr. Mut Moen got married in 1979. They have five children: two daughters and three sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in2000 and started her silk production business in the same year. She has never attended primary school, while her husband, who began, did not graduate from primary school. Her husband grows rice and raises cattle.

This is Mrs K. Mok's first loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $500 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay for fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Sayfullo

texts.ru:
Sayfullo A., 50, is married and has 5 children. He sells fruits and vegetables on one of the markets of Dushanbe. Sayfullo has been in business for 5 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of fruits and vegetables. Sayfullo A. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Сайфулло, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Сайфулло занимается продажей овощами и фруктами на одном из рынков в городе Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести большее количество овощей и фруктов для дальнейшей их реализации. Так как клиент торгует в самом городе Душанбе, столице Республики Таджикистан, он даст возможнодсть жителям города приобретать свежие овощи фрукты по более низким ценам и получать необходимое количество витаминов, так необходимое в зимнее время. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sokheang and her husband, Mr. Ny Neang, got married in 2000 and have two daughters. They are now in the business of producing silk, raising pigs and reselling piglets. In 1999, Sokheang learned form her neighbor how to weave silk and started her own silk production in the same year. Her husband grows rice and raises pigs. Both she and her husband have not attended primary school.

This $500 loan is Mrs Sokheang's third loan from MAXIMA. She will use this loan to purchase piglets for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing piglets for resale

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sokheang Srun has been pay off her loan early before contract and  requesting a new loan from Maxima for expending her business of raising pigs.

Thank you verry much.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Khom and her husband Mr. Ches Toeun got married in 1999. They have two children, one daughter and one son.  In 1997, Mrs K. Khom learned from her neighbor how to weave silk and started her own silk production that year. She has finished primary school but her husband, who is a construction worker, never attended school.

This $300 loan will be Mrs K. Khom's second loan from MAXIMA. She will use the loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread as well as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Khom Khoun has pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sangali

texts.ru:
Sangali F., 47, is married and has 4 children. Sangali has been engaged in cattle farming for 3 years. He lives in the village Muramshokhi, Yavansky region. Cattle farming is Sangali’s main source of income. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 animals, raise and sell them with a profit. Most of Sangali’s customers are butchers, who come to his village to purchase cattle at a lower price. Sangali F. plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзов Сангали, возраст – 47 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сангали занимается разведением и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Живёт в кишлаке Мирамшохи Яванского района. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота. Так как основной доход получаемый им это доход от продажи скота, он планирует на полученный кредит приобрести несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и после его откорма продавать его через каждые 40-45 дней. Большая часть его покупателей эти мясники которые приезжают из города для закупа скота по более низким ценам и дальнейшей его реализации в качестве мясных и молочных продуктов жителям городской черты не имеющим место для содержания скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of cattle

loans.name: Akobirdgon

texts.ru:
Akobirdgon A., 30, is married and has 2 children. Akobirdgon has a college degree in biochemistry. Akobirdgon’s primary job is managing a biochemistry lab at the Yavana city hospital. In addition, Akobirdgon has a cattle farm at his home in the village of Kambari. Akobirdgon plans to use this loan to purchase 3 animals, so he can raise and sell them later on. Akobirdgon has been in farming business for 3 years. Every 40-45 days, he sells raised cattle and uses the money to buy new animals at lower prices. Akobirdgon uses the profits to provide for his family, because the money he earns at the hospital is not enough to sustain his family. He plans to repay the loan with 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Алифов Акобирджон, возраст – 30 лет, образование высшее по специальности – химик – биолог, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Основным видом деятелльности. Которым занимается Акобир это работа в городской больнице Явана, на должности заведующий лабаротирей. Помимо этого он, также у себя дома в кишлаке Камбари, занимается разведением мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота для его откорма и продажи. Клиент имеет 3 года опыта в этом виде деятельности. Через каждые 40-45 дней, по воскресеньям и субботам, он продаёт откормленный скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретает новый по более низкой цене, тем самым увеличивая поголовье своего скота. Прибыль полученную от продажи он использует на содержание своей семьи, так как получаемая заработная плата маленькая и её не хватает на месяц. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of cattle

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif M., 36, is married and has 4 children. For 3 years, he has been selling clothing for children. His sales spot is located at the Vahdatsky region’s market. Sharif plans to use this loan to purchase new inventory of winter clothing. Sharif is one of the few vendors, who sell children’s clothing at the market, so to remain competitive; Sharif must sell at or below competitors’ prices. Sharif plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Миров Шариф, возраст – 36 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Шариф занимается торговлей детских вещей уже в течение 3 лет. Свой бизнес он ведёт на рынке Вахдатского орайона где имеет торговую точку. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый товар детской одежды для зимнего сезона, так как начинается пора холодов. На рынке где торгует клиент не так уж много торговых точек по продаже детской одежды. И чтобы быть конкурентноспособным Шариф хочет приобрести большое количество товара и реализовать его по цене ниже чем у других поставщиков, что даст ему возможность увеличить оборачиваемость своих товаров. а жители района смогут приобрести необходимые им детские вещи по ценам чуть ниже, чем у других. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
Nemat M., 53, is married and has 2 children. Nemat owns a sales location at “Korvon,” a large market in Dushanbe. For 2 years, he has been selling clothing for women. Nemat plans to use this loan to purchase new inventory of goods including winter clothing and shoes for children. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоев Немат, возраст – 53 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Имеет торговую точку на одном из крупных рынков города Душанбе под названием «Корвон». Товар которым он торгует – это женские вещи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товра, а именно зимние детские вещи и обувь. Так как на этом базаре люди в основном покупают товар большими пратиями, так как сюда съезжаются за покупками жители почти всего Таджикистана, они будут иметь возможность приобрести большое количество товра, для того чтобы потом продавать его в своих районах, тем самым получая прибыль и давая возможносьть местным приобретать необходимые им детские вещи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Mahmadsoleh

texts.ru:
Mahmadsoleh I., 45, is married and has 4 children. Mahmadsoleh has been in business for 13 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase additional inventory. Mahmadsoleh has a sales location at the central market of Khuroson, about 60 km from Dushanbe. Mahmadsoleh I. plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Искандаров Махмадсолех, возраст – 45 лет, образование высшее, женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадсолех занимается этим бизнесом в течение 13 лет. На полученный кредит Махмадсолех планирует закупить дополнительно новый товар. Данный район находится в 60 км от города Душанбе, куда в основном ездиют жители района за покупками. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке Хуроссонского района. Закупив большее количество продаваемого ассортимента продуктов питания жители данного получат возможность приобретать необходимые им продукты питания на местном рынке по умеренным ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current stock

loans.name: Amirhamza

texts.ru:
Amirhamza S., 28, owns a taxi car. He drives it for 2 years servicing the residents of Dushanbe. At present, his car runs on gas, but, with gas prices rising every month, Amirhamza plans to use this loan to convert his car to run on natural gas. He plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайдалиев Амирхамза, возраст – 28 лет, образование среднее. Амирхамза имеет собственный автомобиль на котором уже в теченние 2-х летзанимается оказанием услуг такси для жителей города Душанбе. На полученный кредит Амирхамза хочет купить и установить на своё автотранспортное средство газовое оборудование. Так как цены на бензин постоянно растут это негативно сказывается на его бизнесе, так как постоянно приходится поднимать цену за проезд, что вызывает недовольство у пассажировю. Установив газовое оборудование, жители города передвигающиеси на такси получат возможность это делать по приемлемам ценам, а Амирхамза будет предоставлять свои услуги , каждый раз объясняя клиенту почему повысилась цена за проезд. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Sobirdgon

texts.ru:
Sobirdgon K., 23, is married. Sobirdgon sells clothing for children and shoes for women and children at the newly-built market “Balakh” in Rudaky region. Sobirdgon plans to use the loan to purchase an assortment of goods to attract more customers. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонов Собирджон, возраст – 23 лет, образование среднее, женат. Клиент имеет торговую точку на рынке «Балх» района Рудаки, который был построен несколько месяцев назад. Продаваемый товар это детские вещи, калоши, женская и детская обувь. На полученный кредит Собирджон хочет приобрести большее количество продаваемого товар. Так как рынок новый и количество посетителей данного нового рынка незначительное, он хочет увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, тем самым привлечь внимание покупателей к этому рынку, а именно к своему магазину. Данный кредит поможет жителям близлежащих домов расположенных с этим рынком приобретать необходимые им товары, так как большой аналогичный рынок находится за чертой города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and buy bicycles for sale

loans.name: Manama

texts.en:
K. Manama is a 35-year-old dynamic woman. Manama is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Manama has been selling fabric and clothes for more than 10 years. She learned the business from her mother and started selling her own fabric when she joined her husband in Sassandra.

Manama is ambitious and wants to have her own income in order to be more independent from her husband and take care of the education expenses of her children. She did not have opportunity to go to school. Her life’s goal is to give her children the opportunity to get a university education, which she was denied.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
D. Mariam lives with her family in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Mariam is married and the mother of 3 children. She is 34 years old. Mariam sells plastic products, such as plastic buckets, baskets, and bowls.

Mariam's husband is a fisherman and his income is very dependent on the fishing season. Mariam is then the main provider for her family, and she pays the education expenses of her children.She is proud of her children, who all go to school. She is a energetic and a hard worker, and is an active member of the local women's trade association.

loans.use: Purchase plastic goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more khat stock.

loans.name: Nan Julie

texts.en:
Nan Julie G. sells cosmetics in the market of Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest coast of Côte d'Ivoire. She has been in the cosmetic business for many years. Julie wants to expand her business and purchase cosmetics in bulk from sellers in Abidjan and resell the cosmetics in Sassandra. This will increase her profit margin and her revenue.

Julie's income from this business supports her family. Her handicapped husband is no longer able to contribute to household expenses. Her younger children are in grammar school, and Julie must pay their education expenses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products in bulk to resell

loans.name: Mme Elise

texts.en:
G. Elise is a dynamic and ambitious 32-year-old woman. G. has a well known beauty salon in the town center in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest coast of Côte d'Ivoire. This period of the year, with the celebrations of Aid El Kebir, Christmas, and New Year, is the busiest time and generates the most revenue for her. Elise wants to replenish the stock of new fashion hair and skin products in her beauty salon to offer better-quality services to her clients and increase her revenue.

Mme G. is married and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Sassandra. Her children all go to school and she contributes significantly to the education and the household expenses.

loans.use: Replenish the stock in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Basilia Guerrero

texts.en:
Basilia is 57 years old, married, with two daughters and one son. The elder daughter has married and lives with her own family. The other daughter and the son are respectively 15 and years old. Basilia dedicates herself to the sales of silver-plated jewels. Her husband works in a construction company. She sells her goods from home and sometimes by visiting women in the community door-to-door. Basilia hopes in the future she’ll be able to open her own jewelery shop so as to allow customers to make the purchase handily.

With her loan, she will buy a large amount of jewels to sell at low prices during the Christmas period. That way, the entrepreneur will increase her income and attract new clients.

loans.use: Purchase of silver-plated jewels to supply her business

loans.name: Juana Mosquea

texts.en:
Juana sells women’s clothing and gold-filled and silver-plated jewels.

Juana is 40 years old and has three children, two girls and a boy, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a skycap in the international airport of Santo Domingo, the capital. Juana sells her merchandise in La Romana and Bávaro, two high tourist provinces of the country.

The entrepreneur hopes she can expand her business operation. She needs funds to purchase large amounts of merchandise so that she can satisfy more customers’ needs and increase her income. That way, she will be able to keep on running the business and have money enough to take care of her children

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk and jewels to supply business.

loans.name: Polonia Dominguez

texts.en:
Polonia is a 34-year-old single mother of four children, three boys and a girl. They all are above the age of fifteen and attend school. Since her separation from her husband, ten years ago, she has supported herself and her offspring by selling women’s used clothing in her community.

She says that this activity has been very profitable and has helped her contribute to the well-being of her family. But every day other needs arise which must be satisfied. She hopes to someday to sell the clothes from her own store and not have to operate business at home or a public place.

With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk in order to limit number of trips she has to make outside of her community. That way, she will increase her sales volume and improve her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk in order to increase sales volume and income.

loans.name: Francisca Franco

texts.en:
Francisca is a 24-year-old mother of two children and she dedicates herself, together with her husband, to the sales of fish. She has been running that business for more than one year.

Weekly, Francisca’s husband goes Santo Domingo, the capital, to buy the fish in a fish shop. In the house, they have a freezer to preserve the fish. Francisca sells the goods from home, while her husband sells in the streets. Actually, the entrepreneur buys a small amount of fish since she doesn’t have a very spacious freezer. She hopes she can get a used one before long.

The entrepreneur would like to add new products to her business. Her plan is to use her loan and buy many kinds of shellfish so that she can diversify her inventory and satisfy and attract more clients.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of shellfish to introduce to her fish selling business.

loans.name: Marina Santana

texts.en:
Marina is a 44-year-old mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She sells gold-filled jewels such as earrings, bracelets, anklets, rings and so forth. She sells women’s shoes too. Her two children attend school.

Bi-weekly, Marina has to travel to Santo Domingo or Elías Piña, a frontier province with Haiti, to get the goods at very low prices. She retails them in her community and she says that until now she has managed to obtain profits and put aside money for her children’s needs.

With her loan, Marina hopes to invest in more jewels and shoes. She also wants to use the Christmas period to buy some women’s slippers which she would sell at special prices. That way, the entrepreneur will increase her sales volume and make her business known by many more people.

loans.use: To buy large amounts of women's slippers and jewels to buy during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Yusetty Ventura

texts.en:
Yusetty is a very congenial and positive 25-year-old woman.  She has three children and is pregnant.  For more than ten years, her husband and she have been running a general store.  Currently, she sells vegetables, ripe fruits, bread, milk, chocolate, rice, beans and other basic foodstuffs.  She would like to expand her inventory and include energy drinks, bath soap, toothpaste and other similar items after receiving her loan. 
The entrepreneur thinks that the business expansion will help her greatly and she will better help her husband support the family.

loans.use: To buy energy drinks, bath soap, toothpaste and other goods to introduce in her general store.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita dedicates herself to the sale of toasted bread, natural juices and sandwiches, a business which she started more than four years ago. Mercedita is 37 years old and has three children (two boys and a girl). Her husband works in a construction company. She gets raw materials in her town and doesn’t buy fruits since her husband has a field and cultivates various types of fruits.

Mercedita’s dream is to have a cafeteria. She plans to remodel a room of her house to convert it into the cafeteria. She had put aside money to invest in the remodel and will sell a cow she has in order to have money to finish off the work. She needs funds to help her cover the costs that the work requires. Once her locale is ready, Mercedes will see her business change radically. She will more easily sell off the food and she will get more clients, so she will significantly increase her income and will better support her family.

loans.use: Invest to remodel a room of her house in order to run her small cafeteria.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and her two children. Her partner is a farmer. Shortly after becoming pregnant, Alexandra left her parents' house to go to live with her partner. She says that they have difficulty making ends meet. Her partner’s income is not enough to bear all the expenses of a young couple with two children.

Alexandra decided to make a change in her family’s life. She has requested credit to start a small business. She plans to sells natural juices and sandwiches. She will operate the business in a public place and will sell in the morning when people go to school and to work.

That activity will most certainly be successful because people who work in the community get up early in the morning to go to their job and don’t have time to prepare food, and it is usual to eat sandwiches in the morning and at lunch.

Alexandra hopes she will get the loan before long so she will be able to face her economic issues and improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: Funds will be invested to buy raw materials to prepare natural juices and sandwiches.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 27 years old he is married and has 2 children, one of whom is going to school. His mother and father are living with him. He has a snack shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new ice box and new goods, and expand his project by renovating the shop, painting it, and hiring one unemployed person to help him in the shop to increase his income.

This entrepreneur is from a volatile region, and this loan may present a higher repayment risk. Lenders should be aware of this fact when deciding to lend.

To protect the identity of this entrepreneur, their name has been modified and their image in the photograph has been obscured.

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and new goods

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old, married and has one daughter. Ahmed sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business six years ago and works very hard to improve his business and his family's standard of living. He is requesting a loan fo $1000 to purchase more stock. This will allow him to service more customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid T. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old, married and has one son. Khalid rented a small café a few years ago, and started his own restaurant business a few years ago. He has worked very hard to build a clientele, and now is ready to expand. He is requesting a loan of $400 to invest in new tables and chairs for his cafe, so he can serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy new eqiupment

loans.name: Velyeddin

texts.en: Velyeddin G. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. Velyeddin is engaged in sheep-breeding. He established this business ten years ago. He is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more sheep. This will enable him to increase his flock and their gene pool, and will improve the sheep he offers for sale.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep

loans.name: Aligismet

texts.en: Aligismet A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. He engaged in taxi service in Beylagan City. Aligismet must keep his taxi in good working condition, so he is requesting a loan of $500 to bring his vehicle up-to-date with service and repairs.

loans.use: For vehicle repairs

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan. Now she is settled with her husband and two children in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. They are engaged in cattle-breeding. Maleyka wants to increase the number of her cows. She needs a $500 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan. He is now settled  with his mother, wife and two children in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He has a low income. Taleh is engaged in the cattle-breeding business. He needs a loan in the amount of $500. Taleh will use this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en: Jalil A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 53 years old, married and has four children. Jalil owns a small kiosk where he sells spare parts. He started his business five years ago. Jalil wants to built a new store, therefore he needs a loan in amount of $800.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en: Sattar A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 22 years old and is single. He rented a small store in the city center and is engaged in clothing sales there. He sells women's clothes. Sattar needs a loan in the amount of $300 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar A. is engaged in a sheep-breeding business with his father. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 22 years old and is single. He started his business two years ago. Anar wants to increase the number of his sheep. He needs $300 to buy three sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sakhavet

texts.en: Sakhavet M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 38 years old and is single. Sakhavet is a taxi driver. He carries passengers to the city center everyday. He borrowed two loans from Nomicro Beylagan Branch and repaid them on time. Now he needs another loan in the amount of $400.
